elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver. Due from the head of the Egibi family. In addition to silver that had been transferred to the debtor to pay for work (dullu) at a canal.
B should pay 2 minas of white, medium quality of silver which is unmarked and of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him to A in Addar (XII) in Babylon. It comes in addition to (adi) the previous debt (u'iltu) of 1 1/2 minas of silver which had been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to pay for the work (dullu) at the King’s Canal to Elam. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Tattannu/Rēmūtu; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Summons to transmit crops from the land of the Treasurer, and to arrange for their proper registration.
Concerns 170 kor of barley, 4 kor of wheat, and 4 kor of cress (sahlû), the harvest (ebūru) of the 11th year from the Treasurer's field (eqlu ša E ganzabaru).
A is held accountable for the proper registration of these products in his (boss') accounts, but something went wrong and the Treasurer's mayordomo (B) did not receive proof of registration. A shifts the blame to the two men whom B sent to him together with the products (C1 and C2). The story is recounted in the present document as follows. It opens with A's declaration (qabû umma) that the Treasurer's mayordomo wanted the products to be registered in his accounts (ina muhhi-ya ušuzzu) saying that he gave them to C1 and C2: they received from him the 170 kor of barley (in-da-har-in-ni [mahāru]), whereas only C2 (ana elat ana PN) was given the 4 kor of wheat and 4 kor of cress (at-ta-din [nadānu]). This is confirmed (kanû D) by the two men in their own testimony (eli ramāni-šunu) as follows (umma): they both took (našû) the barley from B, and only C1 received (mahāru) the wheat and cress from B. The document then stipulates that by the 20th of Ayyar (II) C1 and C2 should transmit?* the barley they received from B before A and give proof of it to B (dagālu Š-nadānu). Similarly, C2 shall register the wheat and cress he received from B in A's account(**) and give proof of it to B (ušuzzu-nadānu). D1 assumes warranty for C1. D2 assumes warranty for C2. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.

*L. 13: ú-šá-┌ad┐-[gil-ma]; (**) ina muhhi A for usual itti.

A=Nidintu, (rab bīti) of Iqīša; B=Erībaya/Ša-Nabû-šū, (rab bīti) of E; C1=Arad-Bāba/Mušēzib-Marduk//Ašlāku; C2=Šellibu/Iddin-Nabû; D1=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D2=Šulum-Bābili/Bēl-ahu-iddin; E=Bagasarū, (ganzabaru)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for rikis qabli.
A, by order of (ina qibi) C, receives payment (mahāru) from B for his rikis qabli duty. The amount, 1/3 mina and 5 shekels of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, is paid for serving in the King's army (ana alāki ana pāni šarri), which means that A will serve instead of B. The sum is in addition to (elat) the previously paid 3 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-iddin/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Ah-bani; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Murašû/Marduk-šumu-iddin//Ilu-tillatī
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Settlement of a silver debt through the sale of land and slaves to the creditor. Due from the head of the Egibi family. A previous house sale became void after the house had been seized by the Esagil temple.
B sold (ana kaspi nadānu) a plot of land including the house built on it (qanû bīt epšu) in Babylon’s Šu’anna-quarter to A, for 1 talent 4 minas and 14 shekels of silver, but later gave the house to the Esagil temple in order to settle one of his debts (apālu N). Consequently, A needs to be paid back the silver that he paid for the land and house. In the present document A receives (mahāru) 50 minas and 4 2/3 shekels of silver in capital and interest out of the total debt (u'iltu) of more than 1 talent. It is the value in silver of a plot of land planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) of 2 kor, land under cultivation (eqlu merēšu) of 4.3.2 kor and 10 slaves (amīlūtu) which B gave (= sold) to A. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 21 witnesses and the scribe. Sealed by the seller.

A=Anu-mukīn-apli/Anu-ahu-iddin//Ea-qâlu-išemme; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Renting of a boat to the head of the Egibi family.
A1 and A2 rent (ana idi nadānu) a boat to B for 1/3 minas of white, medium quality silver (as rent) and! 0;1.0 kor of flour for the (boat's) maintenance (kurummatu). The boat belongs to C, a slave of [PN], but is at A1's and A2's disposal for boat-service duty (malahūtu). The boat may (or: should?) sail to Bištu-ša-ṣēru’a, but should not pass the fortified settlement (birtu). The text continues with stipulating what happens if the boat passes the fortress, but the pertinent passage is badly preserved.

A1=Niqūdu/mx- x-iá; A2=Kalbi-Bāba/Iddinaya; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Iddin-Bēl, slave of …

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for transport costs. Undertaking to register the receipt in the accounts of the Governor of Babylon.
A, a man from Imbuka (lúim-bu-ku-a-a) courtier/clerk? of the [...]*, receives (mahāru) [3];2.0 kor of barley from B to cover the costs of transporting (gimru) a broken amount of either barley or dates(**). He acts as proxy (našpartu) for C, Governor of Babylon, and should register his receipt in the latter’s account; then he should give proof of it to B (ušuzzu -nadānu). The barley (or dates) that needs to be transported are D’s income from the collection of fixed rent (sūtu). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

*lúS[AG? ...] šá lúšá-di-emeš šálú┌x┐ [(x)]. Or read lúse-pir-ri] šá etc. ?
** 30[+x barley/dates].

A= Rušundāta (or: Rušunpāta), (sepīru?); B= Širiktu/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D= Bēl-ittannu

elementText.text:
Undertaking under oath to settle debts to a slave of the Egibi family with his master. Reference to the pledge of income from a prebend to the creditor.
B1 whose second name is Nabû-ittannu declares under oath (tamû) by Bēl, Nabû and Darius to A2 that he will bring him (ana pāni PN abāku) the brothers C1 and C2 by the end of Ab (V) of Darius 26th year. He and the 2 brothers shall then pay (eṭēru) the silver, barley and dates that he and B2, the brothers' father, owe to A1, A2's slave, according to the promissory notes (u'iltu). In addition (elat), there is a previous document (šaṭaru) that concerns the term of payment (adannu) upon which B1 agreed and the income from his ērib bīti-prebend that was taken as pledge (maškanu ṣabatu), namely 1 liter (qû) of bread and 1 liter (qû) of beer. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

A2=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A1=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of A2; B1=Aplaya/Nergal-iddin, alias Nabû-ittannu; B2=Nabû-ittannu/Nūrea; C1=Nabû-nādin-ahi/Nabû-ittannu; C2=Iddin-d.../Nabû-ittannu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley. Payment for transport costs due to a courtier from the head of the Egibi family.
B should deliver 24;3.2 kor of barley that are due from him to A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri), to cover the costs for the transport (gimru) of barley. Delivery is due in Abu (V). The document specifies the kind of transport at stake but the passage is fragmentary*. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe. Among the witnesses: a man with the Iranian name Bagadata/Mitrata; the courtier Bēl-ušallim (ša rēš šarri); and Mauzzu/Ṭabia (who has no title here, but cf. BM33112). The scribe is B himself.

* transport of barley [...] which Širku (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi) from (ina qate) [...].

A= Nabû-šumu-ibni, courtier (ša rēš šarri); B=Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli) (/Iddināya//Egibi).

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina and 35 shekels of silver to A, slave of C,  to be paid on the 1st of Abu (V). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ušallim/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābī-išme.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; C = Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates
B owes a broken amount of dates to A, to be delivered in their full amount (gamru) and in one payment in Arahsamna (VIII) at the Borsippa canal. The debtor is prevented from giving anything to someone else without the creditor's consent (ša lā). Names of 4 witnesses but the scribe's name is broken off.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Tayyālu/Rahiannu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B1 and B2, sons of C owe 23 1/3 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in full (gamāru D-ma eṭēru) for a one year period (adi ṭuppi ana ṭuppi). In addition, they are previous promissory notes for silver and emmer wheat. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbāši/Kabtia//Egibi.

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Madān-ēreš, son of Gimillu; B2 = Nabû-iddin, son of Gimillu; C = Gimillu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates.
B, the royal official appointed over the harbor (bēl piqitti ša kāri) of Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl owes 254;0.0.0 (kor) of dates to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX) in Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: .../Nabû-gamil.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Itti-maku-ilī, (bēl piqitti ša kāri)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Pledge of family members.
B owes 1 mina and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest in Dûzu (IV). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor's two daughters (fC1 and fC2), whom he bought for 2 minas of silver from D in the presence of the seller's father (E) who acted as witness. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged persons until the debt is fully repaid. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 120;0.0.0 kor of dates and 1 mina of silver on which interest is to be paid. Names of one witness and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl (debtor).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl; fC1 = fQudašu, daugther of Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl; fC2 = fBunanitu, daugther of Iddin-Nabû/Mušēzib-Bēl; D = Bānia/Nabû-ile’’i//Sagdidi; E = Nabû-ile’’i

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and barley without interest.
B owes 1 mina 7 1/2 shekels of silver and 23;0.0.0 kor of barley to A. The silver should be paid in Addar (XII) of the 4th year of Nabonidus in Ālu-ša-Ah-iddin. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II) of the 5th year of Nabonidus in the same town. He does not have to pay interest. A also holds a claim (rašûtu) for silver, barley and onions against C, for which B acts as a guarantor.
D's claim (rašûtu) for estimated income from imposts (imittu) ... [broken off] should still be setttled (nadānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nūrea/Ahunu; C = Sîn-ēṭir; D = Šarrani

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest. Pledge of land.
B1 and his mother (fB2) owe 1 mina of silver to A, to be paid with interest in Tašrīt (VII). The debtors' upper field (eqlu elēnu), next to C's plot of land and his lower field (eqlu šupālu), planted with date palms (bīt gišimmarē) and grain (pî šulpi), next to the border of the abarakku's plot of land were pledged to the creditor and remain pledged. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged land until the debt and its interest are fully repaid. Payment will be in dates and for that purpose the harvest will be assessed (emēdu) in Tašrīt (VII) when the dates are still on the trees. The interest is fixed at c. 20% (lit. 0;1 kor per shekel) according to the market value of Šahrinu. The (indebted) silver is what has been paid for rikis qabli of the royal soldiers (ṣāb šarri). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Šumu-iddin; fB2 = fBāba-eṭrat/Šamaš-ibni, mother of B1; C = Šumu-ukīn/Ša-nāšīšu

B owes 2.1 kor of dates to A which he should deliver in Arahsamna (VIII) according to the the creditor's. At this point the document is broken off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Kiribtu*/Bēl-kāṣir//Ṭābiḫu*.

A = Arad-Bēl/Kabtia//Pappāya; B = Bānia/Nabû-bēlšunu//Eppeš-ilī

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver?. Fragmentary.
B owes a broken amount of what seems to be silver to A, to be paid without interest in ... [the name of the month is broken]. A short note at the end points out that previous claims have been annulled. Names of one witness and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Nabāya.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-iddin/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Nabāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes a broken amount of mina of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be delivered on Simān (III). He will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. Witnesses.

A = Nabû-iddin/Kidu//Sîn-šadûnu; B = Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddināya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates
B owes 50 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) in Babylon. Should the debtor fail to do so and the dates ... [broken off], he can pay in Arahsamna (VIII). He does not have to pay interest. Witnesses.

A = Bēl-ile’’i/Nabû-aplu-iddin; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2, slaves of A2 owe 165 kor of dates to A1 and A2, to be delivered at the canal in Babylon. It is the assessed field rent (imittu) on the arable land located at the new canal. They should deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates(*) they shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 4 qappatu-baskets, 4 zabbilu-baskets and 4 darīku-containers. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu nukarribi). The above said includes (ina libbi) the 18 kor of dates that are due from D1 and D2, slaves (lamutānu) of A1 and A2. Witnesses.
(*)ll. 7 … 10: ina muhhi 1 gur sur-ru-ú … / it-ti-I inandinû.
 
A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Nergal-ušallim/Šumu-iddin//Šulāya; B1 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Zēru-ukīn//Ahu-bāni; B2 = Bēl-ṣullê-šime, slave of A2; D1 = Arabu, slave (lamutānu) of A1 and A2; D2 = Nabû-rīhtu-uṣur, slave lamutānu) of A1 and A2

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 24 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imittu) on land located at (ina muhhi) the New Canal. The full amount of dates (gamru) should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Tašrīt (VII) at the upper New Canal, together with (itti) spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû), green dates (uhinnu), fibres (mangagu) (and) 2 darīku-containers. In addition, there is barley at B's disposal (ina pāni) that he still (rīhtu) has to deliver in payment of the šibšu-tax on land (šibšu eqli) for Ayyār (II) of the 7th year. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-ēṭir/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn//Arad-Nergal

Promissory note for silver and onions, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 14 3/8 shekels of silver and 1200 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, to be delivered by the end of Tašrīt (VII). The (indebted) silver amd onions are what C invested in the business partnership. Scribe: Nabû-le'i/Ardia//šigua.
 
A = Zērutu/Bēl-eṭēru//Suhāya; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; C = Bēl-eṭēru

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley(?). Payment from the prebendary income
Promissory note for amounts of some agricultural commodity from prebendary income.
B owes 0;0.4.0 kor to A. He should give 0;0.3.0 out of the 0;0.4.0 kor from (ina) the prebendary income (maššartu) of the months Šabāṭ (XI), Addar (XII) and Nisan (I) (Nisan of the following year), while the remaining 0;0.1.0 kor should come from that of the months Ayyār (II), Simān (III) (and) Dûzu (IV). The previous promissory note is to be considered paid off (hepû). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Ša-pî-kalbi/Arrabi//Šangû-Bābili

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Mutual warranty.
B1, his brother (B2) and his wife fB3 owe 24 ½ shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX). The debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver available at the due date will pay. Witnesses.
 
A = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ahu-iddin/Šamaš-iddin; B2 = Šulāya/Šamaš-iddin; fB3 = fZunnāya, wife of B1; C = Šamaš-iddin, father of B1 and B2

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Interest to be paid in barley and fixation of exchange rate. General pledge.
B owes 10 shekels of silver to A. He should pay 2 sūtu of barley (as interest) per ½ shekel of (indebted) silver. The barley is to be paid according to its market value (mahīru) in Simān (III). All the debtor’s property in the city of U-RU6 are pledged to the creditor.
Witnesses (a.o. Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi).
 
A = Līšir/Rēmūt//Pahāru; B = Kudurru/Iqīšāya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes a broken amount of dates to A and his brothers, which is most likely the assessed field rent but the pertinent passage at the beginning of the document is broken off. The full amount (gamru) of dates should be delivered in one instalment according to A’s measure in Šuppātu. Delivery is due in Tašrīt (VII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû) from green dates (uhinnu), (and) fibres (mangagu) and 2 darīku-containers. Payment for the garderner's remuneration (šissinnu) is included in the above (ina libbi). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu

B still owes 1 mina and 50 shekels out of an original debt (rīhit u'ilti) of 7 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A1 and his brother. He should pay it without interest (qaqqadu) in Abu (V).
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = borther of A1; B = Šellebi/Pallil-uballiṭ

B owes ½ mina of medium quality white silver to A, to be delivered without interest in Šabāṭ (XI). From Addar (XII) onwards, he will start paying the usual 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley and dates.
B owes 3 kor of barley and 4 kor of dates to A. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II) and the dates in Tašrīt (VII) on the creditor's land (bītu) in Šahrīnu and according to his measure. A has returned the promissory notes for barley and dates which B owed to his slave (C). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Kāṣir/Šulāya; C=Madānu-bēlu-uṣur (slave of A)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 4.2 kor of dates to A1, A2, and A3. It is the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located in Šuppatu: half of this land belongs to A1 and half by his brothers (A2 and A3). The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of firewood, spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangaga) and 1 darīku-container. In addition, he still owes barley from the harvest (ebūr eqli) of the 15th year (i.e. the current year). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli (son of C?); A2 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, son of C; A3 = Nergal-ušēzib, son of C; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt.
B1 and B2 owe 75 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in full in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Tašrīt (VII) of Cambyses’ 6th year at the Ṭubašu-canal. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. The document continues by referring to a payment in silver (made by A on behalf of the debtors) to C, who is appointed over (ša muhhi ) the (yoke-) teams (ṣindu), for the(ir) obligation to provide military equipment (rikis qabli) in Cambyses' 5th year. In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu) against the same debtors for which their land in Bīt-Ṭabi and (their slave) D have been taken as pledged. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Ibnāya; B2 = Šumu-iddin/Nabû-ahu-iddin; C = Nabû-iddin (or: Ahu-iddin, so Joannès, Achemenet)/Aplāya, ša muhhi ṣindāti; D = Ṣilimu (mṣi-lim-mu?!)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 8 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) – probably followed by a description of the field's location but the tablet is broken at this point. B should deliver the dates to the courtyard in one instalment together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), (and) spadices (gipû), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. Delivery is due in Tašrīt (VII).  He should also pay for the habû uhinni-tax. He has not received (eṭēru) any remuneration for his gardening work (šissinnu). The document ends by referring to the share (zittu) of C, which is left out of consideration (elat) in the current promissory note. Witnesses
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nergal-iddin/Šamaš-ahu-iddin; C = Mušēzib-Bēl

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Crown income.
B, slave of D should deliver an unspecified amount of dates to A. The dates are Crown income (makkūr šarri) from the field that belongs to a palace scribe (tupšar ekalli), and which is under A's administrative responsibility. Scribe: Marduk-ēṭir/ Rēmūt//Arad-Nergal
 
A = Ea-nāṣir/Mušallimu//Šangû-Nanāya; B = Arad-Bēl, slave of D; D = Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn

Fixation of interest for a silver debt. Fragmentary.
B owes 1/2 minas of silver to A, on which he should pay interest, apparently a yearly interest of 20% on a monthly basis. A large  part of the tablet is broken off. Names of (at least) 4 witnesses and the scribe [..]-zēru/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nādin-šē’im.

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṯu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-zēru-ukīn//…

A1and A2, acting as proxy (ina našparti) for C receive 10 shekels of silver from fB. This sum does not include (elat) the 24 shekels of silver, received previously. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe:  A1.

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment for interest.
A receives full payment for interest on his silver till the end of Nisan (I) of the 2nd year of Cambyses from B. Note that the receipt is dated in Abu (V) of that year. The document does not only record the receipt but also points out that there exist two promissory notes regarding this silver debt. The exact amount received is not specified. No names of witnesses, no scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk; B = Kalbāya

elementText.text:

A1 and fA2 , wife of B, A’s colleague (šutāpu) have received a broken amount of silver, that does not include (elat) 2/3 mina of silver (received) previously, from C. The latter will be paid (i-šal-la-a’ for išallam [šalāmu G]) all that remains of the silver after the deduction (kaspu ina libbi i-na-ah-hi-su, [nasāḫu]). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-iddin/Bulluṭu; fA2 = fSūqā’ītu/Karêa, wife of B; B = Hašdāya, colleague of A1; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:

A receives 1 1/2 mina white silver of medium quality, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B according to his promissory note for 7 1/3 minas.(*) The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe. (*)According to Dar 278, the amount of silver due to A corresponded to 7 5/6 minas.

elementText.text:
Receipt for barley and various objects.
A, slave of C, receives 22.1 kor (c. 3,996 l) of treated dates (suluppū e-pi-ru-tu, [epšu]), 60 tuhallu-baskets, 90 spadices (gipû), 90 palm fibers (mangagu) (...), 90 palm offshoots (liblibbu) from B. This does not include the 2;4 kor (c. 504 l) of dates for the oven, which have been delivered to D. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šēpit-Bēl-aṣbat, slave of C; B = Gimil-Šamaš/Līširu//Šamaš-abāri; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D = Bēl-KAR-X

Receipt for dates. Purchase price for an ox.
Concerns the ox that A sold to B for its full price: 16 kor (c. 2,880 l) of dates. A receives (eṭēru) the dates from B. The buyer is allowed to take the ox from the seller: it is a three-year old, fattened ox. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-kāṣir/Līširu//Nabû-ēreš; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

B should pay 9 shekels of white, medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him to A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri) and? clerk (sepīru) on the 12th of Addar (XII). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Nabû-..., (ša rēš šarri), (sepīru); B= Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Promissory note to deliver dates (imittu-lease) to a slave of the Egibi family. Pledge of the produce from a palm grove. Witnessed by the royal resident in the Ehursag.
B should deliver the full amount (gamru) of 5.2.3 kor of imittu-dates that are due from him to C in Arahsamna (VIII) at the Borsippa Canal. Payment should be in one instalment and according to the 36 liter measure. The dates are due from a field in Harru-Urukaya that belongs to A but is pledged to C, a slave of D. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Aplaya/Nergal-iddin; B=Aplaya/Gimillu; C=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; D=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

Receipt of the miksu-toll from the head of the Egibi family.
A, harbour master (rab kāri) of Bīt-Ir'anni, receives (eṭēru) toll (miksu) from B for a boat loaded with 70 kor of barley. He should let the boat pass (etēqu Š) beyond (ina muhhi) his quay and give it (back) to B. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Kulbibi/Bēl-kāṣir//Eppeš-ilī, (rab kāri); B= Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Labour contract to go to Elam by joining the chariot of the Governor of Babylon. Receipt of part of the salary from the head of the Egibi family.
A shall go to Elam on behalf of B, together with the charioteers (ṣābū ša narkabti) of C, Governor of Babylon. It is agreed that he will be paid a salary (idū). In the present document he receives (mahāru) 50 shekels of silver of which 1/8 is alloy from B as his salary through the end of Tašrīt (VII). D assumes warranty for A.The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Kuṣuraya/Bānia//Banâ-ša-ilia; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Bēl-aplu-iddin (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D=Napsānu/Nergal-uballiṭ

elementText.text:
Receipt of makkasu-dates by a courtier. For the preparation of offerings in the temple of Nergal. Reference to the foreman of a group of prebendaries.
A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri), receives 24 kor of makkasu-dates from B. The makkasu-dates are for the preparation of Nergal’s regular offerings (ginû) in the period starting from the 1st Siman (III) of the 29th year till the end of Ulul (VI) of the 29th year. He will register the receipt in the accounts of C1 and? his colleagues ( lúki-na-at-tumeš), the lúx-x-rimeš and will give proof of it to B (itti PN ušuzzu-nadānu). If he fails to do so, he should give other dates to the temple for B's account? (ana muhhi?) in the month [broken]. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe. At the very end of the document, after the date, a short remark links the dates to the foreman (LÚ.GAR) of the "arrangers-of-the-sacrifical table (LÚ mu-ban-ni-e).

*suluppê ša šākin mubannê nadnû.

A=Bēl-ruṣūa, (ša rēši šarri); B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C1=Bēl-bullissu (wr. -bul-liṭ-su)

elementText.text:
Summons to settle debts with the head of the Egibi family.
By the 10th of Ṭebēt (X) of the 26th year of Darius, shall B come to A1 (ana pāni PN alāku) in Babylon in order to reach an agreement with him (itti PN dabābu) with regard to his debts (u'iltu). He owes him 1 mina of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, 3 kor of dates, and cattle?. He also owes silver, barley, dates and cattle to one of A1's slaves (A2). For those debts there exist written agreements (šaṭāru) which A1 concluded with B (itti PN šaṭāru) since Darius' 20th year. If B does not meet the deadline, he has to pay off (eṭēru) his creditors in agreement with what is provided for (aki) in the promissory notes (u'iltu) for silver, barley, dates and cattle. After that date (adannu) he cannot present to A1 (ana PN šakānu) anything about what he might have paid off. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of A1; B=Bēl-upahhir/Nergal-iddin

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Purchase price for a boat. Prompt return of the promissory note about the boat to the head of the Egibi family.
A receives (mahāru) 4 minas and 10 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, the price of his boat, from B according to his promissory note (u’iltu). He has returned (târu D-nadānu) the document (u’iltu) about the boat that had been issued (rakistu), sealed (kaniktu) and entrusted (paqdu) to C, to B. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-aplu-iddin/Lâbāši//Nūr-Papsukkal; B=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Niqūdu

elementText.text:
Receipt of ilku-silver by the head of the Egibi family. Payment on account of a bow-fief.
A receives payment (mahāru) for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) of the 25th year till the end of Addar (XII) of the 25th year of Darius, that is due on account of the bow-land (qaštu) of C and lúṭi-pa-ni-šú*. A receives it from B, C’s brother. The amount paid is 2/3 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. This silver has been given** to D, clerk (sepīru) of the courtiers (ša rēši) who are appointed over the administration of the rations of the New Palace. The register (giṭṭu) is with him. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*"on account of C's bow-land and its additions" / "on account of the bow-land of C" and his additional men (cf. BM30261).
** l. 10: A verb like SUM-nu (nadnu “has been given”) may be expected at the end of the line, but is, unfortunately, broken off.

A=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Iqūpu/Nādinu//Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk; C=Bēl-erība/Nādinu//Lūṣi-ana-nūr-Marduk; D= Bēl-erība, (sepirru ša rēši)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest. Fragmentary.
B1 and B2 owe a broken amount of minas and 15 shekels of silver to fA, wife of C. There is a yearly interest of 20% to be paid on a monthly basis. Payment is due in Tašrīt (VII), including the interest. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Until / together with (adi) ... [the rest of the tablet is broken off].
Names of one witness and the scribe: Nabû-ušallim/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābī-išme.

fA = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya, wife of Iddin-Marduk; B1 = Šadûnu; B2 = Balāṭu/Mušallim-Marduk; C = Iddin-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with antichretic pledge of slave. Fragmentary.
The upper half of the tablet is broken off. A broken amount of silver should be delivered in Ṭebēt (X) and its payment is secured by the pledge of the debtors' female slave (fC). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over her until A has received the full repayment of his silver, namely 30 shekels. The income from the slave's work pays for the interest (antichresis). Should the pledged slave go to another place, the debtors shall pay 0;0.3 kor barley on a daily basis to A as compensatory payment (mandattu) for his loss of income from the absent slave. The (indebted) silver is what has been paid for the rikis qabli that ... [broken off]. The names of witnesses and of the scribe are broken off.   

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Arad-Bēl/...; B2 = …//Balāssu; fC = fKalbatu, slave of B

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of land
B owes 40 shekels of silver to A, to be paid on the 28th of Ulūl (VI). The (indebted) silver is what remains (rīhtu) of the creditor's wife (fC) dowry silver, which her husband lent to B and for which she took B's arable land (zēru) at the sluice channel (bitqu) of Ile’’i-Bēl as pledge (maškānu ṣabātu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iqīša/Nergal-ušallim//Sîn-karābī-išme.

A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/ Bēl-iddin//Arad-Nergal; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC = fKalabtu, wife of A.

B1, B2 and B3 owe 1500 strings (gidlu) of onions to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) at the Borsippa canal. The three debtors assume warranty for each other. The document stipulates that 750 strings (gidlu) of onions (out of the 1500 strings (gidlu)) should be delivered by B1. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bazūzu/Šamaš-iddin.

A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B1 = Bēl-iqīša/Nabû-malik;

Delivery is due in the creditor's house (or: to his plot of land) (bītu). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. In addition, there is a previous claim (rašûtu) still outstanding against them. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-ušebši//Amēl-Isin.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Nergal-ēṭir/Adad-ibni; B2 = Nidintu/Šarrani

elementText.text:

B owes 7.3 kor of dates, assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on the arable land (zēru) that is divided up in parcels (qutānu) and shared (pūt zitti) by A with C1 and C2. The remainder of the document is virtually broken off. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = [the name is broken off]; C1 = Bēl-ušallim/šumu-ukīn; C2 = Mušēzib-Bēl/šumu-ukīn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes a broken amount kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli)(*) on land the location of which is only partly preserved. It appears to be land held in common ownership with C. The dates should be delivered to the courtyard (haṣāru) in one payment. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû) from green dates (ša uhinnu), fibres (mangagu), (and) 1 darīku-container. The document concludes by mentioning 1 qappatu-container, apparently as a late addition to the previous list of by-products. Witnesses.
(*)[imitti eqli].
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-talīmu/Nabû-silīm; C = Bēlet-ēreš/Šamaš-uballiṭ

elementText.text:
Promissory note for onions and silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 3000 strings of onions and 4 shekels of silver to A1 and A2. In Nisan (I), the onions should be delivered at the Borsippa-canal and the silver in Babylon. The (indebted) onions and silver are what C invested in the business partnership. In addition, there is an earlier harrānu-promissory note for ½ minas of silver and 6 barrels. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.
 
A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; C = Iddin-Marduk; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia

D will pay for the transportation costs for the [broken off]. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 11 kor of dates which is still pending. Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt. Related to beer brewery.
B owes 23 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Abu (V). Additionally, the debtor should deliver 25 barrels of quality beer (on the same date) from his own assets (ultu ramānišu).  He guarantees that the beer is … (šabbu), has alum (?) (harṣu), and that there is no crack (hupû A), leak (aṣû) or hole (haštu) in any of the barrels. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 50 barrels of quality beer which is still pending. Witnesses. Date. According to the earlier promissory note, the debtor will personally deliver the barrels.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Balāṭu/Marduk-nāṣir//Ararru

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
It is about 46 1/24 shekels of silver, the purchase price (šīmu) for C, whom B1  took from A (ina qātē abāku) and which he still needs to pay. From this sum (ina libbi) he currently pays 5 shekels. The remainder, namely 41 1/24 shekels of silver, should be paid by B2 in Dûzu (IV) in Babylon to A. If B2 fails to meet the deadline, he should do something the details of which are mostly lost in a badly preserved passage: it mentions 4(?) shekels of silver which/for A2 [broken off]. When the text picks up again, it is provided that he (=B2) should bring (abāku-ma nadānu) the man he purchased (C) and another person (D) to Babylon. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B1 = …-ba-a; B2 = Nabû-zēru-iddin/Iddina//[...]; C = Arrabi; D = Nabû-…

The full amount of barley (gamru) should be delivered in one instalment in Ayyār (II) of the 3rd year on the creditor’s land (bītu), while the onions and the sheep should be delivered in [the name of the month is broken off]. Witnesses.
(*)4 udu-nita2 3 munus-i 2 udu-x […].
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Arad-Nabû(?)/Nabû-ēṭir//Eṭēru
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on the harvest, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 17 kor of dates to A, impost on the harvest (imitti ebūri) from land (eqlu) located at the branch (bābu) of Borsippa canal. The dates should be delivered to the courtyard (haṣāru) in one payment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood (and) 2 darīku-containers. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Ahūšunu/Nergal-ibni//Ibnāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and barley. Payment for a debt. Without interest. Pledge of land.
Two brothers (B1 and B2) owe 12 shekels of silver and 6.3.2.0 kor of barley to A, slave of C. The silver should be paid without interest in Nisan (I) of the 8th year (i.e., by the end of the month). They should deliver the full amount of barley in one instalment according to C’s measure in Ayyār (II) in C’s house. The brothers assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver and/or dates available at the time of delivery should pay. The payment is secured by the pledge of a grain field (zēru pî šulpu). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged land until A has received the full repayment of his debt. At the very end of the document a short remark points out that the debt results from a payment made (probably by C on the brothers' behalf) to D (BA ša ana D šūbulu), the royal soldier (ṣāb šarri). Witnesses.
 
A = Madānu-bēlu-uṣur, slave of C; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Iddinunu/dammiq; B2 = Nabû-nāṣir/Nabû-udammiq; D = Mušēzib-Nabû, ṣāb šarri

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 35 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located at the Zabunu-ditch, to be delivered in one instalment to the courtyard. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation:  for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), (and) spadices (gipû) from green dates (uhinnu), a load of firewood, and 2 darīku-container. In addition, there is a promissory note (u'iltu) but at this point the document is badly preserved. It is followed by a statement concerning the settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) of the 9th(?) year […], and B's obligation to pay for the habû uhinnu-tax. Finally, it is said that his gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) has not been entirely paid (šalāmu G). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Līšir/Nabû-bān-ahi//Sîn-šadûnu

elementText.text:
​Fixation of interest for a silver debt.
B owes 2 2/3 minas and 6 shekels of silver to A. The interest is fixed at 1 shekel minus (maṭû) one-sixth of a shekel (suddû, wr. 6-‘) per 1 mina of indebted silver, to be paid on a monthly basis. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi (= debtor).
 
A = Nabû-šumu-uṣur/Mardukāya/Eppeš-ilu; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver. Payment of a debt. Return of the debtnote.
A received (ittenṭir, [eṭēru] the 11 1/3 minas and 3 1/2 shekels of white, medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy that was due from B according to what they agreed. He is paid off and hence he should return the pertinent promissory note to the debtor by the 20th of Nisan (I) (našû-nadānu). Names of 12 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A =  Marduk-iqīšanni/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-ēṭiru; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for assessed field rent, delivered in dates. Fragmentary.
A receives a broken amount of dates from B1 and B2 which are most likely assessed field rent (imittu) for the month Tašrīt (VIII) of Darius' 24th year for a field in Litamu, located next to C1 and C2. It is part of A’s 1/5 share in the rent income that he owns together with B2. D receives payment (eṭēru) for A's gugallu-tax. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4+ witnesses and the scribe. Cf. BM30339.
 
A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1= Madānu-iddin/Ubār//Itinnu; B2= Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šarru-uṣur; C1= ... (name broken); C2=Libluṭ/...; D= Mušēzib

elementText.text:
Receipt for ilku-payment
This is a memorandum (tahsistu) written to record that A receives a broken amount of silver from fB, wife of C, who pays for the ilku-tax due from her husband. It does not include (elat) previous receipts (giṭṭu). Names of 2 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi); no scribe.
 
A = Nūrea/Bēl-iqīša//Šangû-Nanāya; fB = fIna-Esagila-ramât/Zēria; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver for house rental
A, slave of C, receives two payments from B on his master’s behalf. One payment of 8 shekels of silver for rent of C’s house in the first half of the (current) year; the second payment, which amounts to 4 shekels of silver, was charged by C to the debtor (for unspecified reasons). A cryptic note at the end of the document clarifies that the silver is what remained to be paid as house rental, but it is a matter of interpretation whether this relates to both sums or only to the first one. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nergal-rēṣuā, slave of C; B = Arad-Bēl/Kalbāya//Mušallim; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for barley.
A1 and A2, slaves of C, received (im-hu-ru [mahāru]) 1.0.3.4 kor (c. 202 l) of barley, the harvest (ebūr eqli) for Darius’ 12th year, from B on the orders of (ina našparti) their master. In addition (elat), there exists an earlier receipt (giṭṭu) for 4.3.2 kor (c. 840 l.) of barley, the harvest for the 13th year, which A1 (sic) received (mahāru). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šēpit-Bēl-aṣbat, slave of C; B = Ilī-pî-uṣur, slave of C; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; D = Nabû-nāṣir-apli/Nādin//Bābūtu

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price.
Concerns silver that C owes to fA1 and her daughter (fA2) for his purchase of their slave (D). The sellers receive 5 shekels of silver, the purchase price for their slave, from B1 and B2, the buyer’s messengers.
 
fA1 = fIna-Esagila-bēlet/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Aškāpu;  fA2 = fAmat-Ninlil, daughter of  fA1; B1 =Tabnêa/Nabû-ušallim/Sîn-šadûnu; B2 = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Šamaš-nāṣir//Dannêa, messenger of C;  C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; D = Šēpet-Nabû-aṣbat, slave of fA1 and fA2

elementText.text:
Receipt of dates (imittu-lease) by a slave of the Treasurer from a slave of the Egibi family.
A, slave of C and messenger (mār šipri) of D, C’s majordomo (rab bīti), receives (mahāru) 15 kor of imittu-dates from B, slave of E. The dates are C’s share (zittu) in the income from impost (imittu) for Darius’ 21st year from a field located along the Rab-kāṣir Canal. He shares the income with (itti) the Egibi brothers (“E and his brothers”). C appears here without his official title (of Treasurer). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-gabbi-ilī, slave of C, (mār šipri) of D; B=Šēpāt-Bēl-aṣbat; C=Bagasarū; D=Piššia, (rab bīti) of C; E=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of dates by a slave of the Egibi family.
A, a slave of D, receives (mahāru) in total 34.2.3 kor of dates from fB, wife of C. His claim (rašûtu) is for the principal amount (qaqqadu) and the interest (hubullu). The dates, 16 kor of dates of the 13th year of Darius, and 18.2.3 kor of dates of the 14th year, are from two sectors of irrigated farmland in Haṣirātu which belong to C. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of D; fB=fQunnabi/Ahhē-iddin, wife of C; C=Bēl-iddin/Nabû-zēru-ušabši; D=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for a boat. Very fragmentary.
Concerns the boat which A sold to B for its full price? (the passage is badly preserved). In the present document A receives 5/6 minas of medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy and assumes warranty for the uškûtu of the boat. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Kidinnu/Rēmūtu//…; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of barley and dates to the head of the Egibi family. Pledge renewal.
Concerns 297.3.0 kor of dates and 11.2.3 kor of barley that B owes to A. B should deliver the barley in Ayyar (II) and the dates in Tašrīt (VII) of the 5th year. Delivery should be in one instalment in A's house according to the latter’s measure. B’s part in an orchard (eqlu zaqpu) and grain field (pî šulpi) at the Borsippa Canal that he shares with (zittu) C, his brother, is (still) pledged (maškanu) to A. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over it until A has received full repayment (šalāṭu) of his credit claim. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Rēmūt-Bēl/Šumu-ukin; C=Nabû-māku-uṣur
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver among family members. Paid on behalf of the family head by his son to his brother. For military equipment and travel provisions. Reference to a previous settlement of their qinayātu-duties.
A receives (mahāru) 1 mina of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B. It is the share (zittu) that is due from C, his father. This amount of silver is paid instead of (kūm) providing for the equipment of a military expedition (rikis qabli) and the travel provisions (ṣidītu) for the period till the end of Addar of the 36th year of Darius. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. They (already) arranged in mutual agreement (itti ahāmeš šakānu) their qinayātu-duty, which is in addition (elat) to the aforementioned duties. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Nidinti-Bēl/Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver by the head of the Egibi family. Partial repayment of a debt. Reference to the sale of a prebend by the debtors.
A receives* 1 2/3 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B1 and B2, his son. It is part of a larger debt (u'iltu) of 4 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, 66 kor of dates, and 4 kor of some other kind of produce, that B1 owes to A. His orchard (zēru zaqpu) in Ṣilimma had been pledged (maškānu ṣabātu) to secure the repayment of the dates (kūm). A badly preserved clause at the end refers to the sale of a prebend (šīm isqi) by the debtors and its interpretation is open to discussion. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

*Verb of receipt is broken.
**ll. 8-12: "About the 1 2/3 minas silver, the price of the prebend of the [...] which? B1 and B2, A with m[...].”

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1=Bēl-upahhir/Nergal-iddin; B2=Bēl-ibni(or -nāṣir)

elementText.text:
Receipt of the miksu-toll from the head of the Egibi family.
A, harbour master (rab kāri) of Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl, receives (mahāru) toll (miksu) from B for two boats. One boat is loaded with 100 kor of dates and 50 kor of barley and passed (etēqu Š) beyond the quay of Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl and the other boat loaded with 180? kor of dates passed beyond the quay of Til-Gula. The exact amount that is paid for these boats is not specified, but the rate is fixed at 33%*. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

*0;0.1 kor per kor (of load).

A= Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-..., (rab kāri); B= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
List of quantities of silver. Expenditures.
The document lists various quantities of silver that were expended a.o. to buy jars (dannu) by A and B (66 1/2 shekels), to buy beer from Borsippa (16 shekels), to pay for house rent (idū) (55 shekels), and to extend loans (ina pāni) against interest (hubullu) (15 shekels; 20? shekels to C; and a broken amount to D). It also lists expenditures of 100 kor of dates which are at the gate of Babylon. Missing dates (maṭû) (unless this refers back to the 100 kor of dates at the gate); and 14 kor of dates from Dilbat. The end of the tablet is badly preserved.

A= Napuštu; B= Dayyān-Marduk; C= Kabtia/Mušallim-Marduk; D= Bēl-qa…

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver to a member of the Egibi family.
B should pay the [x] mina(s) of white silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him to A till? the [xth] of Ulul (VI) of the 25th year of Darius. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Nabû-ittannu/Bānia//Itinnu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, purchase price of wool from Bēl-šarru-uṣur, the crownprince. Security pledge. Interest at default.
B owes 20 minas of silver to A to be delivered in Addar (XII) of the 11th year. The debt will bear a yearly interest of 20% at default (nemerkû). The debt results from B's purchase of wool (šīm šipāti) from C, the crownprince (mār šarri). The wool is the latter's income (makkūru) which is managed by (ša ina qāte) A, his mayor domo (rab bīti) and by his secretaries (sepīru). Considering that the price of unprocessed wool is 1 shekel for 5 minas of wool, it follows that B bought about 3000 kg wool. The month in which the present document has been written is broken off, but it was most likely soon after sheep shearing which normally took place in February/March (Wunsch 1993, 55f.). Hence, the broken month in which the tablet was drawn up can be safely reconstructed as Šabāṭ (XI). The debtor's house next to [broken off], his slaves and his entire property in and outside the city are pledged to C until the debt is fully repaid. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi.

A = Nabû-ṣābit-qātē, mayor domo (rab bīti) of C; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Bēl-šarru-uṣur, crownprince (mār šarri)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes a broken amount of dates to fA, to be delivered in two installments. The first one should be taken from the (debtor's) prebendary income (maššartu) of / in Abu (V) and the second one from that of / in .... [the name of the month is broken off]. In addition, there are previous promissory notes for dates credited to fA ... [broken off].
Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nergal-šumu-uṣur/…//Dābibi.

fA = fNuptāya/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn; B = .../Ṣāhit-ginê

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates and barley. Transfer to a new creditor. Fragmentary.
The promissory note (u’iltu) for 180 kor of dates and 106 kor of barley that has been contracted to the credit of A1, a courtier (rēš šarri) serving in Šahrinu, now belongs to A2. A1’s brother is mentioned in a badly preserved passage, followed by a big gap in the tablet. When the text picks up again, it states that any promissory note that is credited to A1 and turns up in his brother’s house belongs to the new creditor. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Aplāya/Mušallim-Marduk.

A2 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; A1 = Bēl-ahhē-iddin/Mušēzib-Marduk//..., a courtier (rēš šarri) in Šahrinu; C = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Mušēzib-Marduk//..., brother of A1

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. General pledge.
B owes 3 1/2 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in Nisan (I). Should he fail to do so, he shall deliver a full amount (gamru) of 4;0.0.0 (kor) of barley in Babylon. All the debtor's property in and outside the city are pledged to the creditor. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: MušēzibBēl/Šulāya//Bēl-eṭēru.

A = Zēru-ukīn/Nabû-ibni//Nabāya; B = Mannu-iqabbu/Nabû-nā'id

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates, emmer wheat and silver. Interest and receipt of interest.
B1 and B2  owe 6.4 kor of dates, 3.3 kor of emmer wheat and 10 shekels of silver to A. The dates should be delivered at the next date harvest, in Arahsamna (VIII). The emmer wheat should be delivered in Simān (III) (i.e. next month). There exist a document (u'iltu) about this silver debt that provides that the debt bears interest (hubullu rabû) and the debtors should remove earth clods (paška našû). Each one of the debtors assumes warranty for the other. In addition, there is a lease contract for gardening work (nukaribbutu). A short note at the end of the document states that the creditor already received (mahāru) 2 shekels of silver, part of the interest on the 10 shekels of silver. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû*-mukīn-zēri//Balāṭu.

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Madān-ēreš/Gimillu; B2 = Nabû-iddin/Gimillu

B owes 24;0.0.0 (kor) of dates and 5000 strings of onions to A. The dates should be delivered in Tašrīt (VII), while the onions in Addar (XII). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: DU.../Nabû-gamil.

Promissory note for silver, purchase price for land.
B owes 4 minas 29 1/3 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered at the end of Nisan (I). It is what remains to be paid (rīhtu) of the purchase price for a field (eqlu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-mukīn-apli/Bēl-udammiq*//Egibi.

A = Bēl-ēṭir/Bēl-ušebši//Nūr-Sîn; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with antichretic pledge of house.
B owes 4 minas of silver to A. The debtor's house located next to C's house and D's house, is pledged to the creditor, who enjoys the right of usufruct in lieu of interest (antichresis). The house is actually rented out to E for 7 years. The creditor will pay 3 out of the 4 minas of silver to PN (to whom the house is pledged), and the remaining 1 mina to two other creditors of B (F and G). A short remark at the end of the document relates to additional payments: The debtor should pay(?) for 2 kīnayātu together with the creditor (amāru, lit. "to see"). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-zēru-ibni/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//...

A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Marduk-nādin-šumi//Sippê(a); C = Etellu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Gallābu; D = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi; E = Nergal-iddin; F = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya;
G = Nabû-zēru-ušabši/Kalbāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley.
B, slave of C, owes 27 kor of barley to his master's son (A), to be delivered in Ayyār (II) of Darius' 26th year in Ālu-ša-Bēl. Delivery is in one instalment and according to the 36 liters measure. Should he fail to deliver the barley, he shall provide 4 barrels of good quality beer for the winter. Background to the barley debt is a deal that B concluded in Darius' 24th year and according to which he acquired rights in the use of a cow (zitti alpi) against the payment of part of the barley that he was to harvest in the next year (Darius' 25th year) with the cow's help. A short note at the very end of the document, after the date, refers to 3;3.3 kor of dates from B for A. Witnesses.

A = Nidintu-Bēl/Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi; B = Madān-iddin, slave of Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Egibi; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Egibi

Receipt for dates. Partial payment of assessed field rent. Fragmentary.
A receives (mahāru) 68 kor of dates, part of the dates that B owes to him as field rent (suluppū imittu) [broken off]. B will deliver [broken off] at the end of Arahsamna (VIII). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu; C = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley. Business assets.
B owes a broken amount of barley to A1 and A2. Part of it (6 kor) is what the latter two men invested in a business partnership (harrānu) with B, and another part (12 kor) is the share? ... (at this point the document breaks off). The 6 kor of barley should be delivered in Simān (III) in Babylon [broken off]. In addition (elat), there are previous debts (u'iltu) that B has not yet paid off. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-šāpik-zēri/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Nādin-še’i.

A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Libluṭ/Nergal-ušallim/Ile’’i-Marduk; B = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/…//Rab-banê

Promissory note for onions and barley, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes x+1100 onion strings (gidlu) and 0.1.3.0 kor of barley to A1 and A2, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu) that was established by C as main investor. He should deliver them in Ayyār (II). Witnesses. Scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.

B owes [2?]15 kor of dates to A. The first instalment, i.e., 100 (kor) of dates should be delivered in Dûzu (IV), while the second instalment of 115 (T.:114) kor in Tašrīt (VII). All previous promissory notes have been paid off. Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Purchase price of a female donkey.
B owes 10 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, slave of C. He should pay in Tašrīt (VII). It is a payment for the purchase of the female donkey that A put at his disposal in a share-farming agreement (ša zitti ša ina pāni). 
Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ayyālu, slave C; B = Nabû-bēl-napšāti/Mušēzib-Marduk; C = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest. Pledge of land.
B owes 7 minas of unstamped (?) (la ginnu), medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, to A1 and his brother (A2), to be paid in Addar (XII) of the 19th year. The debt bears a 20% interest, to be paid on a monthly basis, and is secured by the pledge of a plot of land measuring 3 kor and planted with date-palms which is located at the Ištar-canal in Bit-Nabû-bēl-ilī next to C’s plot of land. If the debtor fails to meet the deadline and the debt is still not paid in Nisan (I), the creditor is entitled to [6]0 kor of dates from the pledged palm grove on a yearly basis. Whatever is harvested in excess to these 60 kor of dates belongs to B. If the harvest turns out to be less than 60 kor, the debtor should (still) deliver the rest (apparently, from other date palm groves in his possession). Each year shall B deliver dates and pay interest to his creditors (passage partly broken). At the end of the document it is pointed out­­­ that the indebted silver is the rest of an earlier promissory note for 220 kor of dates owed by B to A1. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Šellebi/Pallil-uballiṭ; C = Rēmūt/Sūqāya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 5.1 kor of dates, assessed field rent for land (imitti eqli) located behind (kutallu) the houses at (ina) the Giššu-Gate, to A and his brothers. He should deliver them in one payment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), and 1 darīku-container. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-ana-merehti/Ardia

B owes 11 2/3 minas and 3 ½ shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be delivered with interest (hubullu) in Ayyār (II). It is what remains to be paid of the 19 2/3 minas and 3 ½ shekels of silver that B's father owed to A's father.
 
A = Marduk-iqīšanni/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Bēl-eṭēru; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 12.0.0.0 kor of dates to A, slave of C. It is the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on D’s field, located at the river flats (raqqatu) of the Borsippa canal opposite to [broken off] (pānat x x meš), which is pledged to A. The full amount (gamru) of dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure at the Borsippa canal. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). Payment for the tithe of the Nergal-temple (ešrû ša Nergal) has been settled (eṭēru G Stat). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Sîn-šadûnu.
 
A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B = Bēl-iddin/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Egibi; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Nergal-nāṣir/Nādin

B owes 1 shekel of silver to fA, on which she should pay a yearly interest of 20% on a monthly basis. In addition, there is an earlier debt for which his house and slaves have been taken as pledge.

fA = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabaya B = Nabû-iqīša/Šellibi//Atkuppu

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Partial payment of a debt and promise to pay remainder.
C has a claim against B for 50 shekels of silver, the repayment of which is secured by an antichretic pledge of a house. The house is rented out to A, who eventually took over C’s claim, probably after having paid him the amount of silver that B owed him. He received the original debt note from C. In the present document, the debtor pays a part of his debt, namely 1/2 mina and 7 shekels of silver, to A and promises to pay the rest by Ṭēbet (X). Witnesses
 
A = Marduk-ēṭir/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Šumu-libši; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Šumu-ukīn//Šigûa

Receipt of silver. Compensatory payment

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-ēṭir/Aplāya//Bēl-ēṭiru; C = Atkal-ana-Marduk, slave of A

Concerns the 11 minas of silver that B owes to A1 and A2 and for the payment of which his house has been taken as pledge. C bought the pledged house and orders A1 to go and get his 11 minas from B. The present document records A’s receipt of the silver from B.
 
A1 = Nabû-mukīn-apli; A2 = Zababa-ahu-erība/...//Eppeš-ilī; B = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Balāṭu//Ša-nāšīšu; C = Neriglissar/Bēl-šumu-iškun

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Return of the promissory note.
Concerns 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of white silver of which 1/8 is alloy, which B owes to C. A, as proxy for the creditor, receives it from the debtor, according to what is stipulated in the promissory note that is with the creditor. As a result, A promptly returns this promissory note to the debtor.
Cf. BM 41444.
 
A = Kiribtu/Ahhē-iddin//Rab-banê; B = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/...-Bēl

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of barley, silver, and browned ghee to the head of the Egibi family. Silver had been transferred to the debtor to pay off his creditor. Return of the promissory note for previous debts that were paid back.
B should deliver the full amount (gamru) of 10 kor of barley that are due from him to A at the end of Simān (III) of Darius' 22nd year in one instalment in the creditor's house in Šahrīnu and according to the latter's measure. He will also deliver the 10 shekels of white, medium quality of silver and the one container (nispu) of browned ghee (himētu qulītu) that are due from him. A has promptly returned the previous promissory note (u'iltu) for 12 kor of barley, capital amount (qaqqadu), 1 object the nature of which is broken*, and browned ghee which were owed to his slave (C) by B, to B (târu D-nadānu). The indebted 10 shekels of white silver are those which have been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to D, creditor (rašû) of B. Names of 8 witnesses and the scribe.

*1-en […].

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Ibnaya/Nergal-zēru-ibni; C=Madān-aplu-iddin; D=Iddin-Nabû
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of barley to the head of the Egibi family.
B should deliver 3 kor of first-rate (babbanû) barley that are due from him to A in Ayyar (II) in Ālu-ša-Marduk-nāṣir-apli along the Piqūdu Canal. Delivery should be in one instalment and according to the creditor's measure. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Šulum-Bābili/Nidintu

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Payment of salary.
A receives (mahāru) 1/3 minas of marked silver from B. The background to this payment is a labour agreement between both parties according to which A will work for B (ina pāni PN uzuzzu) at a yearly salary (idū) of 1/3 minas of marked silver, starting on the 1st of Šabaṭ (XI). Accordingly, the silver that A receives in the current document corresponds to a one-year salary. The document is dated on the 20th of Ṭebet (X). Whether the recorded payment is an advance payment for a full year (Peiser, BRL 3, 46) or a delayed one after almost a year of work (Abraham 2004), is a matter of interpretation. The kind of work is not specified, unlike BM30787 where the same person receives 8 shekels of silver a month for sailing a boat to Babylon. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bulṭaya/Habaṣīru//Rē'i-alpi; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Renting of a boat to the head of the Egibi family.
A rents (ana idi nadānu) a boat that he has at his disposal (for boat-service duty?) to B for 1.0.3 kor of dates a day. The boat belongs to C. There is an additional payment (elat) of 150 kor of dates, but the clause is fragmentarily preserved. From the 14th onwards the boat will be at his disposal (ina pāni).* Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.

*I.e. in a few days up to two weeks depending on the reading of the day on which the agreement was written (l. 15: 9th or 1st).

A=Gula-zēru-tabni/Zēr-Bābili/Nappāhu; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=m...-uṣuršu?
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Letter concerning soldiers and troops. The Governor of Babylon complains to the head of the Egibi family about his unloyal handling of their recruitment.
A (who has no title but may be identified with the Governor of Babylon) accuses B of having lied to him (pirṣāti dabābu) by telling him that C, the charioteer (mār sīsê), and A’s auxiliary charioteer troops (tašlīšu) are enlisted (šaṭāru) with B. If so, they should have been ready available. However, the Commander of the Citadel (rab dūri) came to A and withheld (kalû) C and all the charioteers from doing reserve(?) service (kutallu) for A. They have been taken away (abāku). B should have defended A’s interests before the Commander (pî šakānu) but instead made common cause with him and transferred A’s (military) resources to himself (nikkassu našû). After the accusations follow the instructions. A orders B to write a letter to the town of Danipinu in the Sealand concerning C, who has in the meantime been appointed at the head of a fleet, and is apparently moving his troops to the south. The letter should contain the following message: The charioteers, auxiliary troops and citizen-soldiers (mār bānê) should not be released (muššuru) to C and he should be stopped from raising improper claims (pirṣātu dabābu) against my soldiers (ṣābū) with the Commander of the Fortress. B should talk to D and muster (našû) other soldiers instead of the soldiers which the Commander withheld. The soldiers of the gardu-workers about whom A instructed B (ṭēmu šakānu), should be allowed to go (paṭāru D). B will have at his disposal (ina pāni) the guards (maṣṣāru) at the gates and all the charioteers as well as the troops from Bīt-Dakkuru who are stationed (wašābu) in Babylon, so that he should not interfere with the troops of A’s chariot-property (bīt narkabti). The burden (baganu) of the King lies on (ina muhhí) B.

A=Gūzānu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšīšu; B=Širku (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Libluṭ, (mār sīsê); D=Atkal-ana mār-Esagil/Sîn-bēlu-uṣur, (ša rēš šarri)

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for transport costs. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, courtier (ša rēš šarri) and clerk (sepīru) of the courtiers (ša rēš šarri) of the Grand Palace receives (mahāru) 40.3.2 kor of barley from B to cover the costs of transporting (gimru) a broken amount of barley. He acts by order of (ina qibi) C, governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Babylon. The barley that needs to be transported is D’s income from the collection of fixed rent (sūtu). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Bēl-ušallim, (ša rēš šarri), (sepīru); B= Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D=Bēl-ittannu

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (mahāru) for the entire ilku-tax from Nisan (I) till the end of Addar (XII) of 25th year of Darius from B. It is the share (zittu) that is due from C. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nabû-ittannu; C=Nabû-bullissu/Nabû-ittannu//Sippê(a)

elementText.text:
List of quantities of silver and barley. Expenditures for boats, boat equipment and boat transports. Reference to a City Governor and persons known from texts in the Egibi archive.
x minas x shekels of white silver have been given to A, the Overseer (rabû) [...] for hirelings (agru).
2/3 mina 1 1/2 shekels of white silver, and another 6 shekels of white silver, the price of the garments (túgKUR.RA), have been given in the presence (ina ušuzzi) of the Governor (šākin ṭēmi), to the hirelings.
1/3 mina 6 shekels of silver, the rent (idū) for 2 boats, have been given to B, the official-in-charge (rēšu) and his workmen (ṣābu) at the bīt ú-ri*.
5 shekels of white silver have been given to B, the official-in-charge.
2/3 mina 1 1/2 shekels of white silver, the price of 6.2.3 kor of barley, have been given by order of the Governor to the House of Artasunu.
2/3 mina shekels of white silver have been given according to the register (giṭṭu) and the sealed tablet (kunukku) of the Governor to C for the barley.
1/3 mina of silver have been given according to the register and sealed tablet to C for 4 cables (halliptu).
1/3 mina of silver have been given for the rations of the men who towed the boats (šaddidu) as far as Bāb Kabarri.
10 shekels of white silver, the price of 10 beer jars (dannu ša šikari), have been given by order of the Governor (šākin ṭēmi) for the boats that transport beer.
8.2.3 kor of barley have been given by order of the Governor to D for dismantling (napālu) the boats.
2 minas of white silver have been given as rent for the boat which sailed from Bāb Kabarri till Šušan, and on which … (uncl.).
12 1/2 shekels of white silver, 2 pān (=72 liters) of flour ..., (uncl)
have been given to E.
1 1/3 shekels of white silver have been given by order of the Governor (šākin ṭēmi) for the rent of the boats which transported (qerēbu D) barley with (itti) F.
1 mina 10 shekels of white silver have been given to G, in the presence of H and I.
1 1/2 minas of white silver due from J have been given to the Governor.
1/2 mina 5 shekels of white silver have been given for the rent of the boat loaded with flour

*bīt ú-ri: read bīt kar!-ri "harbour! House"?
** ana našê ša kan-ka?/du?

A=Šullumu, (rabû); B=Bēl-ikṣur, (rēšu); C=Nidinti-Bēl-damqat; D=Šumu-ukīn; E=Gūzu-ina-Bēl-aṣbat; F=Ipria; G=Arad-Bunene; H=Napuštu; I=Bānûnu; J=Marduk//Pahāru

elementText.text:
Renting of a boat and receipt of the rent money. Rented to the head of the Egibi family.
A rents (ana idīšu nadānu) a boat to B and receives (mahāru-eṭēru) 1/3 mina of white, medium quality silver as rent money (idū) and (adi) for the boat’s maintenance (kurummatu). The boat belongs to C, Canal Inspector (mašennu), but is at A, boatman’s disposal (ina pāni, mallāhu) for boat-service duty (mallāhūtu). The boat will sail to Bištu-ša-ṣēru’a, but should not pass (etēqu) the fortified settlement (birtu); if the boat passes it, the renter shall pay an additional 5 minas of silver. He has to dismantle (napālu)* the boat upon arrival at its destination. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

*The verb refers to ship breaking (rather than to unloading), a process that allowed re-use of ship parts or easier transport upstream over land.

A=Nabû-zēru-iqīšanni/Erēšu; B=Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Balāṭu/Ina-qibi-d..., (mašennu)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley. Costs for seeds and maintenance.
B owes 98;0.0.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) to A's house and according to his measure. This barley was given (to B) (nadānu, G Stat) to buy seeds and pay for the maintenance of the farmers (ikkaru) in the 11th year. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Nappāhu. 

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nergalahu-iddin/Ahhea

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley with interest.
B owes 46;0.0.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) with the usual 20% interest. In addition, there are earlier promissory notes (u'iltu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bīt-Ir’anni-šarru-uṣur/Līšir.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-edu-uṣur/Rahiannu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B1 owes 15 shekels of silver to A, to be paid by the end of Addar (XII). The debtor undertakes to bring along B2 (abāku) who will pay off the debt (eṭēru N) and the creditor undertakes to return the promissory note to B1 once he receives his silver.  Perhaps related to debt in BM30990. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Kiribtu//Bēl-aplu-uṣur. 

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Erībāya; B2 = Bēl-šumu-iškun

elementText.text:
Promissory note for bricks.
B owes 2000 pieces of bricks to A, to be delivered at the end of Dûzu (IV). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 2000 pieces of bricks. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-nādin-apli/Arad-Bēl//Ba'iru.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Zēria/Nadnāya//Rab-banê

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, wool and vessel with butter.
B owes 2 minas of silver, 1 talent of wool and a 0;0.3 kor-container of butter to A1, who decided to transfer his claim and the pertinent promissory notes to A2. The new creditor should collect the silver from B and then settle the barley debt that A1 still owes to him. He shall give any exceeding silver (utru) to A1 without delay. A1 undertakes to pay off his debt to A2 should the latter fail to collect the silver. Witnesses.

A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Rēmūtu/ Nabû-šumu-iškun/; B = Nabû-ēṭir/ Amurru-nāṣir

Promissory note for onion.
B, slave of C owes 1200 strings of onion to A, to be delivered in Nisan (I). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-nādin-apli/Nabû-dāmiq//Nappāhu.

A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Esagil-budia, slave of Bēlšunu; C = Bēlšunu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1 mina and 20 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eigth is alloy, to A, to be paid at the end of Ulūl (VI). The document also mentions a claim by A (rašûtu) for which (kum) C transferred 56 1/2 shekels of silver to the former (ina pāni šakānu). After C's death, on the 19th of Ulūl (VI), A paid this silver to B. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-nādin-apli/Zēru-ukīn//Zanêa.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Silīm-Bēl/Marduk//Damqa; C = Nabû-šumu-iškun (no affiliation)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest. Sale of dowry property. Deposit of purchase price. Fragmentary.
B owes 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver to fA. The creditor took silver that she got from selling some of her dowry property, and lent it to B without her son (C) being present, although he and his brothers owned a half share in their mother's dowry. The debtor pledges his house worth 1/2 mina and 5 shekels of silver. There is interest to be paid, namely 5 shekels on a yearly basis. At this point the text is badly preserved, mentioning D and promissory notes that have been deposited with him: "once C has paid the 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver to? D [on behalf of?] fA. ... [broken off]. This no doubt refers back to BM30304 (= Nbn 44) when fA and her son receive interest on the silver that they received from the sale of a house from her dowry and is deposited with D. Witnesses.

fA = fGugūa/Zākiru//Išinnu; B = Tabnēa/Nabû-ušallim//Sîn-šadûnu; C = Ea-zēru-ibni/Bēl-zēru-līšir//Egibi, son of fA; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Repayment in onions.
B, slave of C, owes 5 1/2 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in Nisan (I) (of the next year) at the Borsippa canal. The debt should be paid back in onion strings (gidlu), in accordance with their market value (etēqu) at the time of delivery, but 1800 onion strings should already be delivered at the end of the month (IV). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nergal-šūzibanni, slave of Ṣillāya; C = Ṣillāya
