elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes a broken amount of dates to A, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) at the courtyard (haṣāru) in one instalment and measured according to the 36 liters measure. B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor he shall give a load of spadices (gipû), spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu) and offshoot(s) (liblibbu). Witnesses.

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; Β = Bēl-epuš/Nādinu//Uballissu-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B owes 10 minas of silver to A1, to be paid without interest in Nisan (I) to the creditor and his mother (fA2) and in the presence of C, governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Babylon. A fragmentarily preserved clause describes the silver as part of a larger sum of 25 1/2 minas of silver that apparently belonged to D and had been given to B.

A1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Šamaš-abārī; fA2 = Tabluṭa, mother of A1; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Marduk-zākir, governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Babylon; D = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Fragmentary.
B owes 14? kor of dates to A1, his brothers and the sons of C. It is the assessed revenue (imittu) (from land) at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal, including the x+14 kor of dates from 2 sectors … [at this point the document is broken off]. The passage The passage regarding the terms of delivery is badly preserved. We can learn from it that B should deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation, a.o. fibres (mangagu), and 2 darīku-containers. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). In addition, there is another claim (rašûtu) against B that is still pending. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = [the name is broken off]; C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zeri

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes a broken amount kor of dates to A and his brothers. This is most likely assessed field rent [imitti eqli]), but the pertinent passage at the beginning of the tablet is broken off. The rent is paid for land located [… at] the road to Kiš and shared (pūt zitti) by A and his brothers. The dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), (and) 2 darīku-containers with a 0;0.3 kor capacity. The document ends with the to prune (arū D) any live part of the date palm (raṭbu). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Gūzānu/Mār-bīti-iddin//Šangû-Nanāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu)
B owes x+5;1.4.0 kor of dates to A1 and A2. From this amount, 3;1.4.0 kor is paid for the purchase of a lamb. The debtor should deliver the dates in one payment according to the 36 liter measure in Arahsamna (VIII) at the Borsippa canal. It concerns the assets that C invested in a business partnership (harrānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-dāmiq/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Nūr-Sîn.
 
A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; A2 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; B = Bēl-ibni/Nādin; C = Iddin-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. With antichretic pledge of a slave and guarantor.
B owes ½ minas of silver to A, to be paid in Dûzu (IV). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s slave (fC), a laundress (pūṣa'ītu). A's income from the slave's (laundry) work pays for the interest (antichresis) and he is exempt from paying rent for the slave. Once B has paid off his debt he is allowed to take back his slave. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nabû-ēreš/Tabnēa//Ahu-bāni; fC = fŠalmu-dīninni, slave of B

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Payment for a debt. Pledge of slaves and family members
B owes 59 shekels of silver to A. The payment is secured by the pledge of three of the debtor’s slaves: fC1, fC2, her 13-years old daughter, and her unnamed 6-months old son. The document mentions that B bought these slaves from D. There follows a badly preserved passage which seems to imply that the seller ordered the buyer to pay the purchase price to one of his creditors (i.c., A), and that this should happen in two payments (one of 55 shekels and one of 4 shekels) before the end of Abu (V) (i.e., next month). Should B fail to meet the deadline and A's claim is not secured by the pledged slaves, he should pay A the full 59 shekels of silver.
 
A = Nergal-šumu-uṣur/Nabû-šumu-iddin//Dābibi; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fC1 = fHabaṣīrtu; fC2 = fBānitutaddin; D = Bēl-iddin/Silīm-Bēl//Damqa

B, slave of A owes 0.2.1.2 kor of barley to his master, to be delivered in full (gamru) in one installment according to the creditor’s measure in Ayyār (II). In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu) by the same creditor which is still pending.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for a debt. Pledge renewal.
B owes 17.2.3.0 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in full in one instalment in Dûzu (IV) of Cambyses’ 8th year in the creditor’s house. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s fields at Bit-ṭabi-Bēl and (his slave) C. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until A has received the full repayment of his debt. A fragmentarily preserved elat-clause refers to a claim (rašûtu) against [PN and (?)] D which B has apparently paid off (?) towards the end of Cambyses' 7th year. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Ibnāya; C = Šillimu, (slave of B?); D = Saparri-ibni

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2, sons of C owe 33 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent (imitti eqli). The document does not say which field is at stake. The dates should be delivered in one payment to the courtyard (haṣāru), together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), (and) spadices (gipû), and a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. There is still another (elat) claim against them that is still pending (rašûtu mahrītu). The document ends by stipulating that the debtors should cultivate the entire land (zēru epēšu) and in exchange (-ma), the creditor will deduct (nasāhu) the remuneration for their work (šissinnu) from his claim. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Madānu-ēreš, son of C; B2 = Nabû-iddin, son of C; C = Gimillu

elementText.text:
Settlement of debts and update of the bookkeeping.
The document deals with the settlement of still outstanding debts and the complicated book-keeping that it creates. It concerns dates which the fathers of B1 and B2 owed to the fathers of A1 and A2. Their sons discuss the terms of repayment, and B1 and B2 agree to deliver (nadānu) the still outstanding amount of 25;2.0 kor of dates in Arahsamna (VIII). They should deliver it to A1, and his brothers on the one hand, and A2 and his brother on the other hand. With respect to what has already been paid (eṭēru) in the past: D should show proof of it to A1 and A2 so that they can remove it (nasāhu) from their balance-sheet. With respect to the estimated income in dates from impost of the previous year: it was estimated at 100 kor based on the rate of 5 kor of dates per kor of land, and this amount has been (delivered and hence) deducted (šumqutu epēšu) from the balance-sheet. Should it now turn out that the exact amount of impost exceeds 100 kor (alla atāru), B1 and B2 must deliver the difference to A1 and A2 together with (itti) the pertinent documentation (u’iltu-šu). However, should it turn out that the impost is less than 100 kor (alla mâṭu), they can deduct (nasāhu) what they paid too much from (ina) their (abovementioned) still outstanding debt (u’iltu-šunu) to A1  and A2. The final matter that needs to be arranged in this context is the payment of a remuneration for the gardeners (šisinnu). It should be done in accordance with what can be read (amāru) in C1 and C2’s document (u’iltu) about the income from last year’s impost: in case the gardener’s remuneration has not been settled (eṭēru), they (who?) should “read” (amāru) 12 kor (of dates) as payment for the gardeners and pay (nadānu) it to him (who?) – partly uncl. This whole arrangement does not include what remains to be paid by B2’s father to A2’s father. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; A2 = Erība-Marduk/Bānūnu//Rab-banê; B1 = Šumu-ukīn/Etellu; B2 = Mardukāya/Kalbāya//Arad-Ea; C1 = Bānûnu, father of A2; C2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, father of A1; D = Iddin-Nabû (without affiliation)

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Vindication of a bondwoman.
Concerns fD, a bondwoman, previously owned by fC1 and her husband, then sold to A1 and his wife fA2, and now successfully vindicated by B from the last two owners. In the present document A1, the last owner, receives 1/3 minas and 3 shekels from B and as a result the latter should be considered the new owner of fD. There are two ina ašabi-witnesses: fE and fC1
 
A1 = Nabû-ēṭir/Iqīša/Šangû-Ninurta; fA2 = fBēlessunu/Nabû-zēru-ukīn, wife of A1; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; fC1 = fRēšat/Nabû-šumu-iddin/Sîn-tabni; C2 =Nabû-zēru-ušabši/ Nabû-nāṣir/ Bēl-aplu-uṣur; fD = fBānītu-tuklat, bondwoman of B; fE = fKabtāya/Bēl-uballiṭ//Išparu

elementText.text:
Receipt for assessed field rent, delivered in dates. Partial payment.
Concerns a broken amount of dates, part of the assessed field rent (imittu) for Darius’ 17th year. A, slave of C, receives (maḫāru) the dates as proxy for his master (našpartu), from B. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Rībâta, slave of C; B = Nabû-nāṣir/Nādin//Bābūtu; C = Širik (wr. mŠi-rik)/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price. Payment to sellers’ creditor.
fA1, A2 and A3 sold their slave (D) to B for 1 m 10 shekels of silver, their exact price (šīm harīṣ). They receive only part of the purchase price because the other part is used to pay off one of their debts. Accordingly, C, the creditor, receives (mahāru) a broken amount of shekels in payment for his claim (kum rašûtu) against the sellers. A2 and A3 receive (mahāru) x+9 shekels; and fA1 and …. [broken off] receive (eṭēru) the rest of the purchase price (amount is broken) from  the buyer. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fHibuṣu/Nabû-kāṣir//Malāhu; A2 = Nabû-apla-iddin; A3 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Damqa; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Ina-ṣilli-Bēl, slave of sellers.

elementText.text:
Receipt for boat-toll.
Concerns payments for boat-toll paid by slaves of E and the reimbursement for some of these payments. A (slave of E) made pass (etēqu Š) a boat loaded with onions, income from the 4th year of Cambyses, at the quay of Til-Gula.The silver he paid for boat-toll (miksu) are charged against B (ina muhhi), and it is made clear that he hasn’t received anything yet from him (mimma rašūtu  …  A ul mahir). D, another of E's slaves, paid silver for boat-toll (miksu) to C. No names of witnesses nor of the scribe.
 
A = Madān-Bēl-uṣur, slave of E; B = Ah-ilīa/Kiribtu; C = Rēmutu; D = Nabû-ayyalu, slave of E; E = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver. House rent.
A receives 5 shekels of white, medium quality silver from B according to …. [broken off] of Darius‘ 9th year. It is a payment for house rent . He has not yet received the silver that [he gave] to B for  refurbishing works on the house … [broken off].  The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Aplāya /Šamaš-iddin//Mubannû

elementText.text:
Receipt for onions.
A1 and A2 receive 75,000 bundles of onions from B. This does not include (elat) the 2,000 bundles of onions, which he has to deliver to C in Babylon. In case C will not need the onions, A2 will have 77,000 bundles at his disposal. Names of 3 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi) and the scribe.
 
A1 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnīya; B = Nergal-uballiṭ/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Sagdidi; C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price.
Concerns C’s purchase of D, one of the crownprince’s slaves, from A, the crownprince’s mayor domo (rab bīti), and the seller’s claim for payment of the purchase price. A receives 2/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver from B, who pays on C’s behalf and in the presence of C’s wife (fE) (ina ašābi). The silver with which B pays is income from the collection of tithes (ešrû) for the temples of Bēl, Nabû, Nergal and the Lady-of-Uruk. C, the buyer, is a secretary (sepīru) and slave in the crownprince’s service.
 
A = Nabû-ṣābit-qātī (rab biti of Belšazar, the crownprince); B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Nabû-ṣābit-qāte (sepīru; slave of Belšazar, the crownprince); D = Nabû-karābī-išme (slave of Belšazar, the crownprince); fE = fDēkitu, wife of C

elementText.text:
Summons to settle a debt of silver. Due from a member of the Egibi family.
By the 20th of Nisan (I) of the 14th year of Darius, shall B bring 1 mina of marked silver from A’s credit claim (rašûtu) that the latter holds against him (ina muhhi) and give it to A (našû-nadānu). If he fails to do so, he shall deliver 11 kor of barley instead of the silver to A in Ayyar (II). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ (=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Puhhuru/Nergal-iddin
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Probably purchase price of a slave.
A receives (mahāru)* 1/2 mina of medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy from B. Paid on behalf of (ana muhhi) C. This transfer of silver is also mentioned in Abraham2004001; analogous transfers are mentioned in MnB1870. It is probably linked to the sale document BM30927 in which B buys a slave from C and his brothers. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*l. 7 end: <ma-hir>.

A=Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Bēl-ēṭir//Šangû-Nanāya; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Bēl-nādin-apli/Bēl-uballiṭ//Pahāru
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
About onions, income from the impost on land. Share of the Treasurer.
The document probably records the receipt of 70 bundles of onions although the verb of receipt is not preserved. The onions are the income from the šibšu-impost on land (šibši eqli). It is the 1/3 share (zittu šalšu) of C, the Chief Treasurer (rab kāṣiri), and was received by one of his slaves (A1), who actually acted as proxy (našpartu) for another of his slaves (A2), from B1 and B2. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Bēl-ēṭir, slave of C; A2=...-ia, slave of C; B1=...šarru-uṣur; B2=Talīmu.../Hāziru; C=Bagasarū, (rab kāṣiri)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of ilku-silver by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment for the ilku-tax till the 1st of Dûzu? of the 15th year that is due from C1, C2, C3 and C4?. He receives it from B. The amount paid is 2 minas of marked silver. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Mukkēa/...//Bēl-eṭēru; C1=Nabû-ittannu/...; C2=Bēl-zēri/...; C3=Nidinti-Bēl/...; C4=Balāṭu/...

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver to the head of the Egibi family. Undertaking to return a register to the debtor upon repayment.
B should pay 50 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, which are due from him to A till the 20th Tašrīt (VII) of the 26th year of Darius. As soon as he has paid, the creditor should give the register (giṭṭu) of the LÚ.DÍM to him. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nabû-kuzub-ilī/Bēl-rēmanni//Eppeš-ilī

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family. Impost related to a bridge.
A receives payment (mahāru) from* B for the ilku-tax till the end of Addar (XII) of the 25th year of Darius. The tax is due from him for renting? (šá i-da-šú [idū]) the bridge (gišru) of Babylon which falls under the responsibility of (ina qātē) C. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

*l. 7 [ina ŠU].II (?).

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Bēl-asûa/Nabû-iddin//Bābūtu; C=Bēl-ēṭir (or -upahhir)

Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) till the end of Addar (XII) of the 25th year of Darius that is due from him. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širiktu/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Barsia/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Bābūtu.

elementText.text:
Receipt of persons together with the register of their enlistment. To tow boats.
The document records the receipt (mahāru) of six boat-towers (šaddidu) together with a boat*. The name of the recipient is not specified**. The men are identified by their full name (A-F). The first two had been received (e-ṭir-ú-tu? [eṭēru]) from G "of the bīt ipri-warehouse (for food allowances)" in accordance with the register of their enlistment (gišŠID). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe. Prosopographic links with the Egibi archive.

*ll. 3f. itti eleppi (GIŠ.MÁ) ša … (uncl) ša Darius šarri.
**unless we should read his name in l. 14

A=Libluṭ/Nādinu//MU-...; B=Erība?-Marduk/Bēl-uballiṭ//Nabû-uṣuršu?; C=Nūr-Sîn/Arad-Bēl//Šangû-Gula; D=Kuṣuraya/Līšir; E=Šamaš-iddin/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Ir’anni; F=Ardia/Eṭraya (rd. Kalbaya ?)//Suhaya; G=Bān-šarri-uṣur

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates and barley. Settlement of accounts.
B owes 10 kor of dates and 1.4 kopr of barley to A1 and A2. He should deliver the barley in Ayyār (II) and the dates in Arahsamna (VIII). He does not have to pay interest. They have (hereby) settled their accounts (epuš nikkassi itti ahameš qatû) till the end of the year (adi libbi Addaru). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-rēmanni/Marduk-mukīn-apli//Sîn-damāqu.

A1 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; A2 = Bēl-nādin-apli/Nergal-ušallim//Ile’’i-Marduk; B = Arad-Bēl/Kabtia//Pappāya

Promissory note for dates.
B owes a broken amount of kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Kislīm (IX) of Nebuchadnezzar's 40th year according to the 36 liters measure. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Madān?-šumu-ukīn/...//Munnabittu.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = ...limmir/Zakir//...

elementText.text:
Promissory note for onions and barley.
B owes 8400 strings (gidlu) of onions and 5;0.0.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered without interest in Ayyār (II) in Šahrinu. Should he fail to do so, he shall deliver the whole amount of onions and barley in Babylon (gamāru D-ma nadānu). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note between the same parties (that is still pending). However, claims (u'iltu) by C against B about assets that A invested in the business partnership (harrānu) have been annulled (hepû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-kīnu-iddin/Šadûnu//Šangû-Gula.

A = Nabû-zēru-ušabši/Marduk//Damqa; B = Mukīn-zēri/Nergal-epuš//Ea-eppeš-ilī; C = Bēl-nādin-apli

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Pledge of land.
B owes 50;0.0.0 kor of dates to A, slave of C. His field (eqlu) planted with date palms (bīt gišimmarē zaqpu) and grain (pî šulpi) that extends from the Borsippa canal till the ... [broken off] of the Urukeans and till the Zumi canal is pledged. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over this pledged property until the creditor has received the full repayment [of his silver]. In addition, there is a previous claim (rašûtu) by the same creditor. The (indebted) silver was given (to B) to (pay off) D. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-ēṭir/Rēmūtu//Arad-Nergal.

A = Nabû-ušēzib, slave of Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Šarrani/Nergalle'i; C = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēria//Nabāya; D = ...-uni

B1 and B2 owe oxen(?) ... [unclear] to A, to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). [Broken off] on the account of [broken off] of the creditor. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Ubār//Ša-nāšīšu.

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Madān-iddin/Ubar; B2 = Itti-Nabû-guzu (without affiliation)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1/2 mina of silver to A, to be paid without interest in Simān (III). He should also (ittû) deliver 45 bundles (pītu) of onions in Nisan (I), probably as interest in natura for the silver debt (on the basis that 45 bundles is the equivalent of ca. 4 shekels of silver) The (indebted) silver has been paid to C. There is also (elat) a claim (rašûtu) by D (against the same debtor). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Mušēzib-Bēl/Bēl-upaqu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili (debtor). 

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Ana-Bēl-upaqu//Šangû-Ištar-Bābili; C = Nabû-šumu-ukīn; D = Madān-bēlu-uṣur

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Very fragmentary.
B (name broken off) owes 1 mina and 56 shekels of silver to A. The rest of the document is broken off, including the names of the scribe.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, dates, barley and onions.
B owes 3 minas and 33 23/24 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, and 15;2.0.0 (kor) of dates, 31;2.0.4 (kor) of barley, 11000 strings of onions to A. The barley and the onions should be delivered without interest in Ayyār (II), in one payment according to the creditor's measure and on his land (or: house) (bītu). The dates should be delivered in Tašrīt (VII) under the same circumstances but with a 20% interest. The interest rate is 0;1.0.0 kor of dates for each kor of indebted dates. On the silver the debtor has been paying interest for the past seven days ("since the 1st of Nisan (I) of Nabonidus' 8th year"). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Tabnēa/Nabû-šumu-līšir.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-dīnu-epuš//Kinūnāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest.
B owes 2 1/24 shekels of silver to A, slave of C, to be paid without interest in Tašrīt (VII). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-bān-ahi/Nabû-mukīn-apli.

A = Nabû-mukīn-ahi, slave of C; B = Rēmūtu/Nergal-ina-tēšê-ēṭir; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Pledge of slave.
B owes 2 minas and 7 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered on the 10th of Ṭebēt (X), without interest. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor's slave (D). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged slave until the creditor has received the full repayment. C1 and C2 act as guarantors for the payment, assume warranty for each other, and the one among them who has silver available at the time of repayment will pay. The present document was drawn up in the presence of C1's wife (fE). Witnesses. A short remark at the end of the document clarifies that the silver, to which F is entitled, has been spent for Nabû-dīnu-epuš.

A = Sūqāya/Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti//Bābūtu; B = Nabû-ahu/Tabnēa//Ah-bāni; C1 = Lâbāši/Zēria//Nabāya; C2 = Nabû-šumu-iškun/Tabnēa//Ah-bāni; D = Nabû-dīnu-epuš, slave of B; fE = fGula-qa’’išat, wife of C1; F = Kalbāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 34 kor of dates to A1, his brothers and A2. It is the assessed field rent on land (imittu [eqli]) located at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal and includes (ina libbi) the 25 kor of dates from the 2 sectors located next to the Sîn-šadûnu family land. The passage regarding the terms of delivery is badly preserved. We can learn from it that B should deliver the dates at the old Kutha-canal together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give [spathes (tuhallu)], a load of firewood, [spadices (gipû)], fibres (mangagu), offshoots (liblibbu) […]. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). In addition, there is another claim (rašûtu) between the same parties that is still pending. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zeri//Bēl-eṭēru; B = Ninurta-ahu-iddin/…

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Fragmentary.
B owes 33 kor of dates to fA. Ṭhis is most likely assessed field rent ([imitti eqli]), but the pertinent passage at the beginning of the tablet is broken off, including the details on the land for which this rent is being paid. B should deliver the dates in one payment according to the 36 liters measure in the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood and 2 darīku- and qappatu-containers. Witnesses.
 
fA = fErištu/Širku//Egibi; B = Madān-iddin/Ubār

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Without interest. General pledge and third party guarantor.
B owes 12 minas of silver to A, mayor domo (rab bīti) of the crownprince, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Nisan (I). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s entire property in and outside the city. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged property until A has received the full repayment of his debt. C acts as guarantor for the payment. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-Ṣābit-qāti, mayor domo (rab bīti) of the crownprince; B = Šumu-ukīn/Mušallim-ilu; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for emmer wheat.
B owes 55 kor of emmer wheat to A, to be delivered in Simān (III). It is what remains (rīhtu) of the promissory notes of B which (are) in Pudanu under C’s jurisdiction (ša qātē) (partly uncl.). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for the 17th year. They have settled their accounts (epēš nikkassi qatû). Witnesses.
 
A = Bunene-ibni; B = Bunene-ibni/Šidiru(wr.ši-di-ru)-lūmur; C = Marduk/Bēl-īpuš//Mušēzib

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 208.0.0.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). In addition, he also owes 2 ½ minas of silver on which he pays interest since Nisan (I); C owes an unspecified amount of barley. The silver and the barley are what D invested in the business partnership. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe (= debtor): Balāṭu/Šamaš-iddin.
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Balāṭu/Šamaš-iddin; C = Bēl-Šarra-uṣur/Balāṭu; D = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 16.1.0.0 kor of barley to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Simān (III) at the canal in Babylon according to the royal measure. In addition, there is an ealier promissory note (between the same parties) for 4 kor of barley that is still pending. Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on the harvest, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 13.2.3 kor of dates to A. It is A's share (zittu) in the impost on the harvest (imitti ebūri) from land (eqlu) located opposite (muhhi) the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal. He should deliver the dates in one instalment according to A’s measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), offshoots (liblibbu), (and) fibres (mangagu), one load of firewood and 2 darīku-containers. A and B have not yet settled between them the accounts for the 15th year (epuš nikkassi qatû). B still needs to pay for the habû uhinni-tax and the šugarrû-supplement as stipulated in the promissory note (aki u'ilti) of last year (lit: of the 15th year). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Bēl/Nabû-uṣuršu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of a house. Fixation of interest at default.
B owes 1 mina and 54 shekels of unstamped (?) (la ginnu), medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Simān (III). The payment is secured by the pledge of his house located on the Hubur-street, next to the house of C’s sons. If the debtor fails to meet the deadline, he will apparently start paying interest on the debt starting from the 1st of Dûzu (IV), but the pertinent passage is badly preserved. Witnesses.
A = Nabû-balāssu-iqbi/Bēl-iddin//Damqa; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nergal-zēru-ibni

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 53 kor of dates to A1 and A2, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the Zabunu-ditch. He should deliver them in one instalment according to A1’s measure. Delivery is due in Tašrīt (VII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, payment for the habû uhinni-tax […], fibres (mangagu), and 2 darīku-containers. The debtor is not allowed to deliver the dates to anyone else without A1's consent (ša la). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Nabû-iddin/Kīnāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates and in emmer wheat.
B owes 26 kor [of dates] and 2.1.4 kor of emmer wheat (kunāšu) to A. It is the assessed field rent on land on land (imitti eqli) located at the Zabunu-ditch. The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure to the courtyard. Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the custormay amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, and 2 darīku-containers. The emmer wheat should be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). In addition, there is a promissory note for silver that is still pending against B. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) nor for the services of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu).
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-iddin

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on land, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 46 kor of dates to fA, revenue from the impost for Cyrus 3rd year on land (imittu) located above (eli) the New Canal. He should deliver the dates in one payment according to the 36 liters measure at the New Canal. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 1 darīku-container, and (dates for) the šugarrû-supplement. In addition, there is a promissory note for impost (imittu) to be delivered in dates from land below (šupālu) the New Canal. The gardener (nukarribu) has not received (eṭēru G Stat. sg.) a remuneration for the work (šissinnu) above (eli) and below (šupālu) the New Canal.
 
fA = fQudāšu/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Sūqāya/Arad-Bēl//Pappāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates, silver and onions. Payment for a debt. Pledge renewal.
B owes 105 kor of dates, 1/3 mina and 1 shekel of silver, (and) 42 bundles of onions to A. The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Tašrīt (VII). The silver and the onions should be delivered in full (šalāmu G) in Addar (XII) from the income of his onion field (šikittu)(*) The payment is secured by the pledge of land (eqlāti) which had already been given to the creditor (= pledge renewal). In addition, there are earlier promissory notes owed by B that are still pending. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledge land until A has received the full repayment of his debt. Witnesses.
(*)CF. CAD Š2, 431: ina ši(T: PI)-kit-tu4me <<šú>> eqlišu inandin.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nergal-nāṣir/Nādin

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2 owe 65 kor of dates to A1, A2 and his brothers as well as to A3. The dates are assessed field rent (imittu eqli) and should be delivered to the courtyard (haṣāru) in Arahsamna (VIII). The debtors assume warranty for each other. They should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), spadices (gipû), 42 loads of firewood, (and) 4 darīku-containers. In addition, there is a promissory note for imittu-rent between the debtors and A1 that is still pending. They (debtors and creditors?) should not change (enû) their accounts (epuš nikkassi). Witnesses. 
 
A1 = Erība-Marduk/Bānûnu//Rab-banê; A2 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; A3 = Dummuqu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Šamaš-udammiq/Nabû-bēlšunu//Rab-banê; B2 = Sūqāya/Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ//Itinnu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. With interest (at default).
B owes 1/3 minas 8 shekels of medium quality silver of which one-eighth is alloy to A. From Arahsamna (VIII) onwards he should pay a yearly interest of 20% on a monthly basis. He should pay in Arahsamna (VIII). Or, in other words, the debt will bear interest at default. Names of xxx witnesses; Scribe:

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Šullumu//Itinnu; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi
Promissory note for silver. With interest (at default).

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for a donkey.
Concerns a donkey but any further qualifications are lost in the badly preserved passage at the beginning of the document. A sold it for its full price, 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of medium-quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy to B. In the present document, A receives the full amount of silver, the purchase price for the donkey, from B.
 
A = Rēmūtu/Šamaš-ahu-iddin; B = Nidintu-Bēl/Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt (for dates?) according to a register.
Concerns something, probably dates that are listed in a register and that involves C, but the details are lost in a badly preserved passage at the beginning of the tablet (*). A receives it from B. Besides this there is an earlier register (lē'u). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Witnesses. (*) The beginning of the tablet reads: [...] according to the register on dates(?) C from […] A ag[ainst (?)] B.
 
A = Marduk-bāni-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Iddin-Bēl (/Marduk-iqīšanni//Bēl-ēṭiru); C =.../Libluṭ

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Remainder of purchase price for a field and a house.
Concerns 55 shekels of silver, besides the previously paid 1 mina and 2 shekels of silver, which are part of the 4 minas and 30 shekels of silver: this is the price for A’s plot of land and house at the Giššu-gate, which B bought from him against the payment of silver. A receives the said 55 shekels of silver from B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Zababa-iddin/Bēl-iddin//Adad-šammê; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price.
fB, wife of C, pays 10 shekels of silver, the remainder of the purchase price, to A. What A sold to her is not specified in the document. This payment is to be kept separate from the promissory notes, the previous receipts and the expenditure that is written down in a tablet that belongs to her and her husband (C) and are owed (to them) by A’s father (D). Further excluded are the 50 shekels of silver that A himself owes (to them), as well as the promissory notes (against him) that belong to C. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Šāpik-zēri//Ile’’i-Marduk; fB = fIna-Esagila-ramât, wife of C; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn); D = Šāpik-zēri//Ile’’i-Marduk

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for onions.  
Concerns 2 minas of marked silver which A1, A2 and A3 gave to B in order to buy onions. A2 receives the silver (back) from B and is paid off (mahāru-eṭēru). The receipt is in accordance with what A instructed (qibi) in the register (giṭṭu) on 1 mina of silver. The men who provided B with silver have no affiliation but all have titles: A1 is mayor domo (rab bīti) on behalf of the Kudurru family (Bīt K), A2 is once called scribe (ṭupšarru) and once priest (šangû), and A3 is a alphabet scribe (sepīru).
 
A1 = Nabû-šarru-bulliṭ, mayor domo (rab bīti) of the Kudurru-family; A2 = Iddin-Bēl (ṭupšarru). (šangû) (scribe); A3 = Nergal-šumu-iddin, alphabet scribe (sepīru); B = Širik/Iddināya (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C = Nabû-ittannu/Arad-Bēl

elementText.text:
Receipt for barley and silver.
Concerns 7 kor (c. 1,260 l) of barley, the produce (ebūru) from a field (eqlu) in Bit-Hahhuru and? a broken amount of silver that are owed to three brothers (A1, A2 and A3). In the present document A1 receives (maḫāru) all the indebted barley and? silver for C’s account (ana muḫḫi) from B. He should register his receipt of the 7 kor of barley with the two other creditors and give proof of it to B (ušuzzu – nadānu).
 
A1 = Šamaš-ēṭir/Nabû-uballiṭ//Ēṭiru; A2 = Bēl-ittannu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Ēṭiru; A3 = Ašarēdu/Nabû-uballiṭ//Ēṭiru; B = Širku (wr. mŠìr-ku)/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C = Ubār/Arad-Bēl//Ea-eppeš-ilī

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver. Settlement of accounts in Ayyār (II) of Nabonidus‘ 15th year.
Concerns a total of 5 1/2 minas of silver (not included the interest on it) that are at B’s disposal. This sum consists of 4 minas of silver, (income) from Simān (III) of the previous year, and 1 1/2 minas of silver, (income) from Tašrīt (VII) of the same year that B took from (našû) the outstanding assets (sūqu). Out of these 5 1/2 minas of silver A receives 59 shekels from B and therewith they have settled their accounts. In addition, B disposes over a promissory note for silver that is due to A and is dated in Kislīm (IX) of the previous year. He also disposes over the compensatory payment that was paid when he and his wife (fC) were absent last year in Ṭebēt (X) and thus caused a loss of income to his master (A).
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Nabû-uterri, slave of A; fC = fMiṣatu, wife of B

elementText.text:
Promissory note to deliver dates (imittu-lease) from land at the Rab-kāṣir Canal to the head of the Egibi family. One third is due to the Treasurer.
B should deliver 60 kor of imittu-dates that are due from him to A and his brothers in Arahsamna (VIII) according to his creditor's measure, in one instalment at the courtyard (haṣāru). 1/3 of it is the share of C, the Treasurer (ganzabaru). The dates are due from the harvest of a field located at the Rab-kāṣir Canal.
B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor he shall give a load of spadices (gipû), spathes (tuhallu) and fibres (mangagu), the offshoot(s) (liblibbu), and 2 darīku-containers. The sissinnu-payment has not been paid (eṭēru); and not even one cubīt of the stretch of the dam (mušannītu) (assigned to him for work) has been removed (nishu nasāhu) (partly uncl.) Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Bēl-ahu-ittannu/Ahhē-iddin; C=Bagasarū, (ganzabaru)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Establishment of a business partnership. Head of the Egibi family is the investor.
The present record, formulated as a standard promissory note, documents a business partnership agreement. A invested 51 kor of dates, income from the collection of tithes (ešru) for the temple of Bēl, in a business partnership (harrānu) with B. The latter owes him the dates (ša A ina muhhi B). The partners agree that they will share equally (ahi zittu akālu) in the profits (utru) that B makes (epēšu) of the dates in or out of town. B assumes warranty for the capital amount of the dates. The partnership is to last three years. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Šamaš-ina-tēšê-ēṭir/Šamaš-iddin//Šamaš-abārī
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Sale of a slave and receipt of the purchase price.
Three brothers, A1, A2, and A3, voluntarily sell their slave (C) to B for his harīṣ-price, 4 minas and 10 shekels of white medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. The sellers acknowledge their receipt (eṭēru) of the purchase price and guarantee against any challenger of the legality of the sale (sīhû), any claimant to a right of ownership over the slave (paqirānu), and any suit claiming the slave's semi-independent status (arad šarrūti, mār banûti or šušanûti). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Bēl-nādin-apli/Bēl-uballiṭ/Pahāru; A2=Nabû-iddin/Bēl-uballiṭ/Pahāru; A3=Na'id-Bēl /Bēl-uballiṭ/Pahāru; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Nabû-silim, slave of A1-3
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the ilku-tax till the end of Addar (XII) of the 24th year of Darius, in so much as it is the share (zittu) due from B. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Rēmūt-Bēl/Mušēzib-Bēl//Nanāya

elementText.text:
Security for a silver debt. Due from the head of the Egibi family and his brother. Pledge of land and mutual surety.
Two brothers (B1 and B2) owe 16 2/3 minas and 4 shekels of white silver, of which 1/8 is alloy […] to A. The debt bears a yearly interest of 20% to be paid on a monthly basis. Payment is secured by the pledge of real estate and the fact that each one of the debtors assumes warranty for the other. The one who has silver available at the time of repayment should give it to cover the capital amount (qaqqadu) and its interest (hubullu). Pledged are: (1) the debtors' orchard (zēru zaqpu) on the road to Kiš next to C1 and next to C2. (2) their acreage (zēru) in Bīt-Hahhuru next to D1 and next to D2. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until A has received full repayment of the capital amount and the interest. Names of 18 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Anu-mukīn-apli/Anu-ahu-iddin//Ea-qâlu-išemme; B1=Širku/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B2=Puršû/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C1=Iddin-Nabû/m...-ušēzib; C2=Nabû-šarru-ibni
D1=Arad-Marduk/Nergal-zēru-ibni; D2=m...-luṭu/Šadûnu

elementText.text:
Receipt of dates and barley by the head of the Egibi family. Partial repayment of a debt. Fragmentary.
The beginning of the document is broken. When the text becomes legible we hear about debts that were contracted to the debit of B (ina muhhi ~ e’elu). He owes 245.3.0 kor of dates and 8.1.2 kor of barley to A and 1/3 mina of silver to C, A’s slave. The current document records A’s receipt (mahāru) of part of this debt (ina libbi)* from B. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses. The remainder of the list of witnesses and the name of the scribe are broken off.

*Namely 58 kor of [...], x+1 kor of barley [...], and x x.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Nabû-māku-uṣur/Nabû-aplu-iddin. C=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of A

elementText.text:
Receipt of a person from the head of the Egibi family by an agent of the Commander of the Fortress. To serve in the Fortress of Babylon.
A receives (mahāru) a hireling? (lúa-gàr [agru]) from B, for the account of (ana ina sic! muhhi) C1 and C2 from whom the hireling was due. A acts by order of (ina iq-ba [ina qibi]) D, Commander of the Citadel (rab dūri). The hireling? is (to do service) for the Citadel (dūru) of Babylon till the end of intercalculary Addar (XII2) of the 26th year. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-rēmanni/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Šangû-Adad; B=Širik (wr. mši-rik-ki)/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C1=Šūzub/Uballissu-Marduk//Ṭābihu; C2= Gūzānu/Hambaqu//Mandidi; D=Addu-ēreš, (rab dūri)

element.description: Museum number of cuneiform tablet

elementText.text:
Sale of a boat to the head of the Egibi family and receipt of the purchase price.
A sells his boat to B for 4 minas and 10 shekels of unmarked silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, ša halla iṣṣur*. The seller assumes warranty for the uškûtu of his boat. He receives payment (eṭēru) for the purchase price (šīmu), namely the agreed upon amount of 4 minas and 10 shekels, from the buyer. The boat is a cargo-boat (rukubbu), 6 ½ cubīts wide at its beam (šaburru), with a keel? (šubat mê) of 20 cubīts, covered (kuttummu) with mats (šû), and loaded (elû Š) with cress!? (sahlû).** Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

*The meaning of the latter idiom is unknown (cf. CAD H, 43 s.v. halla).
**Ll. 1f. describes the boat as follows: eleppu šá 6 ½ KÙŠ ina muh-hi šá-bur-ru / rap-šú 20 ina 1 KÙŠ šu-bat me-e-šú; and ll. 21f. eleppu ku-tu-ut-┌mu┐ su-ú ru-kub-bi ? [(x)] / šá-ha-li-e ┌šu?┐-lu-ú.

A = Nabû-aplu-iddin/Lâbāši//Nūr-Papsukkal; B = Širik (wr. mši-rik-ki)/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 30;0.0.0 kor of barley to A, to be paid in one payment and according to the creditor's measure in Ayyār (II). Delivery is due at the entrance to the depot (kalakku) on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-iddin/Nabû-bān-zēri/M Maṣṣār-abulli.

A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-iddin//Egibi; B = Gūzānu/Rēmūtu//Arad-Nergal

elementText.text:
Pledge of a house for a silver debt.
B owes 2 minas of silver to A. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor's house located at the procession-road called "thoroughfare of Nergal-of-Joy" (mūtaq Nergal ša hadê). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged house until the creditor has received the full repayment. The (indebted) silver was paid to C (A's brother-in-law) and D. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-erība/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābi-išme.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nādinu/Arad-Gula//Lultammar-Adad; C = Lâbāši (=Bēl-ušallim)/Zēria//Nabāya; D = Nabû-šāpik-zēri/Balāssu//Ašpe

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver
B owes [x +] 13/24 shekels of medium quality silver to A, to be paid with silver of one-fifth alloy on the 25th of Šabāṭ (XI). The document ends by briefly mentioning an (additional, elat?) claim (by the same creditor) (rašûtu) against C. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-mukīn-apli without affiliation. 

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bazūzu/Nabû-kāṣir; C = Nabû-rēmanni

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of a slave.
B owes 1 mina of silver to one of his sisters (fA), to be paid in Šabāṭ (XI). The debt is secured by the pledge of the debtor's slave (C). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged slave until the debt is fully repaid. The document specifies the origin of this silver, namely, it is silver from the creditor's dowry. It is not clear whether this is silver from the patrimonium that the brother still had to give to his sister as (part of) her dowry, or silver from her dowry that she had borrowed to him? Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya.

fA = fZunnāya/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēria//Nabāya; C = Nabû-ušēzib, slave of Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēria//Nabāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Very fragmentary.
The first part of the document is broken off, but no doubt contained the names of the parties involved, the amount of dates that was to be paid as field rent and a description of the land from which they were to come. The text becomes legible at the point where the terms of delivery are discussed. The dates are due in Tašrīt (VII) and should be delivered [… at] the Kutha-canal together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), a load of firewood, spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), offshoots (liblibbu), (and) 2 darīku-containers. The document ends by stating that "he should deliver (them) on the 20th of [name of month broken off]". This may relate to the delivery of the dates, the by-products or both. Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Fragmentary
B owes a broken amount of dates to A. This is most likely assessed field rent ([imitti eqli]), but the pertinent passage at the beginning of the tablet is broken off, including the details on the land for which this rent is being paid. B should deliver the dates to the courtyard (haṣāru) in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products (ittû) of the date cultivation: a load of firewood, [spathes] (tuhallu), 50 spadices (gipû), [fibres] (mangagu), (and) 1 darīku-container. The document ends with a prohibiton to prune (arū D) any live part of the date palm (raṭbu). Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Bēl-iddin/[PN]//Pahāru

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on the harvest, to be delivered in dates.
B1, B2, B3 owe 27 kor of dates to A, impost on the harvest (imitti ebūri) from land (eqlu) located at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal. They should deliver the dates in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). They should also delivery(*) the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), (dates for) the šugarrû-supplement, and a load of firewood; as well as a broken amount of darīku-containers and 2 qappatu-baskets. The debtors assume warranty for each other. Witnesses.
(*) The verb is in the singular (ll. 11 and 13). Note that the entire passage (ll. 9-14) is characterized by erasures.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Balāssu//Šamaš-abārī; B2 = Iddin-Nabû; B3 = Habaṣīru

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and wool. Interest to be paid in barley and fixation of exchange rate.
B owes 23 5/6 shekels of silver to A. With regard to 20 out of the 23 shekels of indebed silver it is stipulated that B should pay 2 sūtu of barley (as interest) per shekel. The barley is to be paid according to its market value (mahīru) in Simān (III). He should also deliver 15 minas of wool in Ayyār (II). Witnesses
 
A = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Marduk-zēru-ibni//Nādin-še'im; B = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Fragmentary.
B1 and B2 owe 21 kor of dates A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the branch (bābu) of the old Kutha-canal. They should deliver the dates in one instalment at the canal. Delivery is due in in Arahsamna (VIII). They should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give (the customary amount of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), and one load of firewood. They will (also) pay for the habû uhinni-tax (and give) 2 darīku-baskets. A fragmentarily preserved elat-clause seems to refer to additional debts that are still pending. The document ends with a short but badly preserved passage about "2 kor for (ripening in) the oven" (tinūru). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B1 = Aplāya/Iqīša; B2 = Nabû-uṣuršu/Mušēzib-Bēl

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1/2  minas and 5(*) shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid on the 1st of Šabāṭ (XI) of the 19th year. Witnesses.
(*) Joannès (Achemenet website) reads: 4.
 
A = Bēl-ittannu/Iqīša-Marduk//Urnanna; B = Bēl-lummir/Ša-Nabû-šū

Promissory note for silver.
B owes 2 minas of silver to A, to be paid by the end of Ayyār (II). Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Pledge of land.
B owes 12 shekels of stamped (?) silver (ginnu), of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Dûzu (IV). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s arable land, located next to the creditor’s arable land, until the creditor has received the full repayment. The silver is the purchase price (šīmu) for dates that were harvested in Darius’ 10th year (on the debtor's land) (kaspu šīm suluppē ebūr eqli ša šanat 10). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Šāpik-zēri//Nādin-še'im

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and firewood. Interest to be paid in dates and fixation of exchange rate.
B owes 1 ½ minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A. He should pay 2 sūtu of dates (as interest) for each shekel of (indebted) silver. The dates are to be paid in Arahsamna (VIII) according to the exchange rate (mahīru) of Babylon. He should also provide 30 loads of firewood (hu-ṣa-bi!(HU) [huṣābu]). Archival evidence shows that B was travelling in Iran at the time this document was drafted. Witnesses.
 
A = Tattannu/Mušallim-Marduk//Imbušia; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Purchase price.
B owes ½ minas and 7 shekels of silver to A, to be paid on the 28th of Addar (XII). It is what remains to be paid of the purchase price for the slave fC. Cf. Liv019 and BM31426 (= Camb 143).
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Marduk-ahu-uṣur/Šilāya; fC = fMiṣatu, slave

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of slaves. Fixation of interest.
B owes 1 ½ minas and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Ayyār (II). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s slaves (C1 and C2) to A, the creditor(*).From Simān (III) onwards, the usual 20% of interest should be paid on a monthly basis. Witnesses. (*) rāšû "creditor" erroneously placed after B's name instead of A's.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Iddin-Marduk/Damqia (msig5-ia)//Gahal; C1 = Nabû-šunu-midanni, slave of B; C2 = Nabû-ṣābit-qāti, slave of B

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt by a third person
fA1 and A2 (her husband) receive the ½ mina and 5 shekels of silver that B owes to fA1. The silver is paid to them by C.  fD, a slave who also goes by the name Šalam-dīninni was pledged (to secure the debt), and should no doubt be returned to the debtor. Note that the creditors had under-pledged this slave for one of their own debts (BM33156 = Nbn 390). Further note that four days later, B sells fD, his slave (together with two other slaves), to Iddn-Marduk/Iqīšaya/Nūr-Sîn who sends C, his son-in-law to pay to the seller: BM30810 (= Nbn 392) records B's receipt of the purchase price. 
 
fA1 = fBunanītu/Na’id-Marduk/Ṣāhit-ginê; A2 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Ēṭiru (husband of fA1); B = Nabu-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni/Nappāhu; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fD = fṬābatu (aka: Šalam-dīninni), a slave

elementText.text:
Fixation of interest on a silver debt. Related to a house sale.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 1 mina and 38 ½ shekels of silver to A, on which they should pay a yearly interest of 20% on a monthly basis starting from the 1st of Simān (III) of Nabonidus 5th year onwards. The indebted silver is what remains (to be paid to A for the loan of 2 minas and 10 shekels that he lent to the couple) for the purchase of C's house. The sale is recorded in BM32871 (= Nbn 85) and the issue of A's loan to the couple recounted in BM33945 (= Nbn356). See also MMA79.7.35 and BM31675 (= Nbn 1104).
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Apla-dād-natan/Addia; fB2 = fBunanītu, wife of B1; C = Ibāya/Ṣillāya//Nagāru

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver, payment for obligatory service. Fragmentary.
The beginning of this tablet is broken off. A (whose name is lost), acting as proxy  ([ina našparti]) for C receives silver (the amount is broken) from fB, for the urāšu-service of her husband D. This does not include (elat) the silver that the creditor has already received from E nor the hired men (agru) who perform their task (dullu epēšu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = ... (name broken); C = Nūrea/Bēl-iqīša//Šangû-Nanāya; fB = Ina-Esagila-ramât, wife of D; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; E = Iddināya ( = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi)

Receipt for straw bunches
A1 and A2, slaves of C, receive 93 bundles of straw (makṣaru ša tibni) from B, a slave of D. Witnesses
 
A1 = Ana-muhhi-Bēl-amur; A2 = Nabû-bulliṭanni, slave of C; B = Nabû-ālši-ul-abâš, slave of D; C = Rēmūt-Bēl; D = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Receipt for barley. Payment for impost.
Concerns 15 kor (c. 2,700 l) of barley, payment for the sūtu-impost on barley from land (details lost) in Darius’ 10th year. The land belongs to A1 and is at B’s disposal. A1’s father (A2) receives the barley from B by orders of his son. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 12 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Bel-iddin/Mušēzib-Marduk//Ēṭiru; A2 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Apkallu//Ašlāku; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for either dates or barley.
A receives from B, slave of C, some kind of agricultural produce that was due from him. The exact kind of produce and the amount received are broken off. Payment is in the 30-liters measure (lit. 6 mašīhu per kor). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Ea-nāṣir/Mušallim(//Šangû-Nanāya); B = Arad-Bēl, slave of C; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver. Partial payment for a debt.
A receives 2 1/3 minas and 4 shekels of silver, a partial payment from B1 and B2, part of the 5 1/2 minas and 4 shekels of silver that they owe him. The debt was secured by the debtors’ mutual warranty. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B1 = Aplāya/Mušallim-Marduk//Iddin-Amurru; B2 = Ardia/Silim-Bēl//Šangû-Ea

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for dowry slaves.
Concerns the sale of slaves from fE’s dowry and the receipt of the purchase price about which a contract had been concluded between A, her husband, in the presence of his father (D), and B, the buyer. In the present document, A receives 3 minas 48 shekels of silver from the purchase price from B. He acts on C’s orders, who is his father-in-law. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-zēru-ibni/Šambā’; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin(/Šulāya//Egibi), father of A; fE = fNuptāya, daughter of C and wife of A

elementText.text:
Receipt for oxen that had been brought along.
Concerns 5 oxen belonging to A, which B, slave of C, brought along (abāku). The present document confirms that B has returned them and handed them over to A (târu-nadānu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir/Nergal-šumu-ibni; B = Madān-bēl-uṣur, slave of C; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt and return of promissory note.
Concerns the promissory note for a debt of 5 5/6(*) shekels of medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy, that B owes to A, slave of C. It does not include something which is lost in a broken passage. D1 und D2, A’s messengers, receive (eṭēru) the silver together with its interest from B. They have promptly returned the promissory note related to the payment for A to the debtor (târu-nadānu). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe. (*) Or: 5 1/3 (?).
 
A = Girāya, slave of C; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Nabû-bân-ahi; D1 = Lâbāši/ Nabû-kēšir/Ēṭiru; D2 = Nabû-bullissu/Ahhē-iddin

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Related to sheep and a mule.
The text concerns debts that B owes to A, partly being paid in the present document and partly still outstanding. The first (u'iltu) debt concerns 657 sheep which B owes to A: B receives all the silver (that was promised to him), the earlier and later amounts, from A and D guaranteed for the delivery of the animals. However, the text record that he still owes silver for a mule and something else that is lost in a badly preserved passage. A receives from B payment for the interest on the silver of C till the end of Intercalary Ulūl (VI2) and the 10 shekels of silver, the capital amount of C. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-iqīša/Lâbāši; C = Iddināya; D = Gimil-Šamaš

elementText.text:
Summons to settle debts with the head of the Egibi family. 
This document and BM33962 are near duplicates. Until the 10th of Šabāṭ (XI) of the 20th year of Darius, can B bring evidence on whatever he has paid off (eṭēru) of the debts (u'iltu) of silver, barley, dates and cattle which he owes to A2, slave of A1, and he will show it to his creditor's master (našû-kalāmu). If on the 15th of Šabāṭ (XI) he has not yet done as agreed he will have to pay (eṭēru) silver to his creditor's master according to what they agreed upon (aki) in their promissory notes (u'iltu). Names of 9 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); A2=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of A1; B=Bēl-upahhir/Nergal-iddin
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of barley and dates to the head of the Egibi family. Refers to the debtors' bow-land.
Concerns 70 kor of barley and 200 kor of dates that B1, B2, and B3 owe to A. They should deliver the barley in Ayyar (II) of the 14th year and the dates in Tašrīt (VIII) of the same year. Delivery should be in one instalment, in front of the storehouse (maškattu) for the barley, and at the courtyard (haṣāru) for the dates. A badly preserved passage at the end of the obverse refers to the debtors' bow-land (bīt qašti)* of which 3/10 each belong to (3-ta ušrēti) the herdsmen (rē'û ginê), the gaṭṭāya-workers and the mār-damqa(-soldiers?). The location of the land is further specified, with reference to “the Piqūdu Canal till the mooring place (makallû)”, but the passage is badly preserved. A trained heifer (burtu) (ummânu) is also mentioned. Names of 10 witnesses and the scribe.

*[x-b]i É GIŠ.BAN.MEŠ-šú-nu

A=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B1=Nidinti-Bēl/Nabû-šumu-iddin; B2=Bāba-ēreš/Nabû-rībi-uṣur; B3=Nabû-zēru-ibni/Aššur-abu-uṣur
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for rikis qabli. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A1 receives (mahāru) a broken amount of minas of silver, the remainder (rīhtu) of 6 minas of silver, from B. The silver is paid for the rikis qabli duty from Nisan (I) of the 2nd year until the end of Addar XII) of the 3rd year of Darius. It was due to A2, A1's father and has been given to him (nadānu G Stat.) by order of (ina qibi) C, Governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēmi), from (ultu) the house of B. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe

A1=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk; A2=Arad-Marduk/Kittia//Šangû-Ea; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C=Bēl-aplu-iddin, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Renting of a small house at the harbor and a loft.
Concerns a harbour house (bīt kāri) and a loft (rugbu) at the (ina muhhi) ┌b/pur┐-ra-ku (uncl.) that belongs to C. A, acting as proxy for (našpartu) the latter, rents it (ana idi nadānu) to B for 4 liters (qû) of bread (and)? 1 liter (qû) 5 [x] of outstanding! quality (babbanû) per day. This is followed by a clause stressing that B is not allowed to interrupt (baṭlu šakānu) the delivery of the 4 liters of bread, which is the rent for the buildings, and should pay rent before the 20th of Kislīm (IX). The buildings will be at his disposal till the end of month x (=broken) of the 36th year. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-kiṣuršu/Rēmūtu//…; B=Nidintu/Bēl-ahhē-erība; C=Nidintu/Šiški (=Nidintu/Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Undertaking under oath to bring along one’s sons.
A declares under oath (tamû) by Bēl, Nabû and Darius to B that he will bring (abaku) his two sons (C1 and C2) by the 1st of Second Addar (XIIb). The reason is indicated but broken off*. He will bear the guilt of a transgression against the king (hīṭu ša šarri šadādu) and [...] if he fails to do so. Names of 7 witnesses. The scribe is Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi).

*l. 5: ša ana [...] "who for/to [...]".

A=Mīnû-ana-Bēl-dānu/Nabû-šumu-uṣur//...; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšīšu
C1=Nidintu/Mīnû-ana-Bēl-dānu; C2=Mušēzib-Bēl/Mīnû-ana-Bēl-dānu

elementText.text:
Renting of a boat to a member of the Egibi family.
A rents (ana idi nadānu) a boat to B for 0.1.0.4 kor of dates a day, starting the following day. The boat belongs to C but is at A’s disposal (ina pāni) for boat-service duty (malahūtu). B does not have to pay (manû) for each day that the boat remains at the mooring place (makallû). A assumes warranty for loading (elû Š) 350 kor of dates on the boat. He will release? (zakû D) the measure of Bīt?-x-x-x (uncl.). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Aplaya/Iddinaya; B=Nidintu/Šiški//Egibi (=Nidintu/Marduk-nāṣir-apli//Egibi); C=Nabû-ēṭir-napšāti/Haddaya

elementText.text:
Receipt of flour. Paid on behalf of the head of the Egibi family. Rations for one month.
A receives (mahāru) a broken amount of flour (qēmu) from B, as payment for his rations (kurummatu) from the 1st of Arahsamna (VIII) till the 1st of Kislim (IX). The flour is paid for C’s account (ana muhhi). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Amur-qannu; B=Nādinu/Iddinaya; C=Širku/Iddinaya (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Renting of a boat to the head of the Egibi family.
A rents (ana idi nadānu) a boat to B for a broken amount (x minas) of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, starting in two weeks. The boat is 6 cubīts [wide at its beam]? and belongs to C, a clerk (sepīru), but was put at A’s disposal (ina pāni) for boat-service duty (malahūtu). A fragmentarily preserved clause relates to the use that may be made of the boat and any possible infringements in this respect: the boat may (or should?) sail to ... (uncl.) the old? Canal (ul-te-bal [abālu Š]), and if B ... (uncl.) he will pay x minas to C. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Kīnaya; B= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C= Arad-Šamaš?, (sepīru of PN)

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment (and)? the advance payment on the bow-tax by the head of the Egibi family. Impost related to a bridge. Paid on behalf of a third party.
The ilku-tax for “the supplement to the bridge” (ṭipi ša gišri)* from Dûzu (IV) of the 26th year of Darius till the end of Simān (III) of the 27th year is due from C. A receives it (mahāru) from B for C’s account (ana muhhi). A short remark at the very end of the obverse, before the witness list, states that he (also?)** receives (mahāru) an advance payment on the bow-tax (panāt qašti). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*ṭipi ša gišri probably refers to a supplement that had to be paid to the bridge toll (see Jursa 2010, xxx).
**The verb of receipt (mahir) occurs twice: once with ilku ša B (ll. 1-7) and once with pānāt qašti (l. 8) as direct object. These could be seen as two different taxes or service obligations, or the latter could be a specification of the more general ilku.

A = Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B = Iddinaya/Qīštia; C = Nabû-nādin-ahi/Aplaya

B owes 90000 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, to be delivered in Nisan (I) on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu) ... [the rest of the tablet is broken off]. Names of the witnesses are broken off and the scribe: .../...//Bēliau.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B1 and B2 owe 9 shekels of medium quality silver of which one-fifth is alloy to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be paid on the 20th of Simān (III).  The silver is "of the onion habor" (kāri ša šūmi), meaning that the debt results from an onion transport by boat and the costs related to such transports (cf. BM31097). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Mušēzib-Nabû//Nabû-šeme.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B1 = Bēl-ahhē-erība/Nabû-nāṣir//Pahāru; B2 = Marduk-nāṣir/Bēl-iddin//Re'i-sīsê

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates.
B, slave of C owes a broken amount of dates to A, to be delivered in [the name of the month is broken off]. He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor he shall give a load of firewood (huṣābu), spathes (tuhallu) and offshoot(s) (liblibbu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nādinu/Nergal-ēṭir/Bābūtu

A = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-kuṣranni, slave of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of slave.
B owes 1/3 minas of silver to A, to be paid in Dûzu (IV). In addition, there is an earlier claim (rašûtu). The document is mainly concerned with the details pertaining to a female slave (fC) whom B got as pledge from D and then pledged to A (maškānu šakānu).  This slave was currently with fE, D's sister-in-law (kallatu) and therefore unavailable to B's creditor, so that the latter took the current document (šaṭāru) as security (maškānu) instead.
Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Ina-Esagil-šumu-ibni/Dayyān-Marduk//Mušēzib.  

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Ahu-ittabši/Laqipi; fC = fGudaditu, female slave of Šumu-iddin/Nergal-zēru-ibni; D = Šumu-iddin/Nergal-zēru-ibni; fE = fBu'ītu, wife of Nādinu/Šumu-iddin and daugther-in-law of D

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and onion.
B, slave of C1 and fC2(?)* owes 13 1/8 shekels of silver, 26 bundles and 600 strings of onions to A, to be paid (šalāmu G) (in natura) from the income of his onion field (šikittu) in Nisan (I). His master received 4 shekels of silver as compensatory payment (mandattu) for his loss of income from the absence of his slave (B), as well as that of two other slaves fD and fE (who must have been family members of B). F has a share in the profits (utru). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe. Third witness is C1. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ṣillāya//Esagilāya.
*fC2 could also be co-debtor
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-ušēzib, slave of C1 and fC2; C1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Zēria//Nabāya; fC2 = fZunnāya/Zēria//Nabāya; fD = fBābunu; fE = fNarū; F = Nabû-ušallim

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest
fB owes 12 shekels of silver to fA, to be paid without interest in Arahsamna (VIII) of Nabonidus 3rd year. There are also (elat) barrels (dannu) pledged to the creditor: they are at her brother's disposal (C). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Probably related to harbour costs.
B, a judge (dayyānu) owes 1/2 mina of silver to A, master of the royal harbour (rab kāri ša šarri), to be paid in Addar (XII). It is what remains to be paid (rīhtu) of the 2 1/2 minas of silver ina hu-sá-e ša šarri (uncl.)(*)

Notes: Spar 2000 (CTMA 3), 55 translates "(silver) in scraps, owed to the king", but Van Driel 2002 (Elusive Silver), 277: uncl.

A = Nabû-rēmu-šukun/Šūzubu, master of the royal harbour (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, judge (dayyānu)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. General pledge.
B1 and B2 owe 10 minas of silver to A1 and A2, to be paid at the end of Dûzu (IV). They should pay a yearly interest of 20% on a monthly basis. The debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver available at the due date shall pay. All their property in and outside the city are pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until the creditor has received the full repayment of the debt. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-erība/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābī-išme (B1).

A1 = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; A2 = Šaddinnu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Mandidi; B1 = Marduk-erība/Iqīšāya//Sîn-karābī-išme; B2 = Šaddinnu/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Mandidi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on the harvest, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 22? kor of dates to A, his brothers and the sons of C. It is the impost on the harvest (imitti ebūri) from land (eqlu) that [broken off].  He should deliver the dates to the courtyard in one payment according to A’s measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), spadices (gipû), (and) 2 darīku-containers. No payment has been received for the tithes(?) (ešru, wr. eš-r[u?]. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Barsipāyya/Nabû-mār-šarri-uṣur; C = [the name is broken off]

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 1.1.3.3 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in full (gamru) to Ālu-ša-Ahu-iddin Delivery is due in Tašrīt (VII). It concerns C’s investment in a business partnership (with the parties mentioned above). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Aplāya//Rēš-Bānitu; C = Iddin-Marduk(/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn).

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest. Payment for a debt.
B, a temple oblate (širku) owes 1 ½ minas of silver to A, to be delivered with interest (hubullu) in Kislīm (IX). The interest is fixed at 20%, to be paid on a monthly basis. There exists a written (?) document about the payment (terms). A guarantees for the payment of what is (booked) to B's debit in the register of Bēl. B will pay through/in [broken off] to the creditor. Witnesses
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Lâbāši/Bēl-rēṣūa, a temple oblate (širku)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley. Fragmentary.
Concerns 7 kor of barley, assets in the undivided property (qaqqad karê) that belongs to A1, and A2. The barley is at B's disposal (probably to do business with) and he should pay it back in Ayyār (II) according to his share in [broken off]. The document may have a business-related background. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Bānûnu/Ṣillāya//Rab-banê; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Kalbāya/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi//Arad

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 60 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent (imittu) on land(*) located (at) the New Canal. The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to A’s measure in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), [a load] of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. This is followed by a clause the exact meaning of which remains unclear: 3 gur ú-ṣab-bat 3 gur a4? [x (x)]-nu?-nu-ri ┌i-na?-ad┐-[din]. The document concludes by pointing out (twice!) that the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu) has been paid (etēru G Stat), but no payment has been received for the services of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). Witnesses.
(*)im[itti (eqli)].
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Gimil-Šamaš/Līšir//Šamaš-bari

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 28 kor of barley to A. From this amount, 16 kor should be delivered on the 20th of Kislīm (IX) in Alu-§a-libbi-URU.A.A to C (the creditor's slave). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for cattle which are at B's disposal within a share farming agreement. He received seeds and fodder for the cattle for Darius' 15th year from A. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-edu-pitin/Balāṭu; C=Nabû-ayyālu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and onions.
B owes 55 1/24 shekels of (silver) and 110 bundles (pītu) of onions to A, slave of C, to be delivered without interest in Nisan (I). The debt should be paid with the income from his onion field. The (indebted) silver is the amount that has been paid to the temples of Nergal and Nabû. In addition, there is a claim (rašûtu) by D against B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ibni/Nergal-zēru-ibni//Šangû-Nanāya.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Hašdāya; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Madān-bēlu-uṣur
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 33 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land located opposite (muhhi) the Ile''i-Bēl sluice (bitqu). The dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure at the end of Arahsamna (VIII) to the courtyard (haṣāru). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood (and) 2 darīku-containers. The harvest from the 0;0.3 kor acreage that belongs to the undivided patrimonium (karû bīt abi) is included (ina libbi) into the above amount of dates.  Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-ušallim/Bēl-ibni//Gallābu
