elementText.text:
Receipt for onions.
Concerns the receipt of the purchase price for onions which A sold to B.
The beginning of the tablet is badly preserved but refers to a broken amount of onions, a slave, and the xth year of Cyrus. It then continues by stating that 5,000 bundles belong to D, thus resulting in a total of 42,000 bundles of onions for the 5th year of Cyrus. C, slave of B, received them from A’s messenger. In the present document A receives the silver for the sale of these 42,000 bundles of onions from the buyer (B) and is paid off. This does not include the 48,000 bundles of onions, which a man whose name is broken off* will deliver to B in Simān (III) of the xth year of Cyrus. Besides this there exists an earlier claim by B (against the same person). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
*Perhaps again A or his messenger?
 
A = Nergal-ahu-iddin; B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; C = Madān-bēl-uṣur, slave of B; D = Nergal-ēṭir

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver.
Concerns the promissory note (u’iltu) for a debt of 2 minas and 1 shekel of silver which A paid to C1 for barley. Of this amount, A received 1 minas and 1/2 shekels of silver from B, as far as this is B’s share (zittu) and 23 shekels from the 1/3 share. He also receives 23 shekels from the 1/3 share (put šalsu i-ši, unclear). Then, in a broken context A receives from B something that he gave to C2 and C1 in Addar (XII). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.  
 
A = Iddin-Marduk;  B = Zababa-ahu-iddin; C1 = Šumu-iddin; C2 = Nabû-ēṭir

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver.
Concerns the promissory note (u’iltu) pertaining to a debt that C1 and C2 owe to D and which has been transferred to A (possibly as new creditor). In the present document A receives 18 ½ of silver from this debt from B. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Līširu; C1 = Iddinnunu/Nabû-damiq//Arrabi; C2 = Kiribtu/Nabû-…-iddin//Mutakkil; D = Šamaš-…

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt.
Concerns the promissory note for a debt of 30 shekels which two slaves (B1 slave of D1 and B2 slave of D2) owe to fA, slave of fC. It is provided that should a promissory note turn up in the creditor’s house it is considered void because the debtors paid it (i-te-ṭir-ru-u’ [eṭēru]), according to their share. Name of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA = fMahitu, slave of fC; B1 = Ṣilli-Bēl, slave of D1; B2 = Hiṭūa, slave of D2; fC = fIna-Esagila-ramât/Zeria//Nabāya; D1 = Nabû-aplu-iddin; D2 = Šamaš-pir’a-uṣur

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for a donkey.
A receives* 10 shekels of silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, from B for the donkey he sold to him. The donkey is qualified as kam-maš-šu (uncl.). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Witnesses

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver paid on behalf of the head of the Egibi family. Partial payment of a debt.
A receives* 3 minas and 45 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy from B, paid on behalf of (ana muhhi) C. This silver is part of (ina) a larger claim (rašûtu) that A holds against C. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. The list of witnesses is broken off at the beginning, but is preserved in the duplicate document BM31869 (=Dar 472).

*Verb of receipt is broken.

A=Šaddinnu/Madān-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa; B=Nidintu/Kabtia//Ir'anni; C=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and onions to a member of the Egibi family. Fixation of default interest.
B should deliver 140 bundles of first-rate onions (babbanû) and 1 mina of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) that are due from him, to A. The onions he should deliver in Arahsamna (VIII); the silver in Simān (III). The debt bears a yearly interest of 20% to be paid on a monthly basis. In addition (elat), there is a previous debt of 140 bundles of onions. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Bēl-upahhir/Nergal-iddin
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment from the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) of the 26th year till the end of Addar (XII) of the 27th year of Darius that is due from the latter. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šamaš-iddin/Arad-Marduk//Dēkû; B=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Gūzānu/Hambaqu//Mandidi

elementText.text:
Undertaking to bring along thieves who deceived the household of the Egibi family. On the 1st of Simān (III) of the [xth year of Darius], shall A bring along (abāku) the thieves (sāru) and hand them over (nadānu) to B. It concerns the thieves in the area between the Canals (birīt nārāti) in the town of the resident (qīpu) who acted treacherously (niklu nakālu)* against the House of B. In addition (elat), there is a credit claim (rašûtu) which A (still) owes to B. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

*Ll. 3-5 read with Baker 2004 ni-i[k-lu] … ik-kil!-┌lu!┐ (instead of ni-i[k-...] ... ik-si-┌šú┐ in editio
princeps.

A=Arad-Bēl/m...//Ēṭiru (=?Ardiya/Marduk-šarrāni// Ēṭiru); B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley by a (royal) official from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for transport costs. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, clerk (sepīru) appointed over the female flour millers (ša qēmēti), receives (mahāru) 20 kor of barley from B to cover the costs of transporting (gimru) 200 kor of barley "of the estate' (makkūru). He acts by order of (ina qibi) C, Governor of Babylon. The barley that needs to be transported is income from the collection of fixed rent (sūtu), due to D1 and D2 (without official titles). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Mamûzu/Ṭābia, (sepīru); B= Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D1= Iddin-Bēl; D2= Tanda

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Purchase price for a boat. Prompt return of the promissory note about the boat to the payer.
A receives (mahāru) 4 minas and 10 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, the price of his boat, from B according to his promissory note (u’iltu). He has returned (târu D-nadānu) the document (u’iltu) about the boat that had been issued (rakistu), sealed (kaniktu) and entrusted (paqdu) to C, to B. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-aplu-iddin/Lâbāši//Nūr-Papsukkal; B=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Niqūdu

elementText.text:
Receipt of a boat-tower by the head of the Egibi family. From the Governor’s pool of forced labourers. Reference to a register.
A receives (mahāru) one forced labourer (urāšu) from B, for the account of (ana muhhí) C. The labourer is to tow boats (šaddidu) to the quay, under the administrative authority (ša qātē) of D, Governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēmi), for 2 months and 2 days in the 24th year of Darius. A receives, together with the labourer, the previous register (giṭṭu) regarding service in the month Dûzu (IV). The text also refers to E but it is unclear how he is related to the transaction (for possible interpretations, see Abraham 2004, 274-275). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Bēl-uballiṭ/Iddin-Nabû//Bā'iru; C=Bēl-.../Zēria//MU-...; D=Ina-Esagil-lilbur, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); E=Bēl-erība/...

elementText.text:
About persons and their enlistment.
The document is badly preserved and poorly understood. It starts by referring to two persons, A1 and A2, together with the registers of their enlistment (gišŠID), but then becomes very fragmentary. The king is mentioned, as well as B, Governor (šākin ṭēmi) of Babylon, some additional lists and a kind of professionals or labourers (lú[...]). At the end we should probably read "have received", thus assuming that A1 and A2 received several persons together with the registers about their enlistment. Sirik/Iddinaya (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu), head of the Egibi family, is among the witnesses. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Rēmūtu/Marduk-ušallim//Pahāru; A2=Libluṭ/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Sīsê; B=Gūzānu/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšīšu; C=… (broken)

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment (and)? the entire flour-tax by the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) till the end of Addar (XII) of Darius’ 24th year that is due from him. The exact amount that is paid is not specified. A short remark at the very end of the obverse, before the witness list, states that A (also?)* receives payment (mahāru) from B for his entire flour-tax (qēmu) for the 24th year. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*The verb of receipt (mahir) occurs twice: once with ilku ša B (ll. 1-7) and once with qimešu gammar (ll. 8-10) as direct object. These could be seen as two different taxes or service obligations, or the latter could be a specification of the more general ilku.

A=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nabû-ittannu/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Suhaya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for onions.
B owes 2400 strings (gidlu) of onions to A. In Ayyār (II), the debtor should deliver quality strings  on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-zēru-ibni/Nabû-ēṭir.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nādin-ahi/Bēl-rēmanni//Damqāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley.
B owes 66;3.2.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered in their full amount (gamru) in Ayyār (II). Delivery is due on the creditor's plot of land (bītu) at the Borsippa canal. This barley was given (to B) (nadānu, G Stat) to buy seeds and pay for the maintenance of the farmers (ikkaru). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nergal-uballiṭ/Nabû-bān-ahi.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nergalahu-iddin/Ahhea

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Payment for harbor costs.
B owes 6 1/2 shekels of silver of which one-fifth is alloy to A, the royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri), to be paid in Simān (III). The silver is for covering the harbor costs that are made in the course of an onion transport (kasap kāri ša šūmi). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Šangû-Ninurta.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Širiktu/Nūrea//Dannea

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Pledge of two individuals (slaves?).
B owes 1 mina and 12 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eigth is alloy, to A, to be paid without interest in Abu (V) of the next year (lit. "Nabonidus 9th year"). The debt is secured by the pledge of two individuals (fC and D). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged person until the debt is fully repaid. A fragmentarily preserved passages seems to refer to the debtor's legal purchase of the two individuals and antichresis. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-aplu-uṣur/Šākin-šumi//Adad-šumu-ēreš.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nidintu/Nabû-šarru-uṣur; fC = fAlikšu-lūmur; D = Mušēzib-Nabû.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest. General pledge.
B1 and B2 owe 12 minas and 30 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered with interest in Dûzu (IV). They have been paying 20% interest on a monthly basis since the 1st of Ṭebēt (X). All their property in and outside the city are pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until the creditor has received the full repayment of his silver and the interest. The debtors also assume warranty for each other. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Marduk-bān-zēri//Bēl-eṭēru.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Kidin-Marduk; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Zēria//Šangû-Gula

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley, onions and silver.
B, the harbor master's (C) slave, owes 80 kor of barley, 25000 strings (gidlu) of onions and 30 shekels of silver of which one-eighth is alloy to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Dûzu (IV) in their full amount (gamāru D-ma nadānu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-aplu-iddin/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Šangû-Ninurta.

A1 = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; A2 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Lâbāši, slave of C; C = Gimillu, (royal) harbor master (rab kāri)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest.
B owes 16 shekels of silver to fA(*), to be paid with interest in Dûzu (IV). The debt bears a yearly interest of 20%. C1 and C2 act as guarantors for the payment. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.
 
Notes: (*) The creditor's name is collated. She is the wife of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn. Consequently, the text does not refer to sister (Šilīm-Nanāya) (against Tallqvist and Shiff).

fA = fIna-Esagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Etellu//Adad-šumu-ēreš; C1 = .../Bēlusatu//Balāṭu; C2 = Šumu-ukīn/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Nuhašu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Pledge of land.
B owes 10 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor's land at the Nergal canal. In addition, there is another claim by the same creditor which is secured by the pledge of the debtor's land at the Tupašu canal. The first and the second instalments for the poles (tallu)(*) of the smith (without LÚ) have been paid. Witnesses.


Notes: (*) CAD T, 100 s.v. tallu A "crosspiece, crossbeam, pole".
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Šumu-iddin

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Fragmentary
fB, slave of Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi, owes 60 kor of dates to A, to be delivered on the 20th of Kislīm (IX) at the river in Babylon. She should also pay for the costs of transporting  these dates. Payment is in the measure of [PN]. C acts as guarantor for the payment. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note, but at this point the document is broken off. The document refers to Hursagkalamma in a broken context, probably in relation with the origin of the dates.

A = Bēl-aplu-iddin/Rēmūtu//Pahāru; fB = fAhunnatu, slave of Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli)//Egibi; C = …/…//Mukallim-x

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2 owe 12 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli)(*) located above (eli) the New Canal, at its lower side (šupāl nāri). The dates should be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) […] together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates they shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), offshoots (liblibbu), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, (and) [a broken amount of] darīku -container(s). The two debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has dates available at the due date shall deliver them to the creditor. Witnesses.
(*)[imitti eqli].

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1=Bēl-uballiṭ/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn//Arad-Nergal; B2=Iddin-Bēl/[PN]//[PN]

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu). Fragmentary
B1 and B2 owe a broken amount of silver (in minas) to A, slave of C. Possibly, it concerns the purchase price of dates ([šīm suluppē (?)]), considering the fact that the delivery date is in Tašrīt (VII) and delivery is by means of boats at the Borsippa canal. The document further refers to 100 onion strings (gidlu) belonging to D that E on account of (ana muhhi) .... At this point the text becomes fragmentary. Reference is made to the assets of their business partnership (harrānu) and the business investment (harrānu) of someone whose name is broken off. Cf. BM33133 (= Nbn 466). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbāši/Zēria//Nabāya
 
A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B1 = Ea-nāṣir/Mušallim//Šangû-Nanāya; B2 = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Šabbā’; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; D = Nabû-rêmu-šukun; E = [broken off]

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, barley and dates within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes x+2 shekels of silver, 5 kor of barley (and) 5 kor of dates to A. These are assets that C invested in a business partnership (harrānu). The silver and the barley should be delivered without interest in Ayyār (II), while the dates in Tašrīt (VII). D acts as guarantor for the payment. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for a broken amount of dates that B still has to pay. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s field (zēru) planted with date palms (bīt gišimmarē) and cultivated with grain (pî šulpu). Witnesses. Scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi.
 
A = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; B = šumu-ukīn/Ša-Nabû-šū; C = Iddin-Marduk; D = Nabû-ēṭir/Nergal-šumu-ibni//Ṭābihu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. With interest. Pledge of a slave and third party guarantor.
B owes 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered with interest (hubullu) in Ayyār (II). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s slave (fC) until the creditor has received the full repayment of his debt. fD acts as guarantor for the payment. Witnesses
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Arad-Marduk/Marduk-ēṭir//Ša-ṭābtišu; fC = fMiṣatu, slave of B; fD = fTašmētu-damqat/Taqīš-Gula//Atû

elementText.text:

B owes 10 shekels of silver and 20 minas of quality (babbanû) wool (šipātu) to A. The wool should be delivered in Dûzu (IV), while the silver without interest in Kislīm (IX). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Ardia/Aplāya//Atû

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Purchase price. Interest payable on deposit.
fA sold a house from her dowry to D, a royal clerk (sepīru ša šarri), and 5 minas and 2 shekels of silver of the purchase price had still not been paid to her. The buyer had deposited this amount of silver with B who already gave the seller and her son (C) part of it, keeping the remainder (1 mina of silver) in deposit. B should pay 2/3 minas of silver to the seller and her son as interest on the silver that is still with him. In the past he transferred 1/2 minas [and 2 shekels] and paid interest on 1 1/2 minas 2 shekels till the end of Ṭebēt (X). Cf. BM31151 (= Nrgl 60).
 
fA = fGugūa/Zākiru//Išinu; C = Ea-zēru-ibni/Bēl-zēru-līšir//Egibi, son of fA; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; D = Nabû-..., royal clerk (sepīru ša šarri)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 5 ¾ shekels of silver to A1 and A2, to be delivered in Šabāṭ (XI). The (indebted) silver is what C invested in the business partnership. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-šumu-ukīn/Šamaš-šumu-līšir//Si[jatu?].
 
A1 = Ina-tēšê-ēṭir/Bēl-apla-uṣur//Illatu; A1 = Bunene-ibni/Nabû-damiq//Rē'i-sīsê; B = Mušēzib-Bēl/Bēl-lē’i; C=Iddin-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and onions, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 15 shekels of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, the purchase price of a cow, and 26 bundles (pītu) of onions to A1 and A2. The silver should be paid without interest in Nisan (I) from the income of his onion field. The (indebted) silver is what C invested in the business partnership (with the parties mentioned above). Witnesses. Scribe: Tabnēa/Nabû-zēru-līšir.
 
A1 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; A2 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Nabû-kāṣir/Šūzubu; C = Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 22 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent (imittu) on land(*) located opposite (muhhi) the New Canal, above (elû) and below (it) (šaplu)(**). This plot of land is shared (zittu) by A with his brothers (C1 and C2). The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the creditor’s measure in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), offshoots (liblibbu), fibres (mangagu), [a load] of firewood, (and a broken amount of] darīku-container(s). B received (eṭēru) remuneration for [his] garderner's work (šissinnu), but no payment has been received for the services of the agricultural supervisor (gugallu). He should further give for each kor of dates 0.0.1.3 kor for the habû uhinni-tax and the šugarrû-supplement. Witnesses.
(*)i[mitti (eqli)]; (**)muhhi nāru eššu el[û (…)] šaplû {x (x)}
 
 A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Gimil-Šamaš/Līšir//Šamaš-bari; C1 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; C2 = Nergal-ušēzib/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of a slave in antichresis.
B owes [a broken amount] of mina(s) of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A. The debt is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s slave (fC). A's income from the slave's work pays for the interest (antichresis) and he is exempt from paying rent for the slave. Should the pledged slave flee (lit. "go to another place"), the debtor shall pay 3 qû of barley on a daily basis to the creditor as compensatory payment for his loss of income from the absent slave. The debtor should also provide (katāmu, lit. "cover") for the slave’s clothing. Witnesses.
 
A = Hašdāya/Nabû-mukīn-zēri//Bābūtu; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; fC = fMušēzibtu, slave of B

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley (and) silver. Fixation of interest.
B owes 12 kor of barley (and) ½ minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II) at the canal and the silver debt will bear a 20% interest from Ayyār (II) onwards, to be paid on a monthly basis. In addition, there are three earlier promissory notes for 84 kor of dates and 2 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy, which B still has to pay. He has also still to deliver 5 kor of barley in Kislīm (IX) (i.e., next month), and if he fails to do so, he should pay 50 shekels of white silver instead of the barley. Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-uballiṭ/Bēl-eṭēru//Ir’anni; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

B, slave of C owes 4 kor of quality white barley to A. The barley should be delivered in one instalment in Ayyār (III) according to the creditor’s measure and on his land (bītu) at the Piqudu-canal. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Šamaš-iddin, slave of C; C = Nidintu/Išinu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest. Pledge of a house and third party guarantor.
B owes 1 mina of silver to A, to be paid in Kislīm (IX). The silver debt bears a yearly interest of 12 shekels per mina (i.e. 20%). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s house, which is (located?) in […] Ninurta. C1 and C2 act as guarantors for the payment. Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes a broken amount kor of dates, assessed field rent (imitti eqli) on land that belongs to fA. He should deliver the dates to fC in one instalment together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he should deliver spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), spadices (gipû), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). The relationship between fA (title holder) and fC (actual recipient) is unknown (family, creditor?). Witnesses.
 
fA = fQudāšu/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Šulāya/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//Edu-ēṭir; fC = fBānitu-Esagil

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 1/2 mina 1/8 (bitqu) shekel (= 30 1/2 shekels) of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A, to be paid without interest in Abu (V). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sîn-tabni (debtor).

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-iddin//Egibi; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sîn-tabni

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price. Very fragmentary.

fA receives 6 minas and 1 shekel of silver by order of B who bought from her … (remainder broken off).
 
fA = fAmat-Ninlil(?)/Nabû-aplu-iddin/Ša-nāšīšu; B = Neriglissar (the king)

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Perhaps business related.
Concerns the 8 2/3 shekels of silver, A’s preferential share (pūt zitti) that he owns together with D and that is due from C. It probably means  that A and D invested in a business that is run by C. A receives it from B after he paid the same sum on B’s behalf to D.
 
A = Nabû-ēṭir/Rīmūt-Bēl//Egibi; B = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; C = Nabû-ina-tēšî-eṭir/...//Šangû-Ea; D = Rīmūt/Nabû-šumu-iškun//Gahal

elementText.text:
Receipt for house rental and slave rental
A receives 1/3 mina and 6 shekels of silver from his brother (B), paid as rent for a house located in Hursagkalamma and for the rent of his slave C. The rent will last from Šabāṭ (XI) of Nabonidus’ 14th year till the end of Tašrīt of Nabonidus’ 16th year. B will begin to pay starting from the beginning of Arahsamna (VIII). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Witnesses
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Kalbāya/Nabû-ahhe-iddin//Egibi; C = Silim-Bēl, slave of A

elementText.text:
Receipt for boat-toll.
A, supervisor (bēl piqitti) of C, the king's harbour master (rab kāri ša šarri), receives payment for boat-toll (miksu) from B (name not preserved). It is toll for Simān (III) of Nabonidus’ 17th year that is to be paid for letting boat (or boats) loaded with onions pass the royal quay of Til-Gula. Names of witnesses and of the scribe are lost.
 
A = Rēmutu/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Amīl-Isin, bēl-piqitti of C; B = … (name broken); C = Nabû-rēmu-šukun (rab kāri ša šarri)

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt.
fB owes 3 minas of silver to fC, for the payment of which D assumed warranty. In the present document, A, the creditor’s son-in-law receives the indebted silver from the debtor and the guarantor. To make sure that it will not be changed (ana lā enê), the parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fB = fTabannu/Niqūdu; fC =  fIna-Esagila-ramât/Zeria//Nabāya, mother in-in-law of A; D = Nabû-tattannu-uṣur/Tabnêa//Bēl-ēṭiru

elementText.text:
Receipt for dates.
A receives 40 kor (c. 7,200 l) of dates on C’s orders (ina našparti) from B1 and B2, who were sent (mār šipri) by C. The dates are part of his father’s claim (rašūtu) against C. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each, in order to make sure that this agreement will not be changed. Names of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Marduk-rēmanni/Iddin-Marduk/Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Tabnêa, messenger of C; B2 = Madān-ahu-iddin, messenger of C; C = Rēmutu/Nabû-rēhti-uṣur; D = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment for interest.
A receives payment for interest on his silver till the end of Nisan (I) from B. This does not include the previous silver (amount broken) that he (already) received (back) from the capital amount of his loan. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Šamaš-aplu-uṣur/ Šamaš-ina-tēšî-ēṭir; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for barley and other agricultural produce. Payment for impost.
Concerns 46 kor (c. 8,280 l) of barley, 2 kor (c. 360 l) […] mašīhu-measurement […]. It is impost ([sūtu]) for Ayyār (II) of Darius’ 10th year (from land) that is owned by (ša) A1 and A2 and at B’s disposal (ina pāni). A1 received it (eṭēru) from B, as well as the the straw (tibnu). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-nādin-šumi/Erība-Marduk//Mandidi; A2 = Rēmut-Bēl/Erība-Marduk//Mandidi; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi;

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price.
Concerns payments by B to A for the purchase of a house. A already received the 2/3 minas and 17 shekels of silver, the price for the house measuring 5 reeds 2 … [broken off]. B now pays A an additional 1/3 shekels of silver for the interest on this silver. The sale of A’s house is probably related to his debt to B recorded in Nbn 433.
 
A = Esagila-zēru-ibni/Bēl-uballiṭ//Irani; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for ilku.
A1 and fA2, wife of C, receive 3 1/2 shekels of silver, from B as payment for his ilku-tax. The silver is needed for equiping fA2’s husband (C), who is a soldier in the King's army. This does not include the debt for 1 1/2 shekels. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A1 = Nabû-taklāk (probably, father of C); fA2 = fPalitu, wife of C; B = Nabû-ušallim(/Īnīa); C = Bēl-ušallim(/Nabû-taklāk?)

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of barley to a slave of the Egibi family. Reference to additional outstanding debts.
B1 and fB2, his mother, should deliver the full amount (gamru) of 0.3?.2 kor of barley that are due from them to A, a slave of D, in Ayyar (II). Delivery should be in one instalment in the creditor's house, according to the latter’s measure. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. The one who has barley available at the time of delivery should give it. In addition (elat), there is a previous credit claim (rašûtu) charged against the same people, and still another credit claim charged against C, B1’s father. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Madān-bēlu-uṣur; B1=Nergal-uballiṭ/Bēl-iddin; fB2=fQunnabi/Ahhē-iddin; C=Bēl-iddin; D=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
About dates, temple property and lease-related revenues. The head of the Egibi family is involved.
The beginning of this tablet is broken, but probably refers to dates grown by seven gardeners (nukarribu) and the collection of which is the prerogative (makkūru) of the temple of Bēl. It further mentions a man named A and the collection of lease-related revenues (sūtu) that are due to B. The tablet is too fragmentary to reproduce a coherent story. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Marduk-naṣir-apli … (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B= Iddinaya
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment (and)? the flour-tax by the head of the Egibi family Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the ilku-tax from Nisan (I) of the 25th year till the end of Addar (XII) of the 26th that is due from C. B pays for the latter's account (ana muhhi). The exact amount that is paid is not specified. A short remark at the very end of the obverse, before the witness list, states that A (also?)** receives payment (mahāru) from B for C's flour-tax (qēmu). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Rē'ûšunu-Marduk/Bēl-aplu-uṣur//...-aya; C=Murānu/Marduk-nāṣir!//Ah-bani

elementText.text:
Apprenticeship contract to teach a slave from the Egibi family the baker's profession.
A has voluntarily given his slave C to B, in order to learn the baker's profession (lúMU-ú-tu [mubannûtu]). The contract runs for (at least) three months up to one year (adi ṭuppi u ṭuppi), He shall teach (lamādu D) him all the skills of his baker's profession. If he has taught him, the pupil’s master shall give to the teacher an uzāru-garment; if he has not taught him, the teacher shall give to the pupil’s master three liters (qû) of barley for each day as compensation (mandattu) for the pupil. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Gūzānu/Hambaqu//Mandidi; C=Itti-Uraš-pānia, slave of A

elementText.text:
Receipt of a boat-tower by the head of the Egibi family. From the Governor’s pool of (forced) labourers.
A receives (mahāru) a man to tow boats (šaddidu) from B, for the account of (ana muhhí) C. It is the share (zittu) that is due from C. The labourer is to tow boats to the quay, under the administrative authority (ša qātē) of D, Governor of Babylon, for 2 months and 12 days (in the 24th year of Darius? Cf. BM31188). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šiški/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Bēl-iddin/Šumu-iddin//Andaharli; C=Habaṣīru/Mušēzib-Marduk//Dēkû; D=Ina-Esagil-lilbur, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon)

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for transport costs. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, courtier (ša rēš šarri) and clerk (sepīru) of the courtiers (ša rēši) of the New Palace receives (mahāru) a broken amount of barley from B to cover the costs of transporting (gimru) 400? kor of either barley or dates from Tâmti (to Babylon). Tâmti was located in the district under the administrative authority (ša qātē) of two governors (D1 and D2) (bēl pihāti). A acts by order of (ina qibi) C, Governor of Babylon (šākin ṭēmi). Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Aplaya, (ša rēš šarri), (sepīru); B= Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D1=  Bēl-ittannu?, (bēl pihāti); D2= m... (bēl pihāti)

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley from the head of the Egibi family. By order of a royal official.
The document confirms the receipt of 3 kor of barley from B, of which 2 kor are A1’s and 1 kor are A2’s. It is not said who receives (ma-hi-ra-a' [mahāru]) the barley, but it was ordered (ina qibi) by C, courtier (ša rēš šarri) and clerk (sepīru). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A1= Muššê/Inzia; A2= Nabû-rē'ûšunu/Nabû-balāssu-iqbi; B= Širku (wr. mši-ir-ki)/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Iddin-Nabû, (ša rēš šarri), (sepīru)

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment for various service or tax obligations by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C, for various taxes that are due from the latter. The taxes are: the ilku-tax, a supplement to the bow-tax (ṭipi ša qašti) and a contribution for the “fittings of the archer” (unāt qašti), and cover the period from Kislīm of the 25th year till the end of Nisan of the 27th year of Darius. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širku (wr. šik-ku)/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nabû-iddin/Iqūpu//Etel-pî; C=Dummuqu/Balāṭu//Gahul

elementText.text:
Release from obligatory state service for the next three and a half months.
The document starts by stating that A served 10 days a month(*) with B (dullu itti PN epēšu), his contingent commander (rab hanšê, lit: "official in charge of hanšû-land"), since Ayyar (II) of Darius’ 24th year. He served on the makurru-boats at the King’s quay. It is then provided that till the end of Tašrīt (VII) of the 24th year of Darius, the commander cannot call him up (dekû) for service (ana muhhi x dullu). Names of 3 witnesses a.o. Nidintu, B's brother, and the scribe. Prosopographic links with the Egibi archive.

(*)ITI u4-mumeš 10.

A=Ardia/Kabtia//Ea-eppeš-ilī; B=Bēl-erība/Kalbaya//Šumu-libši (rab hanšê)

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley and onions.
B owes 1;2.3.0 kor of barley (and) 1200 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, slave of C. The full amount of barley is due in one payment in Ayyār (II), and the onions are due in Nisan (I). Delivery is in the house (or: on the plot of land) (bītu) of the creditor's master. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nergal-šarrani/Nabû-dāmiq//Rab-banê.

A = Arad-Bēl, slave of C; B = Bēl-KAR-Nabû/Kīnāya; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for beams. Interest at default.
B owes 200 pairs of good-quality split logs (gušūru tāpalu babbanû) each 1 cubit long (cf. CAD T, 178), to A, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) in the house of C. He will start paying the usual 20% interest if he fails to meet the deadline. The logs should be dry (ablu) and strong (pitnu). D acts as guarantor for the delivery. A short note at the end of the document clarifies that the logs are the ones that had been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to D. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbāši/Zēria//Nabāya.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Iddin-Marduk; B = Marduk-šumu-iddin/Kiribtu//Bēlāya; C = Bēl-ibni; D = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Rēmūtu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. General pledge.
B owes 3 minas and 48 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest on the 25th of Šabāṭ (XI). All his property in and outside the city are pledged to the creditor until the full repayment of the debt. In addition, there is a previous claim (rašûtu) by the same creditor. The (indebted) silver is the part (pūtu) of the price that A received (mahāru) together with (his business partner) C for their sale of building plots (qanû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: .../Mušēzib-Bēl//.... The first witness is the debtor's father.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Rēmūtu/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Šamba'; C = Ea-nāṣir

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver.
B owes 36 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in its full amount (gamāru D-ma eṭēru) by the end of Tašrīt (VII). The creditor shall take (našû) the equivalent of the indebted silver from silver with one-fifth alloy (šīm kaspi hamuštu, wr. ha-a?-mu-šu-x), as much as can be cashed (mala i-ru-bu). A fragmentarily preserved passage at the end of the document seems to refer to a business partnership between the partners. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Lâbāši/Bēl-šarru-uṣur//Arad-Ea.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Kalbāya/Marduk-nāṣir; C = Nabû-ušallim

Promissory note for silver.
B owes 10 shekels of stamped(?) silver (ginnu), used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru), to A, to be paid in Šabāṭ (XI). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 7 kor of dates. The present document states that the return of that earlier (already) paid promissory note has not yet occurred. Witnesses.

A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nabû-iddin/Kīnāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 10 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent for land (imitti eqli) located in Litamu next to the ditch (harru) of the Ilu-tillatu family. He should deliver them in one payment according to the 36 liters measure in the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII).  It is A’s 1/5th share in the rent income that he earns together with C. B should also deliver the usual by products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), (and) offshoots (liblibbu), 2 darīku-containers (and) a load of firewood. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Madān-iddin/Ubār; C = Marduk-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šarra-uṣur

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and onions, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 12 ½ shekels of silver and a [broken amount off] onion strings (gidlu) to A within the framework of a business partnership that was established by C as main investor. In Nisan (I), he should deliver the silver without interest as well as the onions. The earlier promissory notes are settled (etēru G Stat). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-šumu-ukīn/Narṭu//[…]
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Nūrea/Ahunu; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates. Temple income.
B, slave of C, owes a broken amount of dates (x+5.0.0.0 kor) to A, a temple oblate (širku ša Nabû). It is the assessed field rent (?) (imitti [eqli]) of land in Borsippa (?) ([šá?] Barsip), income of the Nabû-temple (makkūr Nabû). B should deliver the full amount (gamru) of dates in Tašrīt (VII) at the courtyard (haṣāru) according to his master's measure, which is a measure of 5 (units) per kor (or, in other words, a 36 liters measure with 5 PI = 1 kor). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Iddin-Nabû/Aplāya.
The same parties reoccur in BM30662, BM36336 and Nbn 722 (reedited by Wunsch 2000, nos. 175, 214, and 215.)
 
A = Padāya/Ezida-…, širku of Nabû; B = Arad-Bēl, slave of C; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of a slave.
B owes 1/3(?) minas and 8 2/3 shekels of silver to A, slave of C, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Nisan (I) of Nabonidus’ 12th year. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s slave (D). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged slave until A has received the full repayment. The (indebted) silver is the rest of an earlier debt of 3 minas of silver which was owed by the debtor's father. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-uterri, slave of C; B = Silīm-Bēl/Rēmūt; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; D = Lūṣi-ana-nūri, slave of B.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 12 shekels of silver to A1 and A2, to be delivered without interest (qaqqadu) in Addar (XII). The (indebted) silver is what C invested in the business partnership (with the parties above) and what remains (rēhanu) to be paid for (the purchase of) an ox (alpu). The promissory note for 35 shekels of silver is broken (hepû) and (the claim) invalid (lā pê). Witnesses.Scribe: Nergal-ahu-iddin/Ardia.
 
A1 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; A2 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Šumu-iddin/Šamaš-ibni; C = Iddin-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 55;2.3.0 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at (ina muhhi) the New Canal, above (it) (elû)(*). The dates should be delivered to the courtyard (haṣāru) in one instalment according to A’s measure. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for a debt which is still pending. Furthermore, he should deliver 1 choice (babbanû) lamb (kalūmu) on the 20th of Addar (XII). Witnesses.
(*)Or: located at the upper New Canal (ina muhhi nāru eššu elû (erasure).
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-ēṭir/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn//Arad-Nergal

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes 130 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII), at the canal in Babylon. Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Mušebši-Marduk//Nabûnnaia; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 17;3.3 kor of dates to A1, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located next to C1 and C2 which is shared by A1 and his brothers (A2 and A3). It is A1's half share (ahi zittu) in its rent income. The dates should be delivered in one payment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard. Deliver is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), and 2 darīku-containers with a 0;0.3 kor capacity. He should further give for each kor of dates 0;0.1 kor for the habû uhinni-tax […] and 0;0.0.3 kor for the šugarrû-supplement. The document ends with the prohibition to prune (arū D) any live part of the date palm (raṭbu), from which (ina libbi) B should deliver 1 kor of (fresh) dates for  (ripening in) the oven (suluppū ša tinūri) […] and 1 kor of ṣu-ub-bu-ú-tú? (ṣubbûtu) (mng. uncl.). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli(/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu)//Egibi; B = Qubbar/Lūṣi-ana-nūri; C1 = Ubār; C2 = Nabû-ittannu; A2 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ(/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu)//Egibi, brother of A1 and A3; A3 = Nergal-ušēzib(/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu)//Egibi, brother of A1 and A2

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 4;2.3 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) ša šibbu (uncl.) and (planted with) date palms which is located at ditch (harru) of the Reisissi family. He should deliver the dates in one instalment according to A’s measure to the courtyard. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), [a load of firewood], and 1 darīku-container. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Šamaš-iddin/Bēl-ušallim

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Fragmentary.
B, official (rēšu) in service of the (crownprince) Cambyses, owes 3 minas and 16 shekels of silver to A, to be paid by the end of Arahsamna (VIII). The remainder of the document is broken off. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Atkal-ana-Mār-Saggil/Sîn-bēlu-uṣur, rēšu (lúsag) of Cambyses

elementText.text:
Undertaking to transfer tax income.
Concerns 1 mina of silver of the house of D. B, governor (šākin ṭemi) of Babylon should bring this sum of silver and hand over it over (našû-nadānu) to A, the overseer of the residents (rab āšibī) (*). The silver is C's contribution for military equipment (rikis qabli) for two consecutive years (Cambyses' 3rd and 4th year). Witnesses. (*) Wr. [lú]gal a-⌈šib?⌉meš, collated Joannès, Achemenet website.
 
A = Esagil-šarru-uṣur, rab āšibī; B = Marduk-zākir-šumi, governor (šākin ṭemi) of Babylon; C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu; D = Hašdāya/Arad-Gula//Dēkû

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Purchase price.
B owes 4 minas and 9 shekels of silver to A for the purchase (šīmu) of two bronze containers: a bathtub (narmaku) and a bowl (gullatu). If the debtor fails to all deliver (eṭēru D-ma nadānu) the containers (udû) on the 29th (i.e. within the next two days), he should pay back the 4 minas and 9 shekels of silver to A in Ayyār (II) (i.e. next month). Witnesses.
 
A = Ahhē-Iddin-Marduk/Marduk-šākin-šumi//Eṭēru; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver from a dowry.
Concerns fC’s dowry (nudunnû). A, her father-in-law, receives (maḫāru) 24 minas of silver from B, her father, but the slaves (amīlūtu) and household utensils (udê bīti) are still to be delivered. There exist two documents (u’iltu) pertaining to this dowry-silver. There is also (elat) a document about a one-third share (šalšu zittu) that fC, the bride, has in her father’s property (nikkassu). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi (bridegroom’s father); B = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn (bride’s father); fC = fNuptāya/Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn (bride)

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment for interest.
fA receives payment for interest on her silver till the end of First Ulūl (VI1) of the 2nd year (of Cyrus) from B1 and his wife (fB2). The exact amount is not specified. Names of witnesses and scribe are broken.
 
fA = fIna-Esagila-ramât/Zeria//Nabāya; B1 = Kidinnu/Zeria//Šangû-Gula; fB2 = fBu’ītu, wife of B1

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. House rent.
Concerns the payment of house rent for the first part of the year that is due to C. A1 and one of the landlord’s slave (A2) receive from B 7 1/2 shekels of stamped(?) silver (ginnu) by the landlord’s order. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nidintu-Bēl//Nādin-še’i (=A1)  
 
A1 = Nidintu-Bēl/Damqia//Nādin-še’i; fA2= Šēpet-Bēl-aṣbat, slave of C; B = Nidintu/Arad-Bēl//Šumu-libši; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Repayment of a debt.
Concerns a claim for 1 minas and 16 shekels of silver that A, mayor domo (rab bīti) of (the crownprince) Belšazar*, holds against C. It is a claim for the repayment of the capital amount of a debt and its interest, for which the debtor's plot of land between the Gates has been as pledge. A receives the said sum of silver from B on behalf of C. Names of 4 witnesses (including C, the debtor) and the scribe.
*wr. Bēl-šarru-uṣur
 
A = Nabû-ṣābit-qātē, rab bīti of the crownprince Belšazar; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Bēl-iddin/Bēl-šumu-iškun//Sîn-tabni

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for (pledged) slaves, paid by the creditor to the debtor.
Concerns three female slaves: fD1 and her two children (i.e. fD2 and a baby): A, who previously took them from C paying him 1 mina of silver, now receives the same sum from B, meaning that he allows B (his creditor) to buy the slaves from him in order to cover his debt to him. A has promptly given the three slaves to B: should any previous promissory note related to these three slaves be found in A’s house, this will belong to B. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Šumāya/Nabû-zēru-iddin//Dābibī; C = Bēl-iddin/Silim-Bēl/Damqu; fD1 = fHabaṣirtu; fD2, = fBānītu-taddin daughter of fD1

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Purchase price for a donkey.
Concerns a white donkey, seven-years old, the tip of its right ear, its shoulders and its feet are black, with "4" marked on its left thigh: A sold this donkey for 1 mina and 2 shekels of white medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, to B. In the present document A receives the said sum of silver, the agreed price (hariṣ) for his donkey, from B. C guarantees for the uškûtu of the donkey. Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe: Libluṭ/Marduk-erība/Mušēzib
 
A = Bēl-ēṭir/Nabû-bāni-ahi//Rēmūt-Bēl; B = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi; C = Libluṭ/Iddin-Marduk//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for dates. Partial payment.
B owes 20;2.4.0 kor (c. 3,696 l) of dates to A. In the present document the creditor receives part of this debt, namely 7;2.3.0 kor (c. 1,350 l) from the debtor. The latter should also prove that he handed over (nadānu) dates to C in three days (till the 26th of Tašrīt [VII]): if he fails to do so, he will have to pay the full amount of (C’s) claim for dates of the 12th year in the 6 liters*-measure. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
*0;0.1 kor = 1 sūtu.
 
A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Padāya/Ezida-...; C = Arad-Bēl

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver.
A receives 10 shekels of medium qualtiy of which one-eighth is alloy from B. He shall enter the silver in the accounts of C (= his brother) and give proof of it to B (itti PN ušuzzu-nadānu). Witnesses (including Kalbāya/Nabû-ahhe-iddin//Egibi, A’s uncle). Scribe:  Nergal-ušēzib/Nadnāya/Egibi
 
A = Puršu/Iddināya//Egibi; B = Marduk-ēṭir//Nabû-šumu-iškun//Šumu-libši; C = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Security for debt. Payment due from the head of the Egibi family. Interest.
B owes 50 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, to A. The silver is the remainder (rīhtu) of a debt (u'iltu) of 2 2/3 minas. The present document stipulates that from Nisan (I) of the 18th year onwards a yearly interest of 20% should be paid on a monthly basis. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Bēl-iddin/Mušēzib-Marduk//Sîn-nādin-šumi; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family for the purchase of silver. Transfer of the money between the brothers of the parties involved. Undertaking by the official to write a confirmation of his receipt of the money.
Concerns 5 minas of medium quality of silver of which 1/8th is alloy, that A2 should (have) advance(d) to B2, district governor of Šaḫrīnu, for the purchase of dates (kaspu ša A2 šīm suluppê). The governor sent (šapāru) the debtnote (u'iltu) that had been issued against him (ina muḫḫi … e'elu) to his moneylender via B1, his brother asking him to hand over the agreed upon sum of silver to the latter (ina qātē B1 abālu Š). The present document confirms that B1, acting as proxy for (našpartu) his brother, received (maḫir) the silver from the hands of A1, brother of A2 on his orders (ina qibi). It continues by recording the governor's undertaking to issue a written confirmation (šaṭaru, n.) that he received the silver from his brother and give it to the moneylender's brother (našû-nadānu). The handing over of the document should take place in Šaḫrīnu within the next 5 months ("till the 15th of Abu [V]").

*lúpa-ḫa-tu4

A1=Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B1=Nabû-uṣuršu/Mušēzib-Marduk; B2=Libluṭ/Mušēzib-Marduk, (pīḫatu of Šahrīnu)
Transliteration available on Achemenet

elementText.text:
Lease of a share in the right to collect toll from boats. Leased out by the head of the Egibi family and his co-shareholder to two individuals. The right to collect toll ultimately belonged to the Governor of Babylon.
A1 and A2 lease (ana sūti nadānu) the right to collect toll from boats going downstream and upstream at the bridge and the harbour to B1 and B2, for a monthly payment of 15 shekels of white, medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy. They should demand toll (esēru) from the boats which moor (i-ki-il-la-a' [kalû ]) at the bridge, are not allowed to pass on the monthly income (erbu) from the bridge without A1' s consent, and should show him and the guardians any written message (našpartu) concerning the bridge. The collection of toll (isirtu, usirtu) from said bridge is the prerogative (bīt qipti) of C, but A1 managed it (ina pani). He had a half-share in it (ahi zittu), with 5 bridge guardians (maṣṣārū gišri) being the other share-holders (i.e. A2, D1, D2, D3 and D4). Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=Širku (wr. mši-ir-ka)/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); A2=Murānu/Nabû-mukīn-apli//Maṣṣār-elep-rukūbi; B1=Bēl-asûa/Nergal-uballih//Mudammiq-Adad; B2=Ubār/Bēl-ahhē-erība//Maṣṣār-elep-rukūbi; C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D1=Nabû-bullissu/Gūzānu; D2=Harīṣānu; D3=Iqūpu; D4=Nergal-ibni

element.name: Museum No.
element.description: Museum number of cuneiform tablet

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver, barley and onions to the head of the Egibi family. Pledge renewal. Repayment of the onions is to be obtained from the debtor’s income from impost on land. Silver had been transferred to the debtor to pay for rikis qabli. Reference to an outstanding debt of dates and barley secured by pledge.
B should deliver 3 5/6 minas and 7 ½ shekels of silver, 2 kor of barley and 130 bundles of onions that are due from him to A. The silver and the onions should be delivered in Nisan (I) of the 6th year. In Ayyar (II) of the same year he should deliver the full amount (gamru) of indebted barley, in one instalment according to A's measure. All (gabbu) the previously pledged (bīt maškanu) fields planted with trees (eqlu zaqpu) and grain (pî šulpi), from the Borsippa Canal to the Royal Street, are pledged (anew) to A (maškanu). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over these until A has received full repayment of his credit claim. In addition (elat), there is a previous promissory note (u'iltu) for 297.3.0 kor of dates and 11.2.3 kor of barley owed to A (rašûtu) for which the above mentioned fields have been taken as pledge (maškanu ṣabātu). The (indebted) silver is that which has been given (nadānu, G Stat.) to finance work (dullu) at the dams (mušennītu), within the framework of payments for rikis qabli of the 5th year. A will receive full repayment of the onions from his (=the debtor's) income from the šibšu-impost on an onion-field (ina šibši eqlišu ša šūmi). The field (and the collection of impost from it) is managed by C (A's slave) (epēšu G, lit. "to contract to do perform certain tasks")). The upper sector belongs to B; the lower sector, which is located next to the house of the Canal Inspector (lúAGRIG [mašennu]), is shared with D. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Rēmūt-Bēl/Šumu-ukīn; C=Madān-bēlu-uṣur; D=Nabû-māku-uṣur

elementText.text:
Receipt of barley by a royal official from the head of the Egibi family. Payment for transport costs. By order of the Governor of Babylon.
A, clerk (sepīru) of the specialized craftsmen (ummânu) and appointed (lú[…]) over the Ionians (lúia-ma-na-a-a), receives (mahāru) a broken amount of barley from B to cover the costs of transporting (gimru) a broken amount of barley. He acts by order of (ina qibi) C, governor of Babylon. The barley that needs to be transported is income from the collection of fixed rent (sūtu), due to D1 and D2, governors of (bēl pihāti) the district Tâmti. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 5 witnesses and the scribe.

A= Bazbaka, (sepīru); B= Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C= Gūzānu, (šākin ṭēmi of Babylon); D1= Bēl-ittannu, (bēl pihati); D2= Šumaya?, (bēl pihati)

elementText.text:
Receipt of silver from the head of the Egibi family. Rent for a boat.
A1 and A2, by order of (ina qibi) C, receive payment (mahāru) for the rent (idū) of a boat that appears to be at their disposal (but the pertinent passage is badly preserved). A2 is an official overseeing workmen (ša rēš ṣābē). The amount received is a broken amount of minas of white silver. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A1=m...-ittannu/Niqūdu; A2=Bēl-ikṣur/Rēmūtu, (ša rēš​ ṣābē); B=Šišku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Basia/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Ša-nāšīšu

elementText.text:
Receipt of a hireling? by the head of the Egibi family. Hired for six days a month during six months from March/April till August/September.
A receives a hireling?* from B for 6 days a month, from Nisan of the 25th year till the end of Ulūl of the 25th year. The text doesn’t specify the kind of work that the hireling? should do. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

*[x (x)?] x.

A=Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Bēl-iddin/Zēria//Rab-banê

elementText.text:
Receipt of a boat-tower by the head of the Egibi family. Hired for six days a month during five months from July till November.
A receives (mahāru) a hireling (agru) from B, for the account of (ana muhhi) C from whom the hireling was due. The hireling is to tow boats (šaddidu) for 6 days a month till the end of Arahsamna of the 25th year. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe

A=Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B=Nāšibu//Lā-qīpu; C=Marduk/Nabû-uṣuršu//Šumu-libši

elementText.text:
Renting of a boat and receipt of the rent money. Rented to the head of the Egibi family.
A rents (ana idi nadānu) his boat to B and receives (eṭēru) 1/3 mina of white, medium quality silver as rent money (idū) and (adi) for the boat’s maintenance (kurummatu). The boat will sail to Bištu-ša-ṣēru’a, but should not pass (etēqu) the fortified settlement (birtu); if the boat passes it, the renter shall pay an additional 5 minas of silver. The boat is currently at the disposal of C (ina pāni) for boat-service duty (mallāhūtu). It is not specified when the boat will be made available to the renter (unlike in BM30490; BM31316 e.a.). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Iddin-Nabû; B=Širik/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Šamaš-iddin/Bēl-iddin

elementText.text:

B owes 10 shekels of silver to A, to be paid at the end of Kislīm (IX). In addition, there is a previous promissory note (u'iltu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-šumu-ibni/Šāpik-zēri//Nūr-Sîn.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Rēmūtu/Nabû-rēhti-uṣur

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley and onions.
B owes 3;2.2.0 kor of barley and 2900 strings (gidlu) of onions to A. The onions should be delivered in Nisan (I) on the creditor's land (bītu) along the Borsippa canal. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II) on the creditor's land (bītu). In addition, there are earlier promissory notes. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Rēmūt-Bēl/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Šappāya.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Balāṭu/Bēl-illata

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest. Payment in instalments. General pledge.
B1 and fB2 owe 2 minas and 28 2/3 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest in two instalments: almost half of it (1 mina and 8 shekels of silver) should be paid in Dûzu (IV) and the rest in Addar (XII). The debtors pledge all their property in and outside the city, and assume warranty for each other.  The creditor swore before Šamaš that he agrees to take back the silver in instalments (?) (mīni ša kaspi našû). In addition, there are 4 1/2 shekels of silver at B1's disposal (ina pāni). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya (B1).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Bēl-ušallim/Zēria//Nabāya; fB2 = fSilim-Ištar/Kurigalzu//Ša-nāšīšu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates. Payment for military service. Pledge of slaves and land.
B owes 160 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in its full amount (gamru) in Arahsamna (VIII) at the river in Babylon. Delivery is secured by the pledge of the debtor's houseborn slaves (F1 and F2) and his field (eqlu) at the Biri canal (pattu GN). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged salves and land until the debt is fully paid back. Background to the above debt is the payment (by A) to C for performing military service (on B's behalf) (ana madakti alāku).Besides (ittû) the 160 kor of dates, the debtor should deliver 20 loads of firewood.
The two earlier promissory notes for dates and 12 shekels of silver have been annulled (hepû). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-bān-ahi/Apkallu//Ašlāku.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Bēl-šumu-iškun/Bēl-ahhē-iqīša//Sippê(a); C = Mušēzib-Bēl; F1 = Nabû-kuṣranni, slave of B; F2 = Bēl-ṣullê-šemu, slave of B

B owes 1 mina of silver to A, to be paid with interest in Nisan (I). In addition, there are previous promissory notes (u'iltu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nergal-uballiṭ/Nabû-bān-ahi.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of slaves.
B owes 1 mina and 30 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in Nisan (I). This debt is secured by the pledge of two of the debtor's slaves (C1 and C2). No other creditor shall exercise any rights over them until the creditor has received full repayment of his silver. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu.
This document is a retroact from Ash.1878.3 (OECT 10 105) and BM30810 (Nbn 392). 

A = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nādinu; B = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu; C1 = Ša-pî-kalbi; C2 = Bēl-pitnanni

B owes 5000 strings of onions and 7;2.3.0 (kor) of barley to A, to be delivered in Ayyār (II) at the Borsippa canal. In addition, there are previous promissory notes for onions and barley. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Esagil-šumu-ibni/Dayyān-Marduk/Mušēzib.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for onions. Fragmentary.
B owes 5500 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, to be delivered in ... [the name of the month is broken off] on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu). The end of the document and the first part of the list of witnesses is broken off. Names of at least 1 witness and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-imbi/Ezida-šumu-ibni//Sagdidi (debtor).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-šumu-imbi/Ezida-šumu-ibni//Sagdidi

B owes 2 minas and 4 shekels of silver to A, to be paid with interest at the end of Abu (V).
This sum includes the 1 mina of silver that A paid to C in Nisan (I). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-nāṣir/Mār-bīti-nā'id//Bēliau.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Šamaš-kāṣir/Nabû-bēlšunu//Lā-kuppuru; C = Iddināya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for onions.
B owes 3000 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, slave of C, to be delivered in Ayyār (II). Delivery is due on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu) in the area between the canals (birīt nārāti).  He should make the onions pass the harbour (etēqu Š), i.e. by paying for the harbour customs. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Gimillu/Nabû-šumu-līšir//Malultu.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Nabû-bēlšunu//Lā-kuppuru; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:

B owes 1;3.0 kor of barley to A, to be delivered in Abu (V) in Šahrinu according to the creditor's measure. A promptly returned the promissory note about B's (other) debt of 5 kor of dates and 0;1.0 kor of barley to his brother (C). Witnesses.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley and dates.
B owes 22;0.0.0 (kor) of barley and 50;0.0.0 (kor) of dates to A. The barley should be delivered in Simān (III) and the dates in Kislīm (IX) at the harbour of Til-Gula.
In addition, there are 11+x;0.3.0 kor of barley ... (broken off). Scribe: Bēl.../Tabnēa/Gahal. There are two witnesses. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-.../Tabnēa//Gahal.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Līšir/Etelpi//Bēl-napšāti

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 20 kor of dates to A, assessed field rent (imitti eqli), to be delivered in Tašrīt (VII) together with the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates B shall give spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), spadices (gipû), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. In addition, there is the (still to be completed) settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) with the debtor concerning the imittu of the 1st year. Included are the 5;2.0.0 kor of dates that are the shared income (zittu) of A, C and D. He (= B) has not received (eṭēru) any remuneration for his gardening work (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-ušallim/Bēl-ibni//Gallābu; C = Iddin-Nabû; D = Nergal-ēṭir

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes silver to A, but the amount and other details are lost in the broken part at the beginning of the tablet. It is silver that C invested in a business partnership (with A and B) and is to be used for the purchase (šīmu) of onions. B should pay the silver and the interest on it (hubullu) in Nisan (I). It should be entirely taken (šalāmu G) from the income from his onion field (šikittu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Zēr-Bābili/Aplāya//Šumu-libši.
 
A = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria]//Nabāya; B = Iddiya/Nabû-rēmanni; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

B owes 5 kor of dates to A, the rest (rīhtu) of the revenue from impost on land (imittu), to be delivered by the end of Šabāṭ (XI). C guarantees for the payment. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Nūr-Šamaš/Kī-Nabû; C = Marduk-erība/Līšir//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu).
B owes 41 ¼ shekels of silver to A. The debt should be delivered in medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy on the 20th of Ṭebēt (X). The (indebted) silver is what C invested in the business partnership. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Šamaš-ah[...]/Rēmūt/[...].
 
A = Bēl-aha-ušabši/Nabû-bān-ahi//Bēl-eṭēru; B = Nabû-ušallim/Īnia; C = Bēlšunu/Balāṭu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley. Compensatory payment for a slave.
fB owes 1 kor and 114 silas of bread (?)(*) to A, to be delivered in one payment by the end of Arahsamna (VIII). It is a still outstanding compensatory payment (mandattu) for A's loss of income from the absence of the slave C. Witnesses.
(*) So CAD M1, 15 mng. 4. Alternatively, read: 1 kor (of (barley?) (in the form of) MAŠ breads.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fB = fŠidatu/Handašu; C = Nabû-lusalim, a slave

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Fixation of interest. Pledge. Fragmentary.
B owes a broken amount of silver to A on which he has to pay each month interest (20% on an annual basis). The remainder of the text is fragmentarily preserved. It refers to 7 1/6 shekels and some pledged property and a  woman (fC1) and a man (C2), followed by a reference to silver (at C2's disposal ?) which D, fC1's husband should give without further delay(*). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: …-šumu-ibni/Nabû-šumu-ukīn//Lē'i-bulluṭu-Marduk.
(*)Cf. CAD K, 387 reconstructs as follows: An object weighing 7 1/6 shekels (of gold) that seems to have been given as surety for the loan should be returned to the debtor in its sealed bag (kinku) so that the latter can hand it over to …(kî utirri inandin).
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Mušēzib-Marduk/Nabû-zēru-bīti-līšir//Šullumunu; fC1 = fŠikkû/…//Dābibi; C2 = Tašmētu-damqat/…-ahhē-iddin; D = Mušēzib-Nabû, husband of fC1

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley.
B, slave of A owes 7 kor of dates to his master, to be delivered in Simān (III), apart from (elat) what he still owes as compensatory payment (mandattu) for his absence in the [broken off]-th year of Amēl-Marduk. Witnesses.
 
A = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi; B = Ina-ṣilli-Bēl, slave of A

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on the harvest, to be delivered in dates.
B1 and B2 owe 35 kor of dates, impost on the harvest (imitti ebūr eqli) from arable land (zēru) in Litamu, to A. They should deliver them according to the 36 measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). They should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give (the customary amounts of) spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), (and) fibres (mangagu), 55 loads of firewood (and) offshoots (liblibbu), and 2 darīku-containers. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B1 = Mušēzib-Bēl/Nādin//Sîn-šākin-šumi; B2 = Nabû-zēru-ibni/Mušēzib-Marduk//Abu-ul-īde

elementText.text:
Promissory note for impost on land, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 16 kor of dates to A and his brothers, revenue from the impost on land (imittu) located at (ina muhhi) the Ile''i-Bēl sluice (bitqu). The dates should be delivered in one instalment according to the 36 liters measure in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation to the courtyard (haṣāru): for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood, 2 darīku-containers with a 0;0.3 kor capacity, (and dates for) the šugarrû-supplement. The debtor may not deliver the dates to anyone else without A's consent (ša lā). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Tabnēa/…-ibni//Ša-nāšīšu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates.
B owes 1.2.3.0 kor of dates to A, to be delivered according to the creditor’s measure on the 10th of Nisan (I) of the 19th year in the house of Ubār located at the Piqudu-canal. If the debtor fails to meet the deadline, he will deliver 1.2.3.0 kor of barley in addition to the said amount of dates, apparently in Abu (V) (?). Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Nidintu/Ina-tēšê-ēṭir//Ša-nāšīšu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for barley and dates without interest.
B owes 8 kor of barley (and) 1.2.3.0 kor of dates to A. The barley should be delivered in Ayyār (II), while the dates in Tašrīt (VII) according to the 36 liters measure, without interest (qaqqadu), and in the house (bītu) of C. In addition, there is a previous debt owed by B which is still pending. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Ubār/Arad-Bēl//Eppeš-ilī; C = Nabû-ēreš

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 60 kor of dates to A1 and A2, assessed field rent (imittu). The dates should be delivered to the courtyard (haṣāru) at the branch (bābu) of Borsippa canal in one payment according to the 36 liters measure. Delivery date is not specified. B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), fibres (mangagu), a load of firewood (and) 1 darīku-container. Witnesses.
 
A1 = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; A2 = Bēlšunu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Sîn-imittu; B = Ahūšunu/Nergal-ibni//Ibnāya

elementText.text:
Promissory note for revenue from impost on land, to be delivered in dates.
B owes 30 kor of dates to A, revenue from the impost on land (imittu), to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII) to the courtyard (haṣāru). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give spathes (tuhallu), fibres (mangagu), spadices (gipû), a load of firewood, (and) 2 darīku-containers. He should pay for the habû uhinnu-tax. He has not received (eṭēru) any remuneration for his gardening work (šissinnu). There is the (still to be completed) settlement of accounts (epuš nikkassi) with the debtor concerning the imittu of the [xth year]. Included are the 5 kor of dates from the undivided assets (karû). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Bēl-ušallim/Bēl-ibni//Gallābu

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt.
Concerns 1/3 minas and 5 shekels of white silver of which 1/8 is alloy, which B owes to C. A, as proxy for the creditor, receives it from the debtor, according to what is stipulated in the promissory note that is with the creditor. As a result, A promptly returns this promissory note to the debtor.
Cf. BM 30790.
 
A = Kiribtu/Ahhē-iddin/Rab-banê; B = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi (=Širku/Iddināya//Egibi); C = Itti-Nabû-balāṭtu/Arad-Bēl

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Deposit.
A receives from B two different amounts of silver. The first one correponds to 2/3 mina and 4 shekels, which C entrusted to B as payment for A; then, he is also given 14 shekels of silver, as income (kaspu ša ēreb qātī). Altogether, A receives from B 58 (text: 57) shekels of silver. Witnesses
 
A = Bēl-ahu-ušabši/Etellu; B = Kalbāya/Ṣillāya//Nabāya; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver, payment of a debt secured by the pledge of a slave. Sale of slave and receipt of the purchase price by the creditor from the buyer.
Concerns 1 1/3 mina of silver, which B1 and his son B2 owe to A and for which their slave C was taken as pledge. A receives the whole amount of silver from D, who bought the slave (from the debtors). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-tabni-uṣur/Rēmūtu//Rē’i; B1 = Ea-kaṣir/Šamaš-erība//Šangû-Ea: B2 = Ea-ibni/Ea-kaṣir// Šangû-Ea, son of B1; C = Nabû-rēmu-šukun, slave of B1 and B2; D = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver.
Concerns 1/2 mina and 3 shekels of silver, the residual amount of the 1 mina that was due from C1 and C2 as recorded in a promissory note. A receives the silver from B (C1’s son). A has promptly given back to C1 and C2 the promissory note concerning the 2 mina of silver that were due from them. Witnesses
 
A = Nādin/Kullum-kī-Apladdu; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C1 = Bānûnu(/Ṣillaya//Rab-banê); C2 = Nabû-ahhē-iddin(/Šulaya//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Receipt for onions. Partial payment.
A1 and A2 receive 865 bundles (pītu) of onions on D's orders from B, slave of C. It is part of a claim that D holds against C. Names of 3 witnesses (introduced by ina ušuzzi).
 
A1 = Madān-šumu-iddin; A2 = Nabû-ušallim; B = Nabû-la-dāri, slave of C; C = Mukīn-Marduk; D = Iddin-Marduk

elementText.text:
Receipt of payment for interest, paid in silver.
A receives silver from B, paid for the interest on a debt that the latter owes to him.  The promissory note (u'iltu) that was with A has been given to C. Names of 1 witness and the scribe.
 
A = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Arad-Nabû//Bēl-ēṭiru; B  = Uballisu-Gula/Šumu-uṣur//Arad-Nergal; C = Nabû-šumu-ukīn/Bēl-ibni//…

elementText.text:
Security for debt. Payment due from the head of the Egibi family. Interest and pledge.
B owes 10 1/2 minas and 5 shekels of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy to A. The present document stipulates that from Addar (XII) onwards a yearly interest of 20% should be paid on a monthly basis. We learn that this debt, together with one of (adi) 3 2/3 minas and 5 shekels of silver, are what remains (rīhtu) to be paid (u'iltu) to A for the onions that he sold (mahāru) to B. It concerns the onions of Darius' 11th year, for which probably compare BM30721 (=Dar 315). The debtor's acreage (zēru) in Bīt-Hahhuru, located next to C, is pledged till the full repayment of the capital sum and its interest. Names of 11 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šaddinnu/Madān-ahhē-iddin//Šigûa; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C=Arad-Marduk/Nergal-zēru-ibni

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver and onions.
B should pay 15 shekels of marked silver of the kind commonly used for purchases and sales (nadānu u mahāru) and 15 bundles of onions that are due from him, to A in Nisan (I). He does not have to pay interest (ina qaqqadi) on the silver. Related to the archive of the Egibi family on prosopographical reasons (cf. BM 30838 [=Dar 318]). Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Marduk-bēlšunu/Arad-Marduk//Šangû-Ea; B=Iddinnaya/Arad-Bēl
