elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay a debt of silver to a courtier. Due from the head of the Egibi family. Pledge of slaves and land.
B, whose second name is Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi should pay 45 minas of medium quality silver, of which 1/8 is alloy, that are due from him, to A, a courtier (ša rēš šarri). Payment will be in Simān (III) in Babylon. He does not have to pay interest (ina qaqqadi). Pledged to A (maškanu) are a family of 8 slaves (ameluttu), people belonging to the debtor's household (nīšū bīti): C1, fC2, his wife; C3, C4, C5, C6, his sons; fC7 and fC8, his daughters; and all (gabbu) his fields planted with trees (zēru zaqpu) and grain (pî šulpi) in Šuppātu located next to D1 and D2. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over these until A has received full repayment of his silver. The pledged property will belong to the creditor should the debtor fail to meet the deadline. Names of 14 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Šarru-dūrī/Idrā, (ša rēš šarri); B=Širik, alias Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Iddinaya//Egibi
C1=Madān-bēlu-uṣur, slave of B; fC2=fNanāya-bēlu-uṣur, wife of C1 (slave); C3=Zababa-iddin, son of C1 (slave); C4=Madān-iddin, son of C1 (slave); C5=Bēl-gabbi-Bēlumma, son of C1 (slave); C6=Ahūšunu, son of C1 (slave); fC7=fHašdayītu, daughter of C1 (slave); fC8=fAhāssunu, daughter of C1 (slave); D1=Nabû-nāṣir/Itti-Nabû-lummir//Basia; D2=Nidintu/Marduk-erība//Egibi

elementText.text:
Undertaking to bring along a baker to the head of the Egibi family. Very fragmentary.
The tablet's obverse side and the beginning of its reverse are too fragmentary to understand what the text is about. The part that is better preserved cites the words that were spoken by someone whom we identify as A ("I will bring", abāku), and continues by stipulating that in case he fails to bring along the baker(s) (mubannû) and deliver him to B**, he should give him two other men instead (C1 and C2), as had been agreed in a previous document (šaṭaru). Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

** kī lúM[U ...] la [itab]akkamma ana PN [la ittadin]

A=...-Marduk?; B=Marduk-nāṣir-apli (=?Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C1=Iqīša?-Marduk; C2=Nabû-zēru-ibni/Aššur-abu-uṣur

elementText.text:
Sale of a boat. Warranty by the head of the Egibi family.
A sells his boat to B for 8 minas of white, medium quality silver of which 1/8 is alloy. A third party (C) assumes warranty for the uškûtu of the boat. Nothing is said about the receipt of the purchase price. The boat is new and 7 cubīts wide at its beam (šaburru). Names of 7 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Nabû-zeru-ibni/Itti-Nabû-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Marduk-iqīšanni/Marduk-šumu-uṣur//...; C=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment by the head of the Egibi family.
A receives payment (mahāru) from B1 for the ilku-tax till the end of Addar (XII) of the 25th year of Darius, that is due from him, his brother (B2) and two other persons (B3 and B4). The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe.

A=Širiktu/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B1=Aplaya/Bazūzu//Ašlāku; B2=Iddin-Nabû/Bazūzu//Ašlāku; B3= ...-Nabû/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu; B4=Šumu-ukin/Bēl-ēṭir

B should completely pay off (gamāru-eṭēru* D) the 8.2.3 kor of dates that are due from him to A in Ayyar (II). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe

*Wr. uṭ-ṭar-ar

A=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B=Kīnaya/Atkal-Šamaš?//PN

elementText.text:
Receipt of the miksu-toll from the head of the Egibi family.
A receives (mahāru) toll (miksu) from B for a boat loaded with onions (from the harvest) of the 10th year. Names of 9 persons (i.e., 8 witnesses and the scribe, uncl.).

A=Nergal-ušallim/Arrabi; B=Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi)

elementText.text:
Receipt of an ilku-payment (and)? the advance payment on the bow-tax (pānāt qašti) by the head of the Egibi family. Paid on behalf of a third party.
A receives payment (eṭēru) from B for the account of (ana muhhi) C, his brother, for the ilku-tax till the end of Addar (XII) of Darius’ 26th year that is due from the latter and lúṭi-pi-ni-šú*. A short remark at the very end of the obverse, before the witness list, states that he (also?)** receives (eṭēru) an advance payment on the bow-tax (panāt qašti). The exact amounts that are paid are not specified. The parties to the contract have taken one copy of the document each. Names of 6 witnesses and the scribe.

*ṭi-pi-ni-šú probably refers to C's additional men. (cf. BM30589)
**The verb of receipt (ēṭir) occurs twice: once with ilku ša C (ll. 1-6) and once with pānāt qašti (l. 7) as direct object. These could be seen as two different taxes or service obligations, or the latter could be a specification of the more general ilku.

A = Širku/Iddinaya//Egibi (=Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); B = Nabû-ittannu/Bānia//Itinnu; C = Rēmūt-Bēl/Bānia//Itinnu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for dates and silver. Pledge renewal.
B owes 22;0.0.0 kor of dates and 6 shekels of silver to A, to be delivered in one payment on the 10th of Ṭebēt (X). Delivery is due on the creditor's plot of land (or: house) (bītu) in Šahrinu. In addition, there are earlier promissory notes. The debtor's field (eqlu) in Bīt-ṭāb-Bēl and house at the Borsippa canal which were pledged to the creditor (maškānu ṣabātu), remain pledged. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Nabû-mušētiq-uddê//Sagdidi (sag.di.ti).

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Marduk-nāṣir/Šamaš-ahu-iddin

elementText.text:
Promissory note for onions. Payment for harbor costs. Fragmentary.
B owes x+1500 strings (gidlu) of onions to A, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri). The onions are "of the royal harbor" (ša kāri ša šarri), meaning that they are part of a onion transport by boat and the costs related to such transports. The rest of the tablet is broken off.
Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-šumu-līšir/Mušēzib-Nabû/Nabû-šeme.

A = Gimillu/Šamaš-zēru-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, royal harbor master (rab kāri ša šarri); B = Nergal-ušallim/Zērutu//Dābibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Payment in dates. Renewal of (general) pledge.
B owes 30 shekels of silver to A, to be paid in Arahsamna (VIII) in the form of dates, calculated at the market price of Šahrinu. The dates should be delivered in one instalment by boat(s) at the Borsippa canal. All of the debtor's property in and outside the city that were already pledged to the creditor, including his sluice gates (bābu), remain pledged. In addition, there are earlier promissory notes for silver, barley, dates and onions. The (indebted) silver is what has been paid for the rikis qabli of Dûzu (IV) of Nabonidus' 9th year. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-uballiṭ/Šāpik-zēri//Ile’’i Marduk.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Itti-Nabû-balāṭu/Zēria

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B = Nabû-edu-uṣur/Rahiannu

elementText.text:

B1, his brother (B2) and his wife (fB3) owe 10 minas of medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to fA, to be paid in ... [the name of the month is broken off], without interest. Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-ušallim/Sîn-karābī-išme(?).

fA = fEsagila-rāmat/Zēria//Nabāya; B1 = Kidin-Marduk/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; B2 = Nabû-mušētiq-uddê/Zēria//Šangû-Gula; fB3 = fBu’ītu, wife of B1

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes 6 minas of silver to A, to be paid at the end of the month (namely, on the 30th of Nisan [I]). He will start paying a yearly interest of 20%, if he fails to meet the deadline. C acts as guarantor for the payment. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Nabû-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi.

A = Kīnāya/Erpetu(?); B = Ibnāya/Nādinu//Kisua; C = Kalbāya/Iddin-Marduk//Buratu

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver and barley without interest. Pledge of land.
B1 and B2 owe 1 mina and 36 shekels of silver and 180;0.0.0 kor of barley without interest to A. The silver should be paid in Addar (XII) and the barley in Ayyār (II), in Ālu-ša-Ah-iddin. The (indebted) silver is the price that was paid for the purchase of onion seeds in Neriglissar's 1st and 2nd year. The debtors' onion field (šikittu) is pledged to the creditor. The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Šumu-iddin/Aplāya//Šumu-libši.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Iqīšāya/Bēl-kāṣir//Šangû-parakki; B2 = Marduk-erība/Nādinu

elementText.text:

B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 10 shekels of silver and 20 kor of dates to A, to be delivered in Arahsamna (VIII). The two debtors assume warranty for each other. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Bēl-iddin/Bēl-upahhir//Dābibi. The first witness is the debtor's son.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Ardia/Bēl-iddin//Rē’û; fB2 = fKassiri, wife of Ardia/Bēl-iddin//Rē’û

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Interest at default.
B owes 2 1/2 minas of white, medium quality silver, of which one-eighth is alloy to A1 and A2, to be paid without interest in Ayyār (II) of Darius' 17th year. Delivery is due in Babylon. The debtor will start paying the yearly 20% interest on a monthly basis, if he fails to meet the deadline. The interest rate is partly brok pay 1(?) shekel of silver as interest on a monthly basis. Witnesses.

A1 = Bēl-x/Bēl-iddin//Damqāya; A2 = Marduk-rēmanni/Sūqāya//…; B = Širku (aka Marduk-nāṣir-apli)/Iddināya//Egibi

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes 33 kor of dates to A and his brothers, the assessed field rent on land (imitti [eqli]) located at the Zabunu-ditch, next to C’s [plot of land]. He should deliver the dates in one nstalment according to the 36 liters measure to the courtyard (haṣāru). Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). He should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû) and fibres (mangagu), 2 darīku-containers and 1 load of firewood. In addition, there is an earlier claim (by the same creditor) against B which is still pending. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). Witnesses.
 
A1 = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; A2 = brother of A1; B = Nabû-iddin/Kīnāya;

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest, within the framework of a business partnership (harrānu)
B owes 12 shekels of silver to A1 and A2. It is silver that C invested in a business partnership (harrānu) and used for the purchase (šīmu) of a draught animal (a cow) (litti nīri) and its calf. In Addar (XII), he should pay the silver, with an alloy of one-eighth percent, (kaspa ša bitqa). He does not have to pay interest (qaqqadu). The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtor’s onion field (šikittu). Names of two witnesses and the scribe: Marduk-šumu-uṣur/Šamaš-šumu-ukīn/Sagdidi. 
 
A1 = Bēl-īpuš/Rāšil//Nappāhu; A2 = Madān-šumu-iddin/Zēria//Nabāya; B = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Nabû-šumu-ibni//Pahāru; C = Iddin-Marduk

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver without interest (nishu-loan). Pledge of house. Related to a past deposit of silver from a house sale.
B owes 6 minas of silver to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) in Addar (XII). The debtor's main house in which he is living is pledged to the creditor. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged house until the creditor has received the full repayment of the debt. The loaned silver originates from silver that had been put in a bag (himtu) and entrusted (paqādu) to B's father by the buyer of A's house in the past. On the same day that the present document is issued the chief officials (rabû) and the judges (dayyānu) authorized B to give the bag to A (apparently after B's father died) (cf. MNB1133 = TCL 12, 120). A subsequently lent from this silver to B for expenses (nishu). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Ile''i-Marduk/Bēl-upahhir//Eppeš-ilī.
 
A = Bēl-rēmanni/Mušēzib-Bēl//Ile''i-Marduk; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi, father of B

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of a house in antichresis. Fragmentary.
B owes 5/6 minas and 5 shekels of silver to A, servant of C. The debtor’s share in a house that is located next to D’s house is pledged to A in lieu of paying interest (antichretic pledge). Thus, the creditor should not pay house rent. This is followed by a fragmentarily preserved passage stating that "yearly […] Nisan […]". The document concludes by pointing out that no other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged house, until A has received the full repayment of his debt. Witnesses.
 
A = Bēl-rēṣūa, servant of C; B = Marduk-erība/Rēmūt//Miṣrāya(?); C = Neriglissar; D = Nabû-ahhē-iddin/Šulāya//Egibi

elementText.text:

(*) I.e. 8 shekels interest per 60 shekels of indebted silver.
 
A = Šulāya/Zēru-ukīn//Egibi; B = Nādin/Mušēzib; C = Mušēzib-Bēl

elementText.text:
Promissory note for assessed field rent (imittu), to be delivered in dates.
B owes x+2 kor of dates to A, the assessed field rent on land (imitti eqli) located at the Zabunu-ditch that extends till [broken off]. It is A's [x-]th share in the income to which he is entitled together with his brothers (C1 and C2). The dates should be delivered to the courtyard according to the 36 liters measure of the creditor. Delivery is due in Arahsamna (VIII). B should also deliver the usual by-products of the date cultivation: for each kor of dates he shall give a load of spathes (tuhallu), spadices (gipû), and fibres (mangagu), 1 darīku-container and 1 load of firewood. No payment has been received (eṭēru G Stat) for the gardener's remuneration (šissinnu). In Ayyār (II), he will deliver 1 kor of [broken off]. The document seems to end with an elat-clause but the passage is badly preserved. Witnesses.
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Bēl-iddin/[PN]; C1 = Nabû-ahhē-bulliṭ, brother of A; C2 = Nergal-ušēzib, brother of A

elementText.text:
Promissory note for pipes and barrels.                  
B owes 150 pipes (mušallû) of 1 royal cubit and 2 fingers in length(*) to A. By the end of Nisan (I) he should finish (gamāru G) and deliver them, together with the barrels (?). In addition, there is an earlier promissory note for 2 one-seah vessels (kupputtu) and 20 […. (broken off)] which is still pending. Witnesses.
(*) CAD M/1, 256 "of one-cubit (length) and two-fingers (width) according to the royal cubit)".
 
A = Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi; B = Arad-Nergal/Nabû-bān-ahi//Pahāru

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of persons (slaves?).
B owes 1 mina and 10 shekels of silver to A, to be paid without interest (qaqqadu) on the 1st of Simān (III), i.e. in another 17 days. The payment is secured by the pledge of two women (most likely slaves): fC1 and fC2, her daughter. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged persons until A has received the full repayment of his debt. Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; B = Iqīša/Egibi (sic!)//Rē'i-sisê; fC1 = fNanāya-kilīlu-uṣur (slave?! of B); fC2 = fTabluṭu, daughter of fC1.

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver. Pledge of house with antichresis.
B1 and his wife (fB2) owe 2 minas of silver to A, slave of C. The payment is secured by the pledge of the debtors’ house in the Hubur-street, next to the houses of D and E. According to the current document, the house will serve as antichretic pledge for the silver debt. Thus, the creditor should not pay rent for the house to the debtors because the rent meant to cover the interest which is fixed at 12 shekels of silver per mina on a yearly basis. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the debtors until A has received the full repayment of his debt, namely, 2 minas of silver. The two debtors assume warranty for each other and the one who has silver available at the due date will pay. The document concludes by poining out that debt has accrued interest since the 2nd of Arahsamna (VIII) (i.e., the previous day). Witnesses.

A = Nergal-rēṣūa, slave of C; B1 = Bēl-tutašlim/Andahar; fB2 = fŠini-banȃ/Ninlil-zēru-tabni, wife of B1; C = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; D = Nādin/Hanunu; E = [P]N/Nabû-ahhē-iddin/P[N].

elementText.text:
Promissory note to pay interest for goods deposited in a house.
fB, slave of A owes (ina pāni) 2 minas and 2 shekels of silver to A. It is the total amount that was given to her to purchase the following items: 1 mina of silver, the purchase price for 50 barrels of quality beer (šikaru ṭābu) as well as (adi) a bowl (haṣbātu); 2/3 minas of silver, the purchase price for 60 kor of dates; 1/3 mina and 2 shekels of silver, the purchase price for 2 bronze cooking vessels (mušahhinu) weighing 7 ½ minas of bronze, 7 bronze cups (kasu), 3 bronze dishes (baṭû), and 4 kor of mustard seeds (kasû). These items have been deposited in the house (šakānu). Till ([adi]) the end of Šabāṭ (XI) she has to pay interest (on the deposited goods). In addition, [5] beds, 10 chairs (kussû), 1 cooking vessel (mušahhinu), 1 wooden stand for a large vessel (šiddatu), 1 …. (ingurēnu), 3 razors (sirapu), 1 iron spade (marru parzilli), 1 axe (qulmu), 2 fermenting vat (namzītu), 1 …., 1 jug for fermenting (kankannu ša namzīti), 1 pair of tongs (for picking up coals) (maššānānu). Witnesses.
 
A = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; fB = fIshunnatu, slave of A

elementText.text:
Promissory note for silver with interest. General pledge.
B1, B2 and B3 owe 12 minas of silver with interest to A. The present document stipulates that from the 1st of Šabāṭ (XI) onwards (i.e., from now on) an interest of 20% should be paid on a monthly basis. The three debtors assume warranty for each other and pledge their entire property in and outside the city. No other creditor shall exercise any rights over the pledged objects until the creditor has received the full repayment of the capital amount and its interest. In addition, there is an earlier promissory note but at this point the document is broken off. Furthermore, another promissory note of B1 for 1 mina and 30 shekels of silver is mentioned [broken off] to be paid to/for [broken off] of the king. Names of 4 witnesses and the scribe: Aplāya/M-ušallimMarduk.

A = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšaya//Nūr-Sîn; B1 = Šumu-iddin/Zēria/Šangû-Gula; B2 = Nergal-uballiṭ/Tabnēa/X; B3 = Kidinnu/Zēria/Šangû-Gula

elementText.text:
Settlement of accounts. Division of income.
The beginning of the text is broken, only the name of A, brother of ... (name broken) is extant. He and his brother agree on the division of income from and expenses for their business with onions and barley in and outside the city (dullu šūmi u uṭṭati ša āli u ṣēri). B, his brother who is a royal soldier (ṣāb šarri), is entitled to a 1/3 share. Maintenance costs (kurummatu) are covered by their father’s estate (ultu bīt abi akālu). They received in total 3 PI-amounts? (uncl.) of food allowances (akālu n.) from their commonly held property (karû). They have taken an oath (nīšu zakāru) by the gods and by the king. Names of 2 witnesses (a.o. Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšaya//Nūr-Sîn) and the scribe.
 
A = Nabû-nāṣir/Nabû-ahhē-iddin; B = Ṣillā/Nabû-ahhē-iddin (ṣāb šarri), brother of A

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver
Concerns 1 mina of white silver of medium quality, of which 1/8 is alloy, which A receives in Šušan on C’s behalf (ana muhhi) from B. A shall enter the silver in the accounts of [C] in Babylon, and he will give proof of it to B (itti PN ušuzzu-nadānu). Names of 4+ witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Liqu-ilu-‘inni/Bulluṭu//Bā’iru; B = Širku/Iddināya//Egibi (= Marduk-nāṣir-apli/Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi); C = Itti-Bēl-limmir/Bazuzu//Šumu-libši

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver. Payment for a debt secured by antichretic pledge of a slave.  
B1 and fB2, his wife, owe 30 shekels of silver to fA2. In the present document, the creditor’s mother (fA1) receives repayment of this debt from the debtors. The debt was secured by the pledge of a slave (fC) which fB2, one of the debtors, received as security for her claim against D. We assume that this slave was released from pledge upon its repayment. Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe.
 
fA1 = fEtellitu/Marduk-šumu-ibni//Sîn-šadûnu, mother of fA2; fA2 = fIna-Esagila-bēlet/Nabû-ušallim//Irani; B1 = Nabû-mukīn-zēri/Ina-tēšê-eṭir/Ēṭiru; fB2 = Bunanītu/Na'id-Marduk/Ṣāhit-ginê, wife of B1; fC = fŠalam-dininni, slave of D; D = Nabû-tultabši-līšir/Bēl-zēru-ibni//Nappāhu

elementText.text:
Receipt for forced labourers.
A receives (mahāru) 2 forced labourers (urāšu) from B. They are to do the earthwork (dullu epiri) that C, B's son-in-law, is supposed to do (ša C) from Arahsamna (VIII) till the end of Nisan (I) of Nabonidus’ 13thsic?! year. The document is written on the 9th day of Arahsamna (VIII) of Nabonidus’ 12thsic?! year, which means that the labourers will start working only in another year time (unless there is an error in the copy, and they are to start immediately). Names of 3 witnesses and the scribe: Arad-Marduk/Kittia//Šangû-Ea.
 
A =…-ušallim/Apkallu//Mušēzib; B = Itti-Marduk-balāṭu/Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi; C = Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn

elementText.text:
Receipt for silver.
A receives 1 1/2 shekels of silver, including the 1 shekel of silver that belongs to C, from B. This does not include (elat) payment for his rations (kurummatu). Names of 2 witnesses and the scribe.
 
A = Nūr-Šamaš; B = Nergal-rēṣūa; C = Nabû-ayyalu
